loans.name: Valle Del Ensueño Group

texts.es:
La señora Amalia es de estado civil casada, tiene 40 años de edad, curso la primaria completa, tiene 5 hijos y 1 de ellos está estudiando, se dedica a atender su tienda de artículos de consumo dario, inició este negocio vendiendo solamente golosinas y a la fecha lleva 12 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de productos para su tienda como: pastas, gaseosas, azucar, embutidos, detergentes, etc. desea en el futuro tener una abarroteria. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio. En la fotografía aparecen 13 integrantes pero solo a 10 de ellas se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Amalia is married, 40 years old and has completed elementary school.  She has 5 children and one of them is studying.  She works in a store that sells items of daily use.  She started this business selling only candies and now has 12 years of experience.  She has the support of her husband, who is a salesperson.

A group has been put together, and requests a loan that will be used to buy products for her store like: pastas, sodas, sugar, lunchmeat, detergents, etc.  She would like to have a grocery store in the future.  The rest of the members of the group work in sales.  13 members appear in the photograph, but only 10 would use the loan.

loans.use: to buy items of daily use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Yussuf

texts.en:
Yussuf is a married man; he lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Yussuf operates a charcoal business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in his business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nurjamal

texts.ru: Нуржамал, 38 лет, вдова, имеет 3 сыновей. После смерти мужа, кормильца семьи в поиске доходов для своей семьи Нуржамал стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Бизнес начала с 10 000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Нуржамал достигла небольших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10 000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Нуржамал имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 22 овцы, 8 коз и 1 лошадь. Также в наличии имеет земельный надел 4,20 ГА на обработку и посадку фасоли. По хозяйству помогают 2 сына. Самый старший сын находится в России, на заработках. Помогает материально, высылая ежемесячно свою зарплату семье в Кыргызстан.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нуржамал обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50 000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений ГСМ и на культивацию земли. Доходы от кредита Нуржамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого хозяйства, а также в будущем планирует построить новый дом.
texts.en: Nurjamal is 38 years old, a widow and has three sons.  After the death of her husband, the family provider, Nurjamal became involved in farming and animal husbandry in search of a source of income for the family.  She started the business with 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her strenuous and capacious work, Nurjamal achieved small successes in developing the business and started to earn a monthly profit in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS).  Today, her business contains 2 dairy cows, 22 sheep, 8 goats and 1 horse.  She also has a land plot of 4.20 hectares, where she plants beans.  Her two sons help with the business.  The oldest son is working in Russia.  He helps financially by sending his salary to the family in Kyrgyzstan every month.  In order to further develop her business, Nurjamal requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel for treating the land.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her small business and also plans to build a new house in the future.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel for treating the land

loans.name: Fakhria

texts.en: Fakhria, who appears in the picture, is a 24-year-old single woman who lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is a hardworking woman. She is requesting a youth loan of 170,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to help cover the cost of purchasing home appliances and furniture. This loan will help her to live a comfortable life. She hopes to ensure a better future for herself and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing home appliances and furniture.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is the wife of a hard working electrician. She lives with her family in Lahore, Pakistan, and is the mother of five children, all of whom are at school. The family is poor and Parveen's husband is the only income earner, with a monthly income that is insufficient to meet their household expenses. 

Parveen's husband wants to purchase electronic parts such as diodes, cathodes, wires and panels for his work. Thus, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will not only help him to continue his work but will also increase his net income and savings as well. Parveen hopes that the loan will be very helpful for her husband's business, enabling him to work more professionally and efficiently. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase electronic parts such as diodes, cathodes, wires and panels for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Con el crédito que Sofía obtuvo el año pasado en Kiva compró fertilizantes, planta de café para renovar su finca y realizó labores de limpieza en su cafetal. También le fue posible ahorrar dinero de las ganancias que obtuvo en la cosecha porque tienen planeado ella y su esposo adquirir un nuevo terreno para poder producir más café en el futuro. Este año nuevamente necesita del financiamiento de Kiva para que pueda llevar a cabo sus planes de renovación de su finca, pues otra vez necesitará comprar más planta de café y fertilizantes como lo hizo el año pasado.
texts.en: With the loan that Sofia obtained last year from Kiva, she bought fertilizers and coffee plants and cleared land in order to revitalize her coffee farm.  Also, this made it possible for Sofia to save money from the earnings she obtained from the harvest, because she and her husband have plans to acquire a new piece of land so that they can produce more coffee in the future.  This year she is again asking for a Kiva loan so that she can carry out her plans to revitalize her farm.  Just as she did last year, she will buy more coffee plants and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizers

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es: La cosecha pasada Candelario renovó parte de su cultivo de café gracias a un crédito que obtuvo de Kiva. Con este crédito le fue posible comprar planta de café y fertilizante orgánico. Si todo sale conforme a lo planeado en un lapso de dos años él estará cosechando los primeros frutos de este trabajo que ha venido realizando. Para esta nueva cosecha Candelario quiere continuar renovando otras partes de su cafetal así como fertilizar lo que ya tiene sembrado. Para poder hacer todo esto necesita nuevamente de un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha que es cuando cuenta con más recursos.
texts.en:
During the past harvest, Candelario renewed part of his farm plants, thanks to a loan from Kiva.  With this loan it was possible to buy coffee plants and organic fertilizer.  If everything goes according to plan, in two years he will be harvesting the first fruits of his hard work he has been carrying out.  

For this new harvest, Candelario wants to continue renewing other parts of his coffee fields in this manner, by fertilizing what he has already planted.  To be able to do this he needs a new loan, which he will pay off at the end of the harvest, which is when he has the most resources.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to increase his production

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 58 years old and married with a child who is in school.

Felicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in Teshie and requested a GHS 900 loan through ID-Ghana to purchase additional retail stock to sell like toothbrushes, toothpaste, sardines, detergent, canned goods, milk and milo.

Felicia has borrowed and repaid two loans from ID-Ghana before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years. She is requesting the new loan to build her general store business.

Felicia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional retail stock to sell like sugar, detergent, canned goods, milk and milo.

loans.name: Seguras Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
Nelly es miembro del grupo Seguras Hacia el Futuro 
Nelly de 65 años se dedica a la elaboración de cerámica en frio, realiza toda clase de souvenirs para diferentes eventos, trabaja en su misma casa alrededor de 08 horas diarias. Nelly empezó este negocio hace 10 años, fue su hija quien le  enseño este trabajo, esto le ha permitido ser independiente y salir adelante, con el préstamo que ha solicitado podrá comprar materiales para cerámica y así continuar elaborando mas modelos de cerámica, mas adelante quiere sus hijas hereden el negocio y lo puedan expandir, con miras de exportar. Nelly está feliz por la oportunidad de obtener este préstamo, justo cuando más lo necesitaba y quiere darle gracias a todos los inversionistas que lo hacen posible y a EDAPROSPO por otorgarlo.
En la foto es la ultima de la izquierda, viste pantalón color fucsia.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the communal bank "Seguras Hacia el Futuro."

Nelly, 65, has a business making cold pressed ceramics.  She makes all types of souvenirs for different events.  She works in her home about 8 hours a day.  Nelly started this business 10 years ago; it was her daughter who taught her how to do this work.  This business has enabled her to become independent and to get ahead.  With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy ceramics supplies so that she can continue to make more ceramic models.  In the future, she wants her daughters to inherit the business and expand it, with the aim of moving into the export market.  Nelly is pleased with this opportunity to obtain a loan just when she needs it the most, and she wants to give thanks to all of the lenders who are making it possible, and to EDAPROSPO for granting it to her.

In the photo, she is on the far right, wearing fuchsia pants.

loans.use: to buy ceramics supplies

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret operates a business selling clothes from her home to her neighbors and passersby and even at the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and also competition from fellow sellers.

With the loan she is requesting, Margaret wants to purchase three bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the previous loan which helped her to boost her business and her family's living conditions as well.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa has been operating a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan of KES 40,000 she is requesting , she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo has operated a food stall business for the past 16 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the help.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon lives in the small village of Kobuleti district. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife, son and daughter. Solomon is, at the moment, unemployed. The sources of income for the family are the monthly salaries of Solomon’s wife, who works as a saleslady at the supermarket, and his son, who is a security guard. Solomon’s daughter is a student. The family managed to save enough money to purchase a car. As their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor, Solomon decided to serve the locals as a taxi driver with his own car but he needs money to pay the tax for it. His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program aims to provide business start-up and restart-up loans with more favorable conditions to rural poor people. They do not have access to standard credit, being regarded as 'high-risk borrowers' because of their low income. After the tax is paid, Solomon will start his business and the income of the family will increase. The family will also have enough income to use the usual sources of credit in the country, in case of need.

loans.use: to pay the tax for his car, so he will be able to use it to provide taxi services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, beans, potatoes and vegetables.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel of Molatuhan Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental is studying in her college in Misamis Occidental. To help her parents, she also got a part-time job in order to support her studies. Recently, she took out a loan from GDMPC to pay the school tuition fees. The poverty that her family been fighting is not a hindrance for her to continue her dream. In the future, she hopes to get a job in their town and if given a chance to explore outside the country, then she would.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha operates a food selling business, making dumplingsand flat bread for sale. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar to use in food preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar to use in food preparation.

loans.name: Fenny

texts.en:
Fenny operates a retail business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.  Fenny cites seasonality and the high cost of transportation of her goods as challenges to the business.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, beans and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to buy rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a hardworking woman who strives to make a living and support her family. She operates a cereal-selling business as her source of income.

She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase sacks of cereals, beans and green grains for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cereals, beans and green grains for sale.

loans.name: Mwanahalima

texts.en:
Mwanahalima is a widowed woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan of KES 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase eight bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase eight bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

For the past three months, she has operated a cosmetics shop business, selling on retail to her neighbors and passerby. In addition, she operates a clothing sales business, selling from home, which earns her other source of livelihood. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of cosmetics and more clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics and more clothes for resale

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 33 years old, a married man and a father of two kids. He is a worker who repairs cars. He has been in this field since his childhood, and he established his own business in 2005. He has good experience in this field and employs two people. He is well-known in the neighborhood, thanks to his affordable prices. He is a very talented person.

Ramil is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN in order to buy modern tools for his shop. Ramil believes that this loan will help him to work overtime in order to provide for all the needs of his family. He has a good loan history, and this is his third loan.

loans.use: to buy modern tools for his shop

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Гулчехра добродушная женщина в возрасте 42 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Гулчехра выросла в семье дехканина, её родители были бедны и не смогли дать ей хорошего образования. После окончания средней школы Гулчехра стала помогать своему отцу работать на поле. Этим самым они зарабатывали на пропитание. 

Сейчас, когда Гулчехра имеет свою семью, она желает, чтобы жизнь её детей была хорошего уровня. Поэтому Гулчехра занимается своим бизнесом, чтобы хорошо зарабатывать на жизнь и обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым. Вот уже как 16 лет она занимается купля продажей женской обуви. У неё хороший товарооборот и получаемая прибыль. Также её муж занимается деканством, выращиванием  зерновых культур и от этого бизнеса они также получают дополнительный доход в семейный бюджет. Для того, чтобы улучшить уровень и качество жизни, Гулчехра желает расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получать больше дохода. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит, чтобы закупить больше товара, а именно женской обуви для продажи. Она очень надеется на поддержку Арванд.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a good-natured woman of 42 years. She's married and has 3 children. Gulchehra was born into the family of a "dehkan" farmer; her parents were poor and weren't able to provide her with a good education. After graduation high school, Gulchehra helped her father work in the fields and provide for her family. 

Today, Gulchehra has her own family to take care of. She wants her children to have a good life. So for the past 16 years, Gulchehra has managed her own retail business, which focuses on buying and selling women's shoes. She's able to sell goods quickly, making her business profitable. Meanwhile, her husband works as a farmer, growing various grain crops, which significantly supplements their family budget. In order to improve their quality of life, Gulchehra wants to expand her business and gain more profit. Therefore, she approached Arvand with a request for a loan to buy more women's shoes for resale. She's hoping for your help.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes.

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан, 59 лет, замужем, имеет 1 сына. С 1988 года занимается пошивом национальных тошоков, а также шьет приданое на заказ девушкам на выданье. Бизнес очень хороший, а самое главное Токтокан с удовольствием занимается своей работой-шитьем, которое приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 20000 сом (KGS). Несмотря на понесенный ущерб бизнесу во время волнений в 2010 году, Токтокан смогла выстоять и дальше развить свою деятельность. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Токтокан обратилась в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 30 000 сом (KGS)  на покупку новой инновационной  швейной машинки. На доходы от кредита Токтокан хочет реконструировать дом.
texts.en: Toktokan is 59 years old, married and has one son.  Since 1988, she has been engaged in sewing the national quilts of Kyrgyzstan and also sews the dowry ordered by girls of marriageable age.  The business is very good, but most importantly, Toktokan loves her work and it brings in a monthly income of 20,000 KGS.  Despite the loss of business caused by riots in 2010, Toktokan was able to survive and further develop her business.  With the goal of further growth, Toktokan turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 KGS to buy a new, innovated sewing machine.  She wants to use the income from the loan to make home repairs.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and to make home repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es: Durante la cosecha pasada Ángel renovó su plantación de café y compró fertilizantes gracias a un crédito que obtuvo por parte de Kiva y el cual pagó al final de la cosecha. A él le pareció una gran opción trabajar con este crédito pues por ser socio de la “Unión Regional” no tuvo problemas para tramitarlo. Para la siguiente cosecha Ángel necesita comprar más fertilizante para su finca y también requiere hacer algunas labores de limpieza y para eso solicita nuevamente otro financiamiento a Kiva para poder alcanzar las metas que se ha propuesto.
texts.en: Duding the previous harvest, Ángel tended his coffee plantings and bought fertilizer with a Kiva loan, which he paid off after the harvest. He thinks working with Kiva partner Unión Regional to apply for a loan is a wonderful opportunity, as paperwork is not a problem. For the upcoming harvest, Ángel needs to buy more fertilizer and clear his land. He has applied for another Kiva loan so that he can achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and clear his land.

loans.name: Tiessiri  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe TIESSIRI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Diediela, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide et mil avec  DJENEBA TIECOURA ,  1ere debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1,25  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Sido,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 110.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the TIESSIRI 2 group are married women who are, on average, 39 years old with six children each. They all live in polygamous families in Diediela, one of the villages of the Bougouni commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Djeneba Tiecoura, a member of the group, grows groundnuts and millet. In the photo, she is in the standing row, first from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 1.25 hectare (3 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women in her village and in Sido.

She is expecting to make a profit of 110,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Tiessiri 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  TIESSIRI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Diediela, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
LA spéculation cultivée est l’arachide avec  FATOUMATA ,  2 eme debout de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  0.75  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Sido,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the TIESSIRI 3 group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old with five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Diediela, one of the villages of the Bougouni commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Fatoumata, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the standing row, second from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate 0.75 hectare (1.85 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women in her village and in Sido.

She is expecting to make a profit of 60,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Rita Lorena

texts.es: Doña Rita, es una señora que lucha sola para salir adelante en la vida, en vista de que sus 6 hijos ya son todos mayores de edad e independientes, ella como madre soltera hizo lo que pudo para darles de crecer a sus hijos, hoy en día continua con la venta de repostería que hace ella misma. Poco a poco ha venido mejorando su hogar. En esta ocasión solicita el crédito porque necesita hacer un cuarto, para cuando la visiten sus hijos se sientan cómodos y sobre todo, ella desea ver su casita bien arreglada en orden.
texts.en: Rita strives to get along in life alone, as her six children live independently. As a single mother, she did everything she could to raise her children. She still operates her bakery and makes the goods herself. She has slowly been renovating her house. She has applied for a loan because she needs to add a room where her children can be comfortable when they visit. Above all, she would like her small house to be in good condition.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, and blocks and to pay workers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has been operating a food stall business, selling foodstuffs such as maize flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Rodrique

texts.fr: Rodrique est un jeune camerounais âgé de 30 ans habitant en ville, marié avec  un enfant de 3 ans qui est à l'école primaire. Il a une expérience professionnelle de cinq (05) ans qui fait de lui un homme stable dans son activité. ce qui fait son succès c'est le nombre de sujets qu'il a (650) après 5 ans d'expérience vue son chiffre d'Affaires qui est de 1 625 000 Fcfa et une marge brute de 325 000 fcfa. Actuellement il est a son premier Crédit. Ce crédit va permettre la croissance de son activité à environ 8% et augmenter ses conditions de vie.
texts.en: Rodrique is a young Cameroonian aged 30, living in town, married with a child of three who is in primary school. He has five years of professional experience, making him a stable poultry raiser. His success is shown in the number of birds he is raising (650) after five years of experience and his turnover which is 1,625,000 F CFA and a gross margin of 325,000 F CFA. Presently, he is taking out his first loan. This loan will allow him to grow his business by about 8% and raise his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy new chicks

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es: Isaac cuenta con un terreno desde hace tiempo sin embargo no podía hacerlo producir café ya que no contaba con el recurso para sembrarlo. El año pasado obtuvo un crédito por parte de Kiva que le ayudo a invertir en planta de café y fertilizante para su terreno. Para que esta planta que sembró comience a dar frutos necesitan pasar al menos dos años más y requieren de cuidados. Isaac nuevamente solicita un crédito de Kiva para poder comprar nuevamente fertilizantes los cuales aplicará en sus fincas. Isaac pagará este nuevo crédito al final de la cosecha.
texts.en: Though Isaac has owned land for some time, he has not been able to produce coffee because he did not have the resources to plant. Last year he received a Kiva loan to invest in coffee plantings and fertilizer for his land. The plantings will not bear fruit for another two years, and they need to be tended. Isaac has applied for another Kiva loan to buy fertilizer for his land. Isaac will pay the loan after the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his land.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 35 years old, single, and has one child who attends preschool. She operates a cosmetics sales business, which she has been doing for 15 years. 

Sylvia is requesting her fourth loan from ID Ghana for 1,000 GHS, which she will use to purchase body lotion, hair lotion, and shampoo. Her business is the only source of income that she has for herself and her daughter. She wants to improve the quality of service and for her customers to recommend her to other people.

loans.use: to purchase body lotion, hair lotion, and shampoo.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф усердный и предприимчивый человек в возрасте 52-х лет. У него жена и трое сыновей, с которыми он проживает в городе Куляб. Шариф вместе с сыновьями собирается открыть интернет кафе в своем городе. Он уже выбрал удачное место для бизнеса. По словам Шарифа его один сын работает в букмекерской конторе, куда постоянно приходят много клиентов для того чтобы делать ставки, и он получил разрешение у руководства брать в аренду уголок конторы для открытия там интернет кафе. Теперь чтобы начать работу в интернет кафе, им необходимо приобрести компьютеры. С такой целью Шариф обратился за кредитом. На сумму кредита он хочет купить 4 компьютеров. В интернет кафе в основном будут работать его сыновья, а Шариф будет руководить ими. Шариф полагается на вашу помощь и поддержку для реализации своей цели.
texts.en: Sharif is an industrious and enterprising person, 52 years of age.  He's married and has three sons with whom he lives in the city of Kulob.  Sharif and his sons are preparing to open an internet cafe in their city.  They have already selected a good location for the business.  According to Sharif, one of his sons works at a bookmaker's office where clients are constantly coming to make bids and he received permission from the management to rent a corner of the office to open the cafe.  Now, to get started, they need to buy computers.  With this goal, Sharif is taking out a loan to buy four of them.  It is mostly his sons that will work in cafe, and Sharif will manage them.  He relies on your help and support to make this happen.

loans.use: to buy computers with the goal of opening and internet cafe

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Agus, 52, is a school teacher with a small income. He is married to Henderina, a 50-year-old housewife. They have six children, whose ages are between 20 and 8 years old. Of the six children, four of them are still attending school. 

At the moment, one of Agus' children is going to enter university and needs more money. On the other hand, the other children are moving to the next grade and also need additional money to provide their school items, due to the new school year. 

This condition leads Agus to ask for a loan from Tanaoba Lais Manekat (TLM), amounting to IDR 5,000,000. Agus will then utilize that loan to cover the children’s school fees. 

Agus is hoping that the loan provided by TLM will assist him in providing a better future for his children.

loans.use: to cover the children’s school fees.

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es:
Policarpio  se dedica a la cria de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) El vive con su esposa y sus hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de CHIARUYO, del Sector LAJA de La provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz a tres horas  de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  varias cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector

Requiere crédito para comprar alimento suplementario, asi podrá mejorar la nutrición de su ganado y su producción lechera por las siguientes características de la cascarilla de SOYA, es un subproducto del procesamiento industrial de soya y muy voluminoso.
Tiene un alto contenido de carbohidratos (75%) y azúcares solubles (2%).
En el altiplano existe déficit en la disponibilidad de proteína, principalmente en la época de estiaje (meses de junio a noviembre), razón por el cual es importante suplementar con cascarilla de soya como fuente de proteína para el ganado.
Con la compra de alimentos suplementarios se mitiga en la presión de ampliar más áreas de producción de forrajes

El sueño de Policarpio es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera    vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Policarpio raises cattle to produce milk that he sells to Pil Andina (an industrial milk plant). He lives in his own house with his wife and their children in the community of Chiaruyo, in the Laja district of Los Andes province in the department of La Paz. This is 3 hours from the city of La Paz. Poliarpio has a number of head of an improved breed of cattle who need a lot of care, given the area's weather conditions. 

Policarpio needs a loan to buy supplementary feed. This way, he can improve the nutritional status of his cows and their milk production. This feed contains soy husks, a by-product of industrial soy production which is very bulky. It has a high carbohydrate content (75%) and soluble sugars (2%). In the highlands, there is a shortage of available protein, mainly during the dry season (from June through November). This is why it is important to supplement the feed with soybean husks, which provide protein for the cattle.  

By purchasing supplementary feed, it mitigates the pressure to expand more land into fodder areas.  

Policarpio's dream is to increase his herd of cattle, while maintaining their good health.

This is the third time that he has requested a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy supplemental feed for his cattle

loans.name: Klara

texts.ru: Клара 46-летняя замужняя женщина, проживающая с мужем и детьми в городе Турсунзаде. Вот уже 4 года как она занимается растениеводством. Клара имеет участок орошаемой земли, где в основном выращивает пшеницу, рис и помидоры. Ей в деятельности помогает муж. Прибыль с продажи урожая является единственным источником их семейного дохода. Клара с одной части земли  уже собрала урожай пшеницы и теперь намерена посеять там рис и помидор. С этой целью она запрашивает кредит. Клара на половину суммы кредита хочет купить семена помидора, риса, а остальную часть кредита отдать за оплату тракториста и наемных рабочих. Данный кредит поможет Кларе продолжить свою земледельческую деятельность. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Klara is 46 years old, married and lives with her husband and children in the city of Tursun-Zoda.  She has worked in agriculture for the last four years.  Klara has a a plot of irrigated land where she mostly grows wheat rice and tomatoes.  Her husband helps her with the business.  The profits from the sale of her harvest is the only source of income for the family.  Klara has already harvested a crop of grains from one plot of land and wants to plant rice and tomatoes.  With this goal, she is taking out a loan.  She will use half of the money to buy tomato and rice seeds, and with the rest she will pay for the necessary workers to help.  This loan will help Klara continue her agriculture business.  She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy tomato and rice seeds and to pay for a tractor and other workers to continue her agriculture business

loans.name: Eliodoro

texts.es:
Eliodoro es un hombre mayor, viudo, vive solo en la zona de Las Nieves de la ciudad de La Paz. El señor es transportista público y se dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día. 

Eliodoro necesita el crédito para transformar su vehículo de motor a gasolina a motor a gas. Esto reduciría sus costos de transporte y al mismo tiempo ayuda al medio ambiente por que produce menos contaminación de CO2.

El sueño de Eliodoro es poder vivir tranquilo junto a su hijo y sus nietos.
texts.en:
Eliodoro is an older man who is a widower and lives in the area of Las Nieves in the city of La Paz.  He works in public transportation where he spends around ten hours a day.

Eliodoro is in need of a loan to convert his gasoline engine to natural gas.  This will reduce transport costs and benefit the environment by producing less CO2 pollution.

Eliodoro's goal is to live quietly with his son and grandchildren.

loans.use: To convert his vehicle engine to natural gas.

loans.name: Tiessiri 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   TIESSIRI 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  37 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Diediela, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide et mil avec MOUSSOKOURA,  2 eme assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1,25  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Sido,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 120.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called TIESSIRI 1 are married women with an average age of 37 and on average 6 children, all living in polygamous families in Diediela, one of the villages of Bougouni, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural pursuits during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, the prior loans being correctly reimbursed. 

The crops cultivated by Moussokoura, the second person seated, left to right, in the photo, are peanuts and millet. With her loan she is planning to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing in order to cultivate 1.25 hectares. Her produce is sold in the village, in Sido, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 120,000 F CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and pay plowing costs for the growing season.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has three school-going children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a food vending business, selling at the market to town dwellers and passersby, and she cites seasonality and high rate of perishability to be her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase cooking  oil, rice, beans and wheat flour for food preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking  oil, rice, beans and wheat flour for food preparation.

loans.name: Benkola 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkola 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Djerila, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz et l’arachide  avec KADIA  debout 2 eme  de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Bougouni,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 135.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkola 1 group are married women who are, on average, 41 years old with five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Djerila, one of the villages of the Bougouni commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Kadia, a member of the group, grows groundnuts and rice. In the photo, she is in the standing row, second from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women in her village and in Bougouni.

She is expecting to make a profit of 135,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: Con el crédito que Agueda obtuvo el año pasado en Kiva compró fertilizantes, planta de café para renovar su finca y realizó labores de limpieza en su cafetal. También le fue posible ahorrar dinero de las ganancias que obtuvo en la cosecha porque tienen planeado ella y su esposo adquirir un nuevo terreno para poder producir más café en el futuro. Este año nuevamente necesita del financiamiento de Kiva para que pueda llevar a cabo sus planes de renovación de su finca, pues otra vez necesitará comprar más planta de café y fertilizantes como lo hizo el año pasado.
texts.en:
Agueda bought fertilizer and coffee plantings and paid workers to clear her land with her previous Kiva loan. She was able to save with the profits she earned from the harvest. She and her husband planned to buy another plot so that they could produce more coffee.

This year she needs another Kiva loan so that she can realize improvements to her land; she needs to buy more coffee plants and fertilizer, as she did last year.

loans.use: to tend to her land.

loans.name: Shahzad

texts.en:
Shahzad is a 32-year-old man. He lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a gifts and cosmetics shop which is the only source of income for the family. He belongs to a middle class family. He wants to purchase show pieces, gifts, artificial flowers and perfumes. However due to the lack of funds, he finds it difficult.
 
Therefore Shahzad has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase products for his shop. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to increase his net income and savings. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase show pieces, gifts, artificial flowers, perfumes, time pieces

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es:
Pedro es un joven soltero de 19 años de edad vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en la Aldea Monte Mercedes, Aldea Sacsiguán Centro, Sololá, Sololá. 
El  actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes en el lugar de su vivienda, la cual es una fuente ingresos económicos para sus estudios y  familia. Inicio esta actividad hace 3  años, esta labor le ha permitido seguir estudiando y ahora se encuentra cursando el grado de Quinto Perito en Administración de Empresas. Cuenta que en la mañana atiende su tienda y por la tarde estudia esto lo hace con el fin de superarse y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  
El  ha observado que las ventas se han mantenido y que las ganancias son aceptables por lo que está solicita un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para comprar mas productos y ampliar su tienda de abarrotes de este modo el  puede brindarle una mejor variedad a sus clientes.
Su sueño es culminar su carrera y abrir otro local para poder generar más ingresos para seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Pedro, 19, is single and lives with his parents and siblings in beautiful Monte Mercedes in Sacsiguán Centro, Sololá. He operates a grocery shop in his house, which provides income for his education and for his family. He started his business three years ago, and the job lets him study. He is in the fifth year of the business administration program. He manages his store in the morning and studies in the afternoon so that he can be successful and improve his family's standard of living.  

Sales have been steady, and profits are adequate; therefore, he has applied for a loan of Q 3,000 to buy more inventory, expand his store, and offer his customers more variety. He dreams of finishing his degree and opening another shop so that he can earn more to further his education.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Kitebero Model Group

texts.en: Aidah is a 25-year-old widow from Kitebero, a suburb in Mbarara municipality. She dropped out of school and got married when she was young. However,her husband, who was the sole provider, passed away. Aidah, thereafter, started up a food stall in the market and that is how she takes care of her family of three children. This business grew and helped her to sustain her family. Her business further progressed with the help of Ugafode microfinance loans and this motivated her to mobilize her colleagues in the market to form a development group called Kitebero Model Group. She has requested ugx.2,000,000/= to buy more food stuffs for her stall that will meet the demand her her clients. They are all a hard working lot.

loans.use: To buy more food for her stall

loans.name: Suda

texts.en: Suda is a resident of Nyakihanga,rural Ntungamo. He is married to Hadija and they have 3 children. All the children go to primary school. This is the second time he is borrowing and he wants 1,500,000 UGX to invest in agriculture by applying manure to his banana plantation. Besides the plantation, Suda and his wife also deal in used clothes, and this has helped them take care of their family. In the photograph is the loan officer in a long sleeved shirt, Suda and his wife Hadija.

loans.use: To buy organic manure for his plantation.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim is 57 years old, a married man and father of four children. Rasim sells animals. He buys animals (baby cows) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. He has a good approach towards business expansion and savings for the future. He makes enough through his   business to contribute to the family income, but he   needs to improve his   business to meet the needs of his   children. 

For the improvement of his   business, he   applied for a loan of 2000 AZN to purchase two more cows. He is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, he will definitely expand his   business and income level. He has a good loan history and this is his fifth loan.

loans.use: to purchase two more cows

loans.name: Benkola 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkola 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  42 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Djerila, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide et le mil  avec   MINATA debout 3 eme  de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Bougouni,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 105.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkola 2 group are married women who are, on average, 42 years old with four children each. They all live in polygamous families in Djerila, one of the villages of the Bougouni commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Minata, a member of the group, grows groundnuts and millet. In the photo, she is in the standing row, third from the right.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in her village and in Bougouni.

She is expecting to make a profit of 105,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Benkola 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkola 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  43 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Djerila, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide et le mil  avec   FATOUMARA 1 ere assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Bougouni,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 105.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkola 3 group are married women who are, on average, 43 years old with five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Djerila, one of the villages of the Bougouni commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. 

They are on their fifth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Fatoumara, a member of the group, grows groundnuts and millet. In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the left.

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in her village and in Bougouni.

She is expecting to make a profit of 105,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Faqra Group

texts.en:
Jovita is the featured borrower of Faqra group. She joined with the other members of the group to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. The borrowers have been friends since they came to Lebanon from their hometowns in the Philippines, to work as housekeepers for the sake of developing their families’ lives and needs.

Jovita is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. Her husband is not employed, that's why she had to work hard in order to cover her family's needs. Her portion of the loan will be invested in covering her children living and educational expenses in the Philippines, because most of the housekeepers don't get their salary on monthly basis, but rather they get the money they have earned when they leave for home. 

That's why her loan will be sent to her children. 

Jovita is the one standing in the middle. Ermalyn is the one standing on the right side of the picture and Julie Ann is the one with the red shirt on the left.

loans.use: to send money to her children to cover their living and eductaional expenses

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Valle El Triunfo Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 8 mujeres emprendedoras  y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal “Emprendedoras del Valle el Triunfo”. Una de ellas es la Sra. Gumercinda de 43 años de edad soltera y madre de 3 hijos, la Sra. Gumercinda es una mujer muy emprendedora que debido  de sus esfuerzos a sabido superarse, la Sra. Gumercinda vende medicinas naturales en un pequeño local en su casa, el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia.Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar  productos naturales para su posterior venta y a si también poder  apoyar a sus hijos para que concluyan sus estudios. La Sra. Gumercinda  es la tercera persona de la mano izquierda se  le distingue camisa blanca y chompa   rosada a la vez  se encuentra muy agradecida por la ayuda brindada, se despide con un fuerte abraso sabiendo que cumplirá todas sus metas.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Emprendedoras del Valle el Triunfo” comprises eight enterprising, business-savvy women. Gumercinda, 43, belongs to the group and is the single mother of three children. She is an entrepreneur, who has worked hard to be successful. She sells natural medicines from a small area in her house. This is the only income she and her family have. She will use the loan to buy natural products to sell so that she can pay for her children's education.

Gumercinda appears third from the left in the photo and is wearing a white blouse and pink sweater. She is grateful for the funding and offers a big hug, knowing that she will meet all her goals.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines.

loans.name: Mutabazi Group

texts.fr:
Oscar fait partie du groupe  Mutabazi et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 37 ans et est marié à  Anastasie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants,  âgés de  4  à 11 ans.
  
Il fait le commerce de boutique (savon, sel, huile de palme,…) depuis 15  ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (savon, sel, huile de palme,…) à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir il voudrait que ses enfants  continuent les études et mènent joyeuse vie.
texts.en:
Oscar is part of a group called Mutabazi and lives in Rumonge. He is 37 and married to Anastasie, a farmer. Together they have four children, aged from 4 to 11 years. 
  
He has been running a general store selling soap, salt, palm oil, etc. for 15 years. He is on his second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan that he hopes to receive, he will grow his working capital and buy a large quantity of items for his store (soap, salt, palm oil, etc.) for resale so he can earn more. 

In the years to come, he would like to see his children continue their studies and lead joyful lives.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of soap, salt, palm oil, etc. to sell in his shop

loans.name: Alwan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Alwan, and it consists of four women who live in Hodiedh, Yemen. 

Khadiga is the leader of this group. She is 49 years old, married, and has three children. She has been selling incense, perfumes, and clothes. She works hard to improve her living conditions. She helps her family to meet their daily expenses. 

She applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy incense, perfumes, and clothes for her business. She hopes to open a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy incense, perfumes, and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Taslim

texts.en:
Taslim, 54, is a teacher. He lives with his wife Siti, 46, and their two children, Jumiati, 25, attending university and Fitri, 6, attending first grade of elementary school. Taslim is working in another village and lives separately from his family. In school holidays, Tasrin will have a chance to visit his family. 

His daughter is in her last semester and is now doing her research and could be invited to graduation afterward, but it requires much money. Taslim has to cover the expenditures but he has limited money, since his salary as a teacher is insufficient. So he applied for a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000 to pay for the cost of his daughter's research, thesis and graduation. He really hopes his daughter will have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of his child's research, thesis, and graduation

loans.name: Djiguisseme  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   DJIGUISSEME  1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Karakara, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec   FATOUMATA N’TJI  debout daba en main à l’extrême droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Bougouni,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the DJIGUISSEME 1 group are married women who are, on average, 38 years old with five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Karakara, one of the villages of the Bougouni commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their fifth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Fatoumata N'tji, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is standing, first from the left, and holding a daba (short-handled hoe).

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in her village and in Bougouni.

She is expecting to make a profit of 125,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi is a hard-working woman who strives to ensure her family is well cared for. She appreciates the support given by Yehu and Kiva in general. She is requesting another loan with Yehu, which she will use to buy more fish and cooking oil for her business to earn more income and meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of communication credits (phone minutes).

loans.name: Djiguisseme  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   DJIGUISSEME  2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  37 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Karakara, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec    MAIMOUNA,  2 eme assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Bougouni,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 120.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the DJIGUISSEME 2 group are married women who are, on average, 37 years old with five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Karakara, one of the villages of the Bougouni commune (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

They are on their fifth loan with the institution and have duly repaid their previous loans.

Maimouna, a member of the group, grows groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the front row, second from the right. 

She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing to cultivate one hectare (2.47 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in her village and in Bougouni.

She is expecting to make a profit of 120,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for plowing during the farming season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread, yarn, and colored rope.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Beatriz  sigue con la misma actividad de la elaboración y Venta de pan, galletas queques y variedad de repostería cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos como harina  para la elaboración de su repostería,    en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de un horno de mayor capacidad ya que se incrementaron sus pedidos  y su anterior horno le quedo pequeño, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Beatriz continues with the same activity: making and selling bread, cookies, cakes and varied pastries.  She relates that she did well with her previous loan since she used it to buy ingredients like flour to make her pastries.

On this occasion, she requests the loan to buy a larger capacity oven because her orders have increased and her current oven is too small.  She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity she’s being given to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy a larger capacity oven.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 24 years old. She sells tyres and wheels for both motorbike and bicycles. 

She is married to a mechanic and they have one child. 

With the the loan, she would like to buy more tyres and tubes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more bicycle tyres and tubes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a father of three children, aged between 2 and 12. His wife works as a farmer. He sells beans, and has spent 8 years in the business. With the loan, he would like to add more beans for sale at his stall in the market. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Venutse

texts.en: Venutse is 41 years old. He has been selling vegetables and fruit for the past three and half years. With the loan, he wants to add more fruits and vegetables in his store for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz, age 54, is a married and a dedicated mother of three children. She is efficiently running a donkey cart business with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. Donkey carts are used in the villages of Pakistan for carrying loads. Her husband runs the donkey cart as a transportation service and makes enough to meet the family's needs. Many years ago he started this business with a single cart. The donkeys help customers carry material from one place to another. 

In order to purchase another bigger wooden cart, Mumtaz contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000. In this way her husband will be able to load more things on his cart at once, like fruits and vegetables. This ultimately saves his time and hopefully will increase his net income. She expects a boost in their earnings and wishes to utilize the part of revenue on the betterment of her family members

loans.use: to purchase another bigger wooden cart.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transportation, which is a major challenge.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothing business, selling door-to-door to neighbors and passersby.  She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.  With the 50,000 KES loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase 4 bales of clothes for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania, de 37 años de edad, está casada con German de 39 años con quien tiene 2 hermosas hijas con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Tania consiste en la venta de cosméticos como talcos, perfumes, cremas faciales, accesorios femeninos y otros productos de acuerdo a la temporada. A diario sale en busca de sus clientes quienes en su mayoría son amigos, vecinos y familiares. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 14 años y siempre lo ha hecho sola. También tiene una vitrina exhibidora en su casa en donde coloca los productos que tiene en stock para vender a los clientes que llegan a su vivienda. Con el tiempo aprendió que para tener éxito en este tipo de trabajo tiene que salir en busca de los clientes usando técnicas de convencimiento para poder vender lo suficiente y obtener buenas ganancias. Espera seguir trabajando y tener mucho éxito en adelante, ahora tiene muchas ventas y eso significa que tiene mayores ingresos económicos que le ayudan a mejorar las condiciones de vida que quiere ofrecer a su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de S/.2000 soles comprará mercadería tales como perfumes, talcos, cremas faciales, entre otros.
texts.en:
Tania, 37, is married to German, 39, with whom she has two beautiful daughters she lives with in her own house.  Tania’s work consist in selling cosmetics like talk, perfume, face cream, women’s accessories and other seasonal products.  

She goes out daily seeking customers who for the most part are her friends, neighbors and family members.  She’s been doing this work for 14 years and has always worked alone.  She also has a display case at home where she sets up her products that she has in stock to sell to customers who come by her house.  

In time she learned that in order to be successful in this type of work she has to go out looking for customers using techniques that will convince them to buy enough in order to earn good profits.  She hopes to continue working and being very successful in future.  She has many sales now and this means her income is higher which helps her improve the living conditions she offers her family.  

On this occasion, she will request 2,000 soles.  She’s grateful and happy to know that she can continue relying on financial help to make business progress.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy merchandise like perfume, talc, face cream, etc.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Benkadi Viii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI VIII  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 7 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOMO un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec RAMATOU ,5 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 90.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi VIII Group are married women who average 45 years of age and seven children. They all live in polygamous families in Komo, a village in Baguineda, second administrative region of Mali.

The work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their fifth loan from the MFI, and previous loans were repaid without problems.

Ramatou (fifth women from the left in the standing row) is growing millet. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market in the village, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers. She intends to turn a profit of XOF 90'000 (ca US$ 180) per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare

loans.name: Anastaz

texts.en:
Anastaz is a 35-year-old man from the Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a top-up loan of 30,000 Rwandan francs (RWF) to purchase ten additional rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Anastaz started selling lights in October, 2012 and has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for ten low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.en:
Bruno is a young Cameroonian, married with two children. The first is in primary one and the younger is still breast-feeding. Bruno has been in this business for the past five years which makes him very experienced, stable and successful. He has an 80% likelihood of succeeding in this business.He has not gotten any loan other than this one.

Bruno's current turnover per month is 50,000 F CFA and this loan will increase his turnover to 95,000 F CFA per month and his profit as well will increase considerably.

loans.use: to pay for fowl (chicken) feed

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is a 42-year-old man from the small village of Gurjaani district, East Georgia.  He lives with his wife and 14-year-old son, who goes to the local school.  Zurab requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times, for a family business start-up, without success.  His loan request was always rejected because of the family’s low income and poor living conditions.
 
The only source of income is from agricultural activities.  In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land, where maize and strawberries are grown.  Zurab looks after and does all the agricultural work to ensure a good harvest.  The harvested products are sold at local markets at a good price.  It is hardly enough to feed the family, as the income is only seasonal.  According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zurab requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business.  Zurab has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people.  These individuals do not have access to credit products and are regarded as ‘high risk borrowers’ because of their low income.  With the received credit Zurab will purchase a minibus.  After the minibus is purchased he will begin trading with fruits and vegetables.  He plans to purchase fruits and vegetables from the wholesalers and then resell them at a higher price.  This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed by the loan, will give him a chance to have a regular income, thus significantly improving the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à NAGOUSSO, commune de moribila  cercle  de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4er prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  avec  KADIA,  1 ere femme  debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village à San et Kimparana, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 35.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women who, on average, are 35 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional families in Nagousso, in the Moribilia commune of the Cercle de San, in the fourth administrative region of Mali. The group is collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the instition and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Kadia, the first woman standing on the left in the photo, grows ground nuts. With this loan, she plans to buy farm inputs, seeds, some small farm equipment and to pay the cost of labor to maintain a quarter hectare. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the villages of San and Kimparana to men and women customers. 

Kadia hopes to earn 35,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay the cost of labor and to buy farm inputs, seeds, and small farm equipment

loans.name: Danaya  1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    DANAYA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide et le riz avec  YAMOU ,  1ere debout  de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 90.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
