texts.en: The members of the DANAYA 1 group are married women who are on average 40 years old, have six children, and live in polygamous families in Bladiè, a village in Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see through their agricultural businesses in the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution, and their previous loans were properly repaid. The grown crops are peanuts and rice with YAMOU, the first woman standing on the right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy ingredients and seeds and to pay for the labor to make use of one hectare. The crops are sold in the village in Garalo, after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She plans to earn 90,000 FCFA per crop. These earnings will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and seeds and to pay for labor pour for an agricultural crop

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es: Don Ernesto de 53 años de edad vive con su esposa y su suegra en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene 9 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía, don Ernesto tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ernesto, 53, lives with his wife and mother-in-law in his own house.  He works growing corn and sorghum.  He’s been working in agriculture nine years and has gained much experience that leads to his getting the best harvests.  He sells his crops around the community and has many customers that prefer him because of the quality, good prices and above all the good service.  

He needs to invest which is why he’s requesting a loan that will make it possible for him to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, fertilizer, manure, etc. as shown in the photo.  Ernesto has good payment references from his acquaintances.  He’s very responsible and is assures that he will be able to repay the loan as scheduled while at the same time trusts that he will bring economic security home.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es: Guido, de 48 años de edad, está casado con Narda y es padre de 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Guido se dedica a conducir su mototaxi, por está razón sale a las calles de la ciudad en su vehículo en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros a quienes transporta dentro y fuera de la ciudad con bastante serenidad y tranquilidad ya que considera que la seguridad de sus pasajeros es lo más importante, de la misma manera siempre brinda su numero de celular para que pueda ser contactado por algún cliente que necesita de su servicio de transporte. Lleva realizando esta labor hace 16 años , eventualmente trabaja como electricista o brindando servicio logístico a determinadas instituciones. Al principio no le fue muy bien, ahora afirma que esa situación a cambiado y sus ingresos económicos se han visto multiplicados gracias a las recomendaciones de sus clientes. Ahora espera continuar trabajando y más adelante implementarse con más unidades de mototaxi para empezar a alquilarlos y generar así más ingresos para su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.1500 soles y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado renovará el tapizado y algunos repuestos que su mototaxi necesita para que este en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Guido, 48, is married to Narda and is the father off three children that live with him in his own house.  Guido works driving a mototaxi; he heads out into the city streets looking for customers to transport inside and outside the city calmly and tranquilly because he feels that his passengers’ safety is most important.  In the same way, he always gives them his cell phone number so that any customer who might need his services can contact him.  

He’s been doing this work for 16 years and he also works as an electrician or providing logistic services to certain institutions occasionally.  At the beginning he didn’t do too well but he states that the situation has changed now and his income has multiplied thanks to recommendations from his customers.  

He hopes to continue working now and later on to acquire more mototaxis to start leasing them out and generating more family income.  On this occasion he will request 1,500 soles and he’s grateful for the financial support he gets to continue moving forward.  In addition, he commits to make his payments punctually.  He will use the amount requested to replace the upholstery and some spare parts his mototaxi needs so that it will be in optimal condition.

loans.use: to buy upholstery and spare parts for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Yusak

texts.en:
Yusak is a 53-year-old man who runs a kiosk business. He is married to Naomi, a weaver. Yusak has three children: Yanto, 28, is attending university; Jemri, 13, is attending third grade of elementary school; and Aplonia, 12, is attending second grade of elementary school. 

Yusak has been engaged in his business for six years. The business is the only source of income that Yusak and his family are depending on. Yusak’s business place resides precisely in front of a school building that allows him to get many customers. There are some goods that he provides in his kiosk, including stationery, snacks, and also daily basic needs. 

In this new academic year, the income from his kiosk business is spent to pay for his child's college fees. Therefore, he needs more capital to renew his kiosk stocks. He proposed a loan from Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation (TLM), amounting to IDR 5,000,000 to pay for kiosk stocks, such as biscuits, pencils, pens, books, instant noodles, coffee, and sugar.

loans.use: to pay for kiosk stocks, such as biscuits, pencils, pens, books, instant noodles, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Norlina

texts.en: Norlina is a 51-year-old widower.  She lives with her mother, Ribka (71), and a 19-year-old adopted son named Maklon.  Norlina is generating money for her family by working as a farmer.  After her husband died in 2003, she began managing the business by herself.  She plants mustard greens in a plot of land behind her house and then sells them to the traditional market after harvest.  She wanted to send her adopted son to a university but her money is insufficient to cover the costs.  Therefore, she is requesting a 7,500,000 IDR loan from TLM to pay for the university fees.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Ixlacuitzence No. 1 Group

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es soltera, tiene 30 años de edad, curso la primaria completa, tiene una tienda de artículos de consumo diario, inició este negocio con una minitienda y al momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con todo el apoyo de su familia.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para ampliar su negocio comprando mercadería como azucar, jabones, fideos, granos básicos, golosinas, aguas gaseosas, productos enlatados etc. desea en el futuro contar con una abarrotería. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio. En la fotografía aparecen 13 miembros de grupo, pero, solamente a 10 de ellos se le concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosa, 30, is single.  She completed primary school.  She has a store where she sells basic staples.  She started this business with a mini-store and to date has five years’ experience.  She has her entire family’s support.

She decided to organize a group in order to request a loan she’ll use to expand the business buying such merchandise as sugar, noodles, basic grains, snacks, soft-drinks, canned goods, etc.  She hopes in future to own a grocery store.

The other group members are merchants.  Thirteen members of the group appear in the photo but only ten of them were granted the loan.

loans.use: to buy basic staples for her store.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 31 years old. She has been selling flour and other foodstuffs for 12 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more flour for sale. Her husband works as a businessman and they have both four children, only two of whom go to school. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children’s school.

loans.use: To buy more flour to sell

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyawana est membre du groupe d’affaire « Bon berger», jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un commerçant de divers. La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme. Elle installe ses produits au marché public et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, Il y a environ 6 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 fûts d’huile de palme. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Nyawana is a member of the Bon Berger (“Good Shepherd”) business group. A young, experienced entrepreneur, she is 39 years old, married, and has eight children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a general trader. 

Nyawana sells palm oil. She sells her products at the public market and sometimes from home. She started her business around six years ago, using her own money received from her husband. 

Nyawana will use this new loan to buy two drums of palm oil. In this way, she would like to increase her capital and feed her children. 

Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for providing support to small-scale entrepreneurs through microcredit.

loans.use: to buy two drums of palm oil.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 53 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years.

Shirly requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional feed for her pigs. She has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her business activity. In the future, Shirly would like to save money to expand her business.

She belongs to the third sex society (transgender).

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has eight children, all of whom graduated from school. For years, she has operated a food business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, yeast, and sugar for the preparation of the food. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Her family lives in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, yeast, and sugar

loans.name: Nomi

texts.en:
Nomi is a 29-year-old married woman.  She has been manufacturing buckles for the past four years, which are used to embellish shoes.  She beautifully makes buckles at home and then sells them in the local market.  By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.  Her husband also works in a factory but earns an insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide for her family.  To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase stocks of threads, bundles of leather, sequins, and pearls of various colors.  She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales.  She is in her third loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior.  She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make buckles.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina, age 47, deals in the business of caring for cows and milk sales. Some years ago, she started her own business to contribute to the family income, as her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. With the passage of time, she has become famous in her community for selling good-quality milk. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings, and she applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to help her purchase another cow. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Benkadi 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à NAGOUSSO, commune  cercle de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4er prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est l’arachide  Mme  SOUTOURA,  4 eme femme  debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à San et Kimparana, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 25.000 FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 4 group are married women who, on average, are 36 years old and have three children. They live in traditional families in Nagousso, in the commune of Cercle de San, in the fourth administrative region of Mali. The group is collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their work during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Soutoura, who is the fourth woman standing from the left in the photo, grows groundnuts. With this loan she plans to buy farm inputs, seeds, small farm equipment and to pay the costs of labor to maintain a quarter hectare of land. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the villages of San and Kimparana to men and women customers. She hopes to earn 25,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with the everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay the costs of labor and to buy farm inputs, seeds, and small farm equipment

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à NAGOUSSO, commune de moribila  cercle  de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide  Mme  SALI,  1 ere  femme  debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et à San et Kimparana, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 75.500 FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 5 group are married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have four children. They live in traditional families in Nagousso, in the commune of Cercle de San, in the fourth administrative region of Mali. 

The group is collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their work during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly. 

Sali, the first woman standing on the left in the photo, grows groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to buy farm inputs, seeds, small farm equipment and to pay the cost of labor to maintain a quarter hectare of land. After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the villages of San and Kimparana to men and women customers.

Sali hopes to earn  75,500 francs CFA after the season. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband in the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay the cost of labor and to buy farm inputs, seeds, and small farm equipment

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman is a 35-year-old married man and father of 4 children. Last year he changed his business and now he is selling food products in his own store. He is satisfied with his business. Elman is a popular merchant in his home town because his shop is situated in the center. From this business his profit is 400 Azerbaijanian Manats (AZN) monthly.

He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop. His son also helps him in this business.

The profit he gains is not enough to reinvest it his business and to cover customer demand, so he is suffering for this reason. His being the main source of income, his profit is used for the family's needs. Elman would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for 2000 AZN. He will purchase and diversify additional foodstuffs. This will be his fourth loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Dolly's Trip Group

texts.en:
Dolly's trip is a group composed of four Filipino ladies, who work as housekeepers for Lebanese families. They decided to join hands and form the group, in order to support each other financially by acquiring the group loan from Al Majmoua.

Salvacion is the leader and featured member of the group. She is a 38-year-old, married mother of four children, standing second to the left of the picture. Her husband is unemployed, which means that she is the only financial provider of the family. However, her income is barely sufficient to provide for one individual. Therefore, she joined the group to acquire a loan. She will use her share of the loan to settle the school tuition fees of her children, who are enrolled in a private school.

As for the other group members, Rowena Starlet is standing on the far right of the picture, Gessille Jean is standing second to the right of the picture, and Dioliza is standing on the far left of the picture.

loans.use: to settle the school tuition fees of her children

loans.name: Danaya 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    DANAYA 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide et le riz avec  SANATA GOMI ,  1ere   assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the DANAYA 2 group are married women who are on average 40 years old, have five children, and live in polygamous families in Bladiè, a village in Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see through their agricultural businesses in the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution, and their previous loans were properly repaid. The grown crops are peanuts and rice with SANATA GOMI, the first woman sitting on the right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy ingredients and seeds and to pay for the labor to make use of one hectare. The crops are sold in the village in Garalo, after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She plans to earn 100,000 FCFA per crop. These earnings will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and seeds and to pay for the labor for an agricultural crop

loans.name: Danaya 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    DANAYA 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le spéculation cultivée sont l’arachide avec   TENIN ,  1ere   debout  de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  0.50  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 30.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the DANAYA 3 group are married women who are on average 39 years old, have five children, and live in polygamous families in Bladiè, a village in Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see through their agricultural businesses in the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution, and their previous loans were properly repaid. The grown crops are peanuts with TENIN, the first woman standing on the right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy ingredients and seeds and to pay for the labor to make use of half a hectare. The crops are sold in the village in Garalo, after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She plans to earn 30,000 FCFA per crop. These earnings will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and seeds and to pay for the labor for an agricultural crop

loans.name: Danaya 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    DANAYA 4  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide et le riz avec   CHATA DIAKADIA ,  3 eme debout  de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1,25  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 115.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the DANAYA 4 group are married women who are on average 41 years old, have five children, and live in polygamous families in Bladiè, a village in Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see through their agricultural businesses in the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution, and their previous loans were properly repaid. The grown crops are rice with CHATA DIAKADIA, the third woman standing from the right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy ingredients and seeds and to pay for the labor to make use of 1.25 hectares. The crops are sold in the village in Garalo, after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She plans to earn 115,000 FCFA per crop. These earnings will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and seeds and to pay for the labor for agricultural farming

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Doña Elsa, es habitante del barrio Memorial Sandino, junto a su esposo busca como salir adelante, él como taxista y ella con su pequeña pulpería, ambos comparten gastos, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad e independientes. Ella solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio lo que le mantiene todos sus gastos principales del hogar. Comprara granos básicos, golosinas, enlatados, embutidos, huevos, cereales entre otros de la demanda de sus clientes, los vecinos del barrio.
texts.en:
Elsa is a resident of the neighborhood Memorial Sandino. She and her husband are looking to get ahead: he as a taxi driver and she with her small grocery store. Both of them share expenses. Her children are adults and are independent.

She is requesting a loan to be used in her business, which supports all the main household expenses. She will buy staple grains, snacks, canned food, sausages, eggs, cereal, and other items that are in demand from her customers, who are the residents in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, snacks, canned food, sausages, eggs, cereal, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: Zuhro is one of the smart members of her family who lives happily but poorly.  She is 46-years-old and has a lovely husband who helps her with business.  They bring up 2 children.  Zuhro and her husband try to provide them with high-quality living conditions.  With this aim, she began her own business years ago selling ‘kuraga’.  Every year she buys and processes apricots.  She sells her products at the local market and has a great experience in this field.  Now, it is the season for her business as the apricots are ready for collecting.  She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy an apricot garden.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy an apricot garden.

loans.name: Lajoyeuse Group

texts.fr:
Saleh fait partie du groupe Lajoyeuse  et habite à  Bujumbura. Elle est mariée à Atibu un mécanicien. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 13 à 23 ans dont 1 étudie. 

  
Elle fait le commerce de l'huile de palme,du riz et du haricot depuis 5  ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’huile de palme  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait faire le commerce de pièces de rechange en provenance de Dubaï, et voir son enfant devenir Docteur après ses études.
texts.en:
Saleh lives in Bujumbura and is a member of the group Lajoyeuse. She is married to a mechanic named Atibu, and they have three children aged 13 to 23, one of them in school.  

Saleh has been selling palm oil, rice and beans for five years. This is her second loan cycle with Turame, and she will use the funds to bolster her working capital and stock up on palm oil to sell and increase her revenue.

In the coming years, she would like to start selling spare parts imported from Dubaï. She hopes to see her child become a doctor once he completes his studies.

loans.use: to bolster her working capital and stock up on palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's group is made up of two members: both are women. They do different jobs, but each one gives them the opportunity to improve their financial stability and ensure that their family's situation stabilizes financially. They are very hard-working and are customer oriented. They live in the city of Accra-Teshie.

Rose is one of the members of this group. She is married, 49 years old, and has one child. Her husband works as a taxi driver. They do not have their own home; they rent.

Rose works selling second-hand clothing, which she has done going on 8 years. She works Monday through Saturday, with no fixed schedule. She has her own stand in a market in the city. Her new loan of 800 Ghana Cedis (GHS) will be used to purchase one bale of second-hand clothing so she can continue to grow her business.

Her dream is to one day have her own home.

Adiza is also a wax-print seller and a member of this group.

loans.use: To purchase one bale of second-hand clothing so she can continue to grow her business.

loans.name: Emis

texts.en:
Emis lives in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, situated along the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She is married and has one child. 

Emis has practiced farming for three years. Her source of income is maize, coffee, and bananas. She also has a green grocery business, as an extra source of income.

Emis has requested a loan of KES 35,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. This will boost her production level and, hence, boost her income. It will improve her family's standard of living.

The challenge Emis faces is inadequate funds. In five years,she will have opened a retail shop. Emis says that she appreciates Juhudi Kilimo because her monthly installments for Juhudi Kilimo are favorable.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Toka Chini Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kiyana est membre du groupe d’affaire « Toka chini», entrepreneur débutante, âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique. La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme, tomates, arachides, etc. Elle installe ses produits au marché public et parfois à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, Il y a environ 5 mois. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 bidons d’huile de palme, 2 bassins de tomates, 1 bassin d’arachides. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
The borrower, Kiyana, is a member of the business group "Toka Chini".  She is 45 years old and a novice entrepreneur.  She is also married and the mother of eight children who all attend school.  Her husband works as a civil servant in a public administration.

Kiyana sells palm oil, tomatoes, groundnuts etc.  She displays her products at the public market and sometimes at home.  She started in this business about five months ago using a loan received from the microfinance Hekima.

She will use this new loan to buy two cans of palm oil, two bowls of tomatoes and one bowl of groundnuts.  She hopes to be able to expand her activity, and to feed and educate her children.

Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for providing support to small-scale entrepreneurs, through micro-credit.

It should be noted that (in the photo) one of the borrowers is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy two cans of palm oil, two bowls of tomatoes and one bowl of groundnuts.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Danaya 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    DANAYA 5  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide et le riz avec    BINTOU TAHIROU ,  debout au milieu sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  0.75  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the DANAYA 5 group are married women who are on average 39 years old, have four children, and live in polygamous families in Bladiè, a village in Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see through their agricultural businesses in the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution, and their previous loans were properly repaid. The grown crops are peanuts and rice with BINTOU TAHIROU, standing in the middle of the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy ingredients and seeds and to pay for the labor to make use of .75 hectares. The crops are sold in the village in Garalo, after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She plans to earn 45,000 FCFA per crop. These earnings will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and seeds and to pay for the labor for an agricultural crop

loans.name: Jocasta Josefina

texts.es: Jocasta, tiene 30 años de edad, habita en el barrio monseñor Lezcano de Managua, ella es casada su esposo trabaja en construcción y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa variada para adulto y niños, tiene dos hijos, uno de 11 años y otro de días de nacido, el cual requiere de cuidado especial. Jocasta solicita el crédito para invertir en su pequeño negocio con el que intenta salir adelante, en la actualidad no tiene muchos productos que ofrecer es por eso la necesidad de comprar, en esta ocasión dos bolsones de ropa de paca, para vender de esa manera ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jocasta is 30 years old, she lives in the Monseñor Lezcano neighborhood of Managua. She is married and her husband works in construction, while she makes her living selling a variety of clothes for adults and children. She has two children, one aged 11 years old and the other a newborn who needs a lot of special care. 

Jocasta is seeking the loan to invest in her small business with which she is trying to get ahead in life. At the moment, she doesn't have a lot of products to offer, hence the reason she needs to buy two bags of used clothes to sell on this occasion and therein help her family.

loans.use: to buy two bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

She operates a grocery vegetable stall, selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge in the high cost of transportation to her place of operation, and she dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale cereals shop in the near future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For the past ten years, Mwanaidi has operated a cashew nut selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation and she dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Amamesa Group

texts.fr:
Allon fait partie du groupe  Amamesa  et habite à  Rumonge. Il  a 40 ans et est marié à  Eugénie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants,  âgés de  4  à 11 ans.
  
Il fait le commerce de  poissons. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de poissons à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dan les années à venir, il voudrait construire une maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Allon is part of the Amamesa   group and lives in Rumonge. He is 40 years old and married to Eugénie, a farmer. Together, they have four children, ages 4-11.

He sells fish.

He is on his second loan with Turame. With his KIVA loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of fish to resell at a higher price.

In the coming years, he would like to build a house and send his children to school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of fish to resell at a higher price

loans.name: Zulayya

texts.en:
Zulayya is 37 years old, and a married mother of three children. She sells a variety of products in her shop, such as sugar, sweets, dish washer, and shampoo. Her husband is a driver. She has eight years of experience in the shopkeeping field. People in her town are the regular customers for purchasing food products and other available items at the store. Her monthly profit from selling products is 150 AZN.

Her elder son helps her to sell products in the shop. She is a very successful entrepreneur, because of the shop's good location in the bazaar of her  home city. Zulayya wants to expand her business and to buy more products, because this business is only one financial income in her family. For this purpose, she applied for a loan of 1,900 AZN.  She has a good client history; this will be her fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell at her store

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa de 43 años de edad se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos queso, crema, quesillo, etc. desde hace 1 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en un mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 12 y 19 años de edad, Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más productos lácteos por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Rosa, 43, makes her living selling dairy products, cheese, soft cheese and so on. Since a year ago, her business is located in a market which is close to her place of residence. She is a very responsible, hardworking and friendly person. With the profits that she makes, she is able to cover some of the household costs. She lives with her husband and their two children aged 12 and 19 years old. 

Rosa is seeking a loan to buy more dairy products in bulk and therein obtain larger profits and give her family what it needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy more dairy products such as cheese, cream, soft cheese and so on in bulk.

loans.name: Pioneras - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PIONERAS - 26 Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  el  presidente del banco es el Sr. Víctor tiene 57 años, tiene hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes,   el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona de Villa Dolores,  es cliente antigua de la institución, saco los anteriores créditos siempre para mejorar su negocio, el Sr. Víctor va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, manteca y levadura por mayor para la elaboración de repostería, el Sr. Víctor es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, también se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado a su compañeras  de grupo.
texts.en:
The PIONERAS - 26 communal bank is made up of eight members: six women and two men. The president of the bank is Víctor who is 57 years old and has children who are already adults and independent. He makes his living making and selling break. His bakery is located in the Villa Dolores area, he is a long-standing customer of the bank, having taken out previous credits always to improve the business. 

Víctor will use the loan to buy supplies such as flour, butter and yeast to make bakery goods. Víctor is a person who is keen to improve and is happy and grateful to the bank for the support given as this is the only activity which allows his to support himself and his family. He is also happy and grateful to the bank for the help given to his fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour and butter in bulk to make bakery goods.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 39, is a married woman. She, along with her husband, is in the business of making bangles (artificial jewelry) and has been for many years. The business has great potential for growth and Nasreen is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them. She has five children; all of them are going to school. 

The couple wishes to increase their earnings to afford the educational expenses of their children. In order to meet the orders on time and boost their sales, Nasreen requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems with some packs of stones and pearls. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend the part of it on providing a good quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems with some packs of stones and pearls.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha lives in the small village of Dighomi, near the capital city. He is 48 years old, married, and lives with his wife Manana, two sons, and a daughter-in-law. Manana works at the local bakery and gets a monthly salary. 

Gocha's economic activity is a greenhouse where different kinds of vegetables are grown. His sons help Gocha run this business. The harvested products are sold at the capital city open market. Gocha decided to start his business as their existing income isn't enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. 

His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of low income. 

With the loan, Gocha will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country's capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car for use as a taxi

loans.name: Danaya 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe    DANAYA 6  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide et le riz avec    SETOU MORY ,  2 eme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the DANAYA 6 group are married women who are on average 40 years old, have four children, and live in polygamous families in Bladiè, a village in Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see through their agricultural businesses in the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution, and their previous loans were properly repaid. The grown crops are peanuts and rice with SETOU MORY, sitting second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy ingredients and seeds and to pay for the labor to make use of one hectare. The crops are sold in the village in Garalo, after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She plans to earn 100,000 FCFA per crop. These earnings will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and seeds and to pay for the labor for an agricultural crop

loans.name: Hilda Marina

texts.es: Hilda de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura y tambien posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, aceite, golosinas, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que tendrá una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Hilda, 62, lives in her own house with her husband and three children. She farms and also has a store, where she sells basic items such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, oil, and candy. She has managed the business for years and has garnered sales experience that has led to higher profits. The store is in her house, which is in a well-trafficked area and is known to neighbors. She has many customers because her shop is well stocked. She wants to grow her business and make a new investment, but she lacks funding. She has applied for a loan to buy what she needs for the store. She is certain she can pay her loan and is confident that she will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy milk, eggs, bread, oil, candy, etc.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 37-year-old, married woman. She has been in the business of hand embroidery for ten years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

With the passage of time, her customers increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as in financial matters. 

She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy stocks of threads, sequins, stones, and pearls in various colors, to complete the orders on time. She expects a boost in her business income and is very thankful to Kashf Foundation for its support.

loans.use: to buy stocks of threads, sequins, stones, and pearls in various colors.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of two children, both of whom go to school. They live in their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For the past years, she has operated a cashew nut selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. Mwanamisi dreams of establishing a wholesale shop for selling the cashew nuts in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Lorena

texts.es: Blanca se dedica  a la venta de ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos y su esposo, blanca esta solicitando un crédito para la  comprar de mas ropa interior por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Blanca makes her living selling underwear for men, women and children. She sells in the streets in the different neighborhoods which are near to her place of residence. She has a lot of customers as her products are of a high quality, with the profits that she makes from her sales and with the help of her husband, they are able to cover some of the household costs. She lives in her own home with her four children and her husband. 

Blanca is seeking a loan to buy more underwear in bulk and therein obtain better profits to give her family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy more underwear in bulk.

loans.name: Elfy

texts.es: La señora Elfy vive en la población de Manco Kapac, junto a su concubino,en la casa de su pariente, pagan alquiler por esta vivienda, se dedican a la producción  agrícola, trabajan en el terreno de su suegra, y también se alquilan  terrenos de los vecinos para cultivar algún producto estacional,  siempre con el anhelo de salir adelante y crecer económicamente para darle mejores condiciones de vida al niño que está en camino.  La señora Elfy y su concubino producen yuca, son muy dedicados a su actividad,  siempre buscando sobresalir adelante en la vida. De su producción de yuca cosecha, 400 quintales y vende a los intermediarios que compran en el lugar, aparte de esto se dedican a trabajar en el terreno de sus tíos o conocidoscolaborando en el desmalezado de sus cultivos de esto obtienen otro ingreso adicional llamado un jornal. El presente crédito es solicitado  para la compra de un terreno agrícola, ya que lo que ahorraron no les alcanza, y con este crédito más podrá realizar el objetivo propuesto, y tener su propio terreno agrícola para cultivar.
texts.en:
Elfy lives in the town of Manco Kapac with her spouse. They live in a rented house that belongs to a relative. They work as farmers in Elfy's mother in law's land. They also rent plots of land from neighbors to grow seasonal products. They have the desire to get ahead in life and grow financially so they can provide better life conditions for a baby that is on the way.
Elfy and her spouse grow yucca and are very dedicated to this activity. They harvest 400 quintals (1 quintal = 100 pounds) of yucca, which they then sell to intermediaries. In addition to this, they work in plots of land belonging to their aunt and uncle or acquaintances, helping them weed their fields. From this activity they earn an additional daily wage. 
Elfy is asking for this loan to purchase a plot of land because their savings are not enough. This loan will allow them to achieve their goal and have their own land to cultivate.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land.

loans.name: Gaudalupe De Gaucampoy Group

texts.es:
La señora Eulalia esta unida de hecho, cuenta con 23 años de edad, de escolaridad 3ro. primaria, tiene 2 hijos que aun no estudian, se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verdras, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que tenia ahorrado y hasta la fecha lleva 6 años de expericneica, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para poder solitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería para apmpliar su negocio, espera en el futuro contar con un local bien acreditado en el mercado de la localidad. Los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican la venta de verduras y frutas, venta de animales domésticos y venta de ropa. En la fotogafía se incluyen 14 personas pero solamente a 13 de ellos se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Eulalia is in a common law marriage, she is 23 years old and completed her 3rd year of secondary schooling. She has 2 children who are not yet studying. She makes her living buying and selling fruit and vegetables. She started this business with a small capital that she had saved up and to date has six years of experience in this field. She can count on the support of her husband who makes his living in sales.

Eulalia organizes a group to seek a loan that she will use to buy merchandise to expand her business. In the future, Eulalia hopes to have a well accredited area in the local market. The other members of the group make their living selling fruits and vegetables, domestic animals and clothes. In the photograph, there are 14 people but only 13 of them where given the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Ríos De Agua Viva” está   conformada por 06 socios responsables la cual pasan a su 8 ciclo. Martha una madre de 51 años,  es viuda  y tiene 04 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 02 de ellos.  Ella comenzó ofreciendo servicio de cocina, con los deseos de mejorar inició su propio negocio, la cual hace 02 años que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y calzados. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo a brindado educación a sus hijos. Su último crédito lo destinó para la compra de casacas, chompas, pantalones y calzados ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar. Más adelante le gustaría poner una boutique donde pueda exhibir sus productos. Martha es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste un saco a cuadros y cartera negra. El grupo “Ríos De Agua Viva” agradecen el crédito brindado, pues hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Ríos De Agua Viva” comprises six responsible members, who are in their eighth loan cycle. Martha, 51, is a widow and the mother of four children, two of whom are dependents. Initially, she sold prepared food. Two years ago, hoping to improve her circumstances and educate her children, she began her first business, selling clothing and footwear.  

She will use this loan to buy jackets, sweaters, pants, and footwear to fill customer orders. Eventually, she hopes to open a boutique, where she can display her merchandise. Martha is the first person on the left and is wearing a plaid jacket and is carrying a black purse. The group “Ríos De Agua Viva” is grateful for the funding, which makes its progress possible

loans.use: to buy jackets, sweaters, pants, and footwear.

loans.name: Nestan

texts.en: Nestan, 48, is a nurse at the hospital. She is a widow and lives in the village of Dighomi with her daughter. She has requested loans from local financial institutions several times without success in order to restart up her clothing trading business, which closed because of financial problems. Her loan requests were rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is Nestan’s small monthly salary. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credit with soft conditions to the country's rural poor. They do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Nestan plans to purchase clothing in Turkey from wholesalers and sell these items among the villagers as well as in the nearby villages. After investing the funds in her business, Nestan hopes to generate additional revenue and invest the profits for further business development. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for restarting trading business

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zakaria is 36 years old and lives in a small village of Gurjaani District with his wife Nino. Zakaria requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up but without any success. His loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Zakaria and his wife are actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land and grow maize. They also have pigs and sell piglets locally. It is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zakaria requested loan from Credo to start up a family business. Zakaria has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Zakaria will purchase a tractor. After the tractor is purchased, he will go to the forest and transport lumber for selling. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up, loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is is a 42-year-old woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. Now, her children are growing old and their needs are growing, as well. 

Previously, Hameeda's husband was driving an auto-rickshaw which did not belong to him. On a daily basis, he had to pay a fair share to the owner of the auto-rickshaw. Therefore, her husband decided to buy his own rickshaw, to increase his income and savings. 

Hameeda has some savings, which is insufficient to buy a new auto-rickshaw. That is why she requested a loan of PKR 25,000, so that her husband would be able to buy a new auto rickshaw.

Hameeda hopes that this loan can bring happiness and joy to her family’s life and that she could easily meet the daily household expenses. She is very glad after taking this loan and assures us that she will pay back the installments on-time.

loans.use: to pay for an auto-rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 46 years old, married and has one daughter. Her husband is a driver but his salary is not enough to meet their family's needs. Because of that, Tahira rents a store where she is selling food products. She has 10 years of experience in this field. Tahira sells from Monday to Sunday to customers who visit her shop daily. The customers include her neighbors and friends, as her business is located near her house. From this business, her monthly profit is 150 AZN.

Tahira is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy more food products such as soft drinks, juices, bread, cookies, milk, eggs, cheese, water, beans, sugar and butter. With the support of this loan, she  hopes to increase her inventory and thus the volume of her sales. 
She has a good credit history and this is her third loan. She hopes to get money to expand her business in the future. Tahira awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more food products

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es: Silvia de 29 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa interior lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela ya que su mercadería es de muy buena calidad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, Silvia está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más ropa interior  por mayor para seguir con su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia, 29, is a street vendor who sells undergarments in different areas near her home. She has a lot of customers because her merchandise is of very good quality. She lives in her own home with her husband and four children. 

Silvia is requesting a loan to buy more undergarments wholesale to continue with her business to get better profits and have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase more undergarments at wholesale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam has operated a greengrocery stall. Her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. In addition, she also operates a stall selling other foods, to earn a living. She faces a major challenge of seasonality of products in the market.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, fruits and onions, to resell at the greengrocery stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, fruits and onions, to resell at her greengrocery stall

loans.name: Reina Maritza

texts.es:
Reina,  se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere más capital de trabajo para  fortalecer   su negocio; este le permitirá comprar maíz, aceite, una plancha más.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que le ayudo a mejorar las ganancias y con ello ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios; las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Reina finds herself in need of a new loan because she requires more working capital to strengthen her business - this will allow her to buy corn, oil and another grill.

The effect of the previous loan was favorable as it helped her to improve her profits and with it she was able to support her children in their studies and the financial situation has improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil and another grill.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 32-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children; all are school-going. 

She has been stitching autobike seat covers for many years and she sells them at reasonable prices to the people of her community and in local market. She works hard on her machine every day, so she may earn a living for her family and provide food, health, and education. She has gradually improved her business, with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Shazia is in her fourth loan cycle, with good repayment history. Now she has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase a new machine with more spools of thread in various colors, cutters, and needles. 

In this way, she would be able to increase her sales, which ultimately helps in generating more cash. She hopes to have a good experience with the new loan.

loans.use: to purchase new machine with more spools of thread in various colors, cutters, and needles.

loans.name: Heriberto De Jesus

texts.es:
Heriberto, está acompañado  disfruta de cuatro hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 4, 9, 10 y 12 años. El, se dedica a la ganaderia y asimismo al cultivo de granos básicos tales como maíz y frijol,  esta actividad la realiza desde hace 22 años y oficio que lo aprendió con su padre, este lo desempeña de 6:00am a 3:00pm y por el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para llevar a cabo el cultivo, entre estos están: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas; esta inversión le ayudara a tener todo lo requerido de una sola vez.
Su sueño es apoyar a su familia con la alimentación y brindarle ayuda a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Heriberto lives with his partner and enjoys his four children, ages 4, 9, 10, and 12. He raises livestock and grows basic crops such as corn and beans. This has been his profession, which he learned from his parents, since he turned 22. He works from 6:00am until 3:00pm, and, for now, the job doesn't present any problem.
 
He needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, weed killer, and pesticide to begin planting. The loan will let him buy all that he needs at once. He dreams of feeding his family and helping his children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy manure, weed killer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Grace Lisseth

texts.es: Grace es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo de 6 años y sus padres, ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, tiene mucha clientela pues tiene muy surtido su negocio y es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y honesta, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Grace esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar ropa por mayor como: blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas, etc. y seguir con su negocio ya que tiene mucha demanda y así poder seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Grace is a single mother who lives in her own home with her 6-year-old son and her parents. She has been running a business selling clothes in her place of residence for the last three years and has a lot of customers as she stocks her business well and is a very friendly, hardworking and honest person. With the profits that she makes, she is able to cover some of the household costs that surface. 

Grace is seeking a loan to buy clothes in bulk such as blouses, skirts, trousers, shirts and so on to continue with her business as she has a lot of demand and, in this way, be able to give her family what it needs without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk such as blouses, skirts, trousers, shirts and so on.

loans.name: Rose Acayo

texts.en: Rose is 44 years old. She is married and all of her children go to school. Rose lives in Nimule, South Sudan. She runs her own business selling items such as clothing, shoes, handbags and bedding. She has been in business for over two years. Rose has requested a loan of 3,000 Sudanese Pounds to purchase more stock for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to expand her business and allow her to employ people to help her in the business.

loans.use: to buy items such as clothes, shoes, handbags, and bedding.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama is a 35-year-old, married woman. She is the mother of three children; all of them are school-going. For about six years, she has been working in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and her regular customers are her neighbors. She earns enough through her business, to afford a decent life. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000. She will use the loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with some packs of beads, pearls and stones, for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers, consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers, and she dreams of a bright future for her children.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, with some packs of beads, pearls and stones.

loans.name: Nazibrola

texts.en:
Nazibrola is 51 years old and lives with her husband Tamaz in the Gurjaani district, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. Nazibrola requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Tamaz bakes Georgian bread at a local bakery, earning a small monthly amount, the family's sole source of income, barely enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category.

Nazibrola has requested this loan from Credo to start up a family business, a loan approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Nazibrola will purchase calves to raise to start producing dairy products, a business she hopes to expand in the future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa de 42 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de elote desde hace varios años lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, rosa esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los tamales como: elotes, azúcar, leche, etc. y seguir con su negocio y poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, lives with her husband and two children in a relative’s home. She has been selling corn tamales for many years as a street vendor in different areas near her home. With the profits that she gets she hopes to cover some household costs. 

Rosa is requesting a loan to be able to buy all the necessary ingredients to make tamales: corn, sugar, milk etc…and continue with her business and be able to give her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, milk etc…

loans.name: Lorena Marilu

texts.es: Lorena de 46 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa, cepillos para lavar  ropa y pastes, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de sus hijos logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos y su nieta, Lorena esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercadería por mayor para obtener mejores ganancias y poder seguir con su negocio y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lorena, 46, sells clothing, laundry brushes, and paste in nearby neighborhoods as a street vendor. She manages to pay household expenses with her income and with help from her children. She lives in a rented house with her two children and her granddaughter. Lorena has applied for a loan to buy wholesale inventory so that she can earn more, continue her business, and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing, laundry brushes, and paste.

loans.name: Broumana Group

texts.en:
Broumana is a group comprised of five Filipino ladies, all of whom work as housekeepers for Lebanese families. They decided to join hands and form the group, in order to support each other financially by acquiring the group loan from Al Majmoua.

Maricel is the featured borrower of the group. She is a 31-year-old, married mother of two children, and in the picture she stands in the center of the group. Her husband is unemployed, which means that she is the only financial provider of her family. However, her income is barely sufficient to provide for one individual. Therefore, she joined the group to acquire a loan.  She will use her share of the loan to settle the school tuition fees of her children, who are enrolled in a private school.

As for the other group members, Alejandrina is standing on the far left of the picture in a red shirt, Jennifer is the second from the left in a pink shirt, Judith is standing at the far right of the picture, and Jenalyn is standing the second from the right, wearing red.

loans.use: to settle the school tuition fees of her children

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Doña María de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y sus nietos, ella se dedica a elabora antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. que vende en su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza y a la ayuda de su hijo han logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña María pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maíz para los tamales, plátanos y todos los ingredientes para su elaboración y así poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
María, 57, lives in her own home with her son and their grandchildren. She makes her living making corn-based dishes: fried potatoes, fried yucca, empanadas, tamales and so on which she sells in her place of residence. Thanks to the sales she makes, and the support of her son, they have been able to cover the household costs. 

María is seeking financing to buy products that she used to make her corn-based dishes such as oil, potatoes and corn for the tamales, and bananas and all the ingredients to make them. In this way, she will be able to continue covering the costs which can arise.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes and corn for tamales, bananas and so on.

loans.name: Bijumaa

texts.en:
Bijumaa operates an open-air food-vending business, selling dumplings to her neighbours and passersby from home. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation and dreams of establishing a cafe in the future.

With this Kshs 40,000 loan, Bijumaa wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal for the preparation of food for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal for the preparation of  food for sale.

loans.name: Frial

texts.en: Frial, a 26-year-old single woman who lives in Taiz, Yemen, works hard. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. Due to the high cost of goods, Frial has requested a youth loan of 180,000 YER to a buy fridge and washing machine for home use. In the future, she hopes to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and washing machine for home use.

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es:
Ana, es madre soltera y vive con sus hijos, no posee familiares en el extranjero. Ella, se dedica a la venta de gas, el negocio lo aprendió de familia y lo desempeña de 6:00am a 7:00pm, la ventaja que posee es que lo realiza en casa propia y lo lleva a cabo desde hace un año.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar gas; esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar los inventarios y con ello mejorar las ventas.
Su sueño es poder tener una distribuidora de gas y así sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Ana is a single mother, lives with her children, and has no family members living abroad. She sells gas, a business she learned from her family, from  6:00 am until 7:00 pm. She has had the business for a year, and one advantage is that she operates it from her house. She needs a loan to buy gas. This investment will increase her inventory and sales. Her dream is be a gas distributor and support her family this way.

loans.use: to buy gas.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy resides in the Nkubu area of Eastern Kenya, a very fertile land for agriculture production. She is married and has four children, two of whom are of school-going age. A farmer for 13 years, Mercy grows and sells bananas, maize, beans and sweet potatoes. She also sells timber.

Mercy has requested a loan of KES.60,000 to purchase poultry. The resulting egg production will increase her income level, enabling her to offer better educational opportunities for the children.

The major challenge she faces is inadequate funds. Within five years, she plans to establish a green house. Mercy says that Juhudi Kilimo's services are fair.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira has operated a cashew nut-vending business for the past six years, selling at the market to town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of competition from other cashew nut sellers. She dreams to expand her business and start selling cereals in the future.

With this Kshs 50,000 loan, Samira wants to purchase 12 sacks of cashew nuts for resale to meet the demands of her customers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood, and she appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Edwin Balmore

texts.es:
Edwin, tiene 29 años de edad y vive con su esposa, disfruta de 3 hijos, los cuales uno de ellos tiene 6 años mientras que los otros  2 son gemelos y tienen 12 años de edad. El, se dedica a la siembra y producción de hortalizas tales como: pepino, ejote, chile y tomate.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios, entre estos: abono, fertilizantes, semilla de pepino y ejote; esta inversión le ayudará a incrementar la producción y sus ingresos para los gastos del hogar.
Su sueño es adquirir su propio terreno y ampliar el área de hortalizas, tener casa propia y brindarles apoyo a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Edwin, 29, lives with his wife and enjoys his three children, a six-year-old and twelve-year-old twins. He grows vegetables such as cucumbers, chiles, tomatoes, and corn. He needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies like manure, fertilizer, and cucumber and corn seed. 

This investment will help him increase production and income to pay household expenses. He dreams of owning his own land, expanding his vegetable crops, having his own house, and giving his children the means to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and cucumber and corn seed.

loans.name: Antolina De Jesus
