texts.es: Antolina de 53 años de edad se dedica a la venta de especias como: achiote, relajo, fideos, canela, pimienta, etc. vende de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela ya que su producto es muy vendible con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar,  vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos que también ayudan en los gastos del hogar, antolina esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de especias por mayor y obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Antolina, 53, makes her living selling spices such as achiote, relajo, fideo, cinnamon, pepper and so on. She sells in the streets in the different markets near to her place of residence. She has a lot of customers as her products sell well. With the profits that she makes, she is able to cover some of the household costs. She lives in her own home with her husband and their three children who also help with the household costs. Antolina is seeking a loan to buy the spices in bulk and obtain better profits to give her family greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy spices achiote, relajo, fideo, cinnamon, pepper, and so on in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es una joven muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable, siempre esta al pendiente de que a su familia no le falte nada, desde hace 1 año decidió poner un comedor en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues el plato de comida lo da a un buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos que se le presentan en su casa, vive con su compañero de vida, su hijo y su suegra en casa propia, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios para poder preparar los alimentos como: pollos, carnes, vegetales, fruta, arroz, frijoles, refrescos, maíz, etc. todo esto por mayor para poder tener siempre los platos de comida necesarios cuando los clientes la busquen para comprarle y así obtener mejores ganancias que le ayuden a darle a su familia una mejor calidad e vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client is a hardworking, honest, responsible young woman, She ensures that her family always has what it needs. A year ago, she decided to open a dining area in her house. She has many customers because the food is well priced. She manages to pay household expenses with the income. She lives with her life partner, son, and mother-in-law in her own house.

The client has applied for a loan to buy wholesale supplies such as chicken, meat, vegetables, fruit, rice, beans, sodas, and corn to prepare her food. She will have the dishes ready when her customers come to buy them. This way, she will earn more and can easily give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, fruit, rice, beans, sodas, corn, etc.

loans.name: Filipe

texts.pt:
Filipe é solteiro, tem 35 anos de idade e é professor primário há 5 anos. Tem dois filhos de 8 e 13 anos que estão a estudar e sustenta também o seu pai enviando produtos e dinheiro.
Com o empréstimo o cliente pretende comprar cimento e chapas de zinco para a construção de sua casa.
No futuro, Filipe deseja casar-se, construir uma mini mercearia e um salão de cabeleireiro na sua casa.
Nas horas vagas ele faz trabalhos de ourivesaria como forma de reforçar a sua renda.
Filipe pretende pagar pontualmente e o mais rápido possível o seu empréstimo para poder solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar seus planos.
texts.en:
Filipe is single. He's 35 years old and has been an elementary school teacher for over 5 years. He has two children aged 8 and 13 years who go to school. He also supports his father by sending him goods and money.
With the loan he intends to purchase cement and metal sheets in order to build his house.
In the future Filipe wishes to get married and build a small grocery store and a hair salon in his house.
In his free time he does goldsmith work as a way of increasing his income.
Filipe intends to repay the loan in a timely fashion and as quickly as possible. That way he'll be able to request more loans so he can accomplish his plans.

loans.use: to purchase cement and metal sheets in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Cesar Wilian

texts.es: Cesar de 49 años de edad tiene un negocio de venta de agua embotellada la distribuye por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, cesar esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar  el agua embotellada por mayor y poder seguir con su negocio ya que tiene mucha demanda y asi obtener mejores ganancias que le ayuden en los gastos de su hogar y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar, 49, runs a business selling bottled water which he distributes to the different neighborhoods which are near his place of residence. With the profits he makes, he is able to cover some of the household costs, he lives in his own home with his wife and their children. 

Cesar is seeking a loan to buy bottled water in bulk and continue with his business as he has a lot of demand and in this manner he will obtain larger profits which will help him with the household costs and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bottled water in bulk.

loans.name: Ana Mabel

texts.es: Ana de 30 años de edad se dedica  a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace 10 años vende de forma ambulante  por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela ya que su mercadería la vende a buen precio, vive en casa alquilada con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor  para poder seguir con su negocio y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Ana, 30, is a street vendor and has been selling clothing and footwear for 10 years in nearby neighborhoods. She has many customers because her merchandise is affordable. She lives in a rented house with her husband and two children, ages 14 and 12, who are students. With her income and help from her husband, they manage to pay household expenses. Ana has applied for a loan to buy wholesale merchandise to continue her business and to give her family greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari is married and has four children, all of whom go to school.  They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling dried fish, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She also sells firewood, which is another source of livelihood for her. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish, in the near future.

With the KES 50,000 loan proceeds, she wants to purchase two sacks of dried fish to resell.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Jambul

texts.en: Jambul lives in Vani, Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife and a son. Jambul has a small income from a family owned agricultural business. He grows maize and nuts and sells the harvested products at the local, open market. As the income is seasonal, Jambul decided to start a trading business with his own mini-bus. His loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages the provision of business startup and restartup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural, poor population who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Jambul will purchase fruit and vegetables from farmers at wholesale prices and sell them in nearby towns for a higher price. It is hoped that the income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Additionally, the family will hopefully, in time, have enough income to access the regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, if needed.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to start a trading business.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 26 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, Maia, in Gurjaani district, East Georgia. Zaza requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

Zaza and his wife work hard, physically. In particular, they help their fellow villagers in any kind of agricultural work, such as: cultivating the land, sowing the seeds of vegetables, harvesting the products, and so on. This is how they get income. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Zaza requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Zaza has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people who do not have access to other credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Zaza will purchase a horse. He will go to local forests and bring wood from the forest on the horse. They will sell the wood in the village and earn income. Wood is mainly used by the village population for ovens, to heat the houses and cook. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for carrying firewood to the village

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es: Carmen de 45 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable con su familia, ella tienen una pequeña tienda donde vende aceite, sopa, salsas de tomate, productos instantáneos, etc. tiene muchos años con su negocio que le han dejado muy buenas ganancias y con esas ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos de los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, su hijo mayor trabaja de empleado  y su esposo trabaja de albañil ambos ayudan también en los gastos del hogar, Carmen esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería por mayor y poder surtir mas su pequeña tienda para poder complacer a sus clientes cuando le lleguen a compara y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias  y tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen, 45, is a woman who is very hardworking, honest and responsible with her family. She has a small store where she sells oil, soup, tomato sauces, instant products and so on. She has worked many years in the business which has returned excellent profits, and with these profits she is able to cover some of her household's costs. She lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. Her eldest son works as an employee and her husband works as a builder, they both help with the household costs. 

Carmen is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise in bulk to be able to stock more in her small store and be able to satisfy her customers when they come to buy. It is in this way she will be able to gain larger profits and have greater financial security with her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, soup, tomato sauces, instant products and so on.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio  es un hombre soltero  de 33 años de edad vive junto a sus 3 hijos, 1 hombre y 2 mujeres en la Colonia Buena Vista, Barrio El Calvario Sololá, Sololá.
El  es albañil eligió  esta actividad porque hace años, el se dedicaba a la agricultura pero se dio cuenta que los ingresos eran cada vez más bajos,  por lo que decidió obtar  por esta  labor, fue adquiriendo experiencia  por medio de unos familiares que lo motivaron a seguir adelante,  contribuyendo de esta  manera con la economía de su familia.
Cuenta con 12 años de experiencia en  este tipo de trabajo  a través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos aceptables,  por lo que esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para la compra de materiales como cal hidratada, arena, piedrín y cemento para la remodelación de su vivienda.
Su sueño es construir 2 cuartos de block,  para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio is a single, 33-year-old man who lives with his three children, one boy and two girls, in Colonia Buena Vista, in the El Calvario Sololá neighborhood of Sololá. He is a builder; he chose this trade because he was working in agriculture years ago, but he realized that his income was getting lower all the time. So he decided to opt for this work. He continued to gain experience through some family members who encouraged him to keep going, thereby contributing to the family's finances. 

Antonio has twelve years of experience in this type of work; through what he does, he earns an acceptable income. He is requesting a loan of 7,000.00 GTQ to purchase materials like lime, sand, gravel, and cement to remodel his house. His dream is to build two cinderblock rooms to provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to remodel his house.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in the Nkubu area in Eastern Kenya, a very productive area. She has three children, one of whom is of school-going age. Joyce has been farming for 20 years. Her sources of income are coffee, bananas, tea leaves, and maize. The challenge she faces is seasons of dry spell.

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000. She will use it for setting up a water tank, which will help in the storage of water for farm use. The tank will ensure a constant flow of water to the farm, and thus cause her crops to grow and be productive. It will help to increase her income and, thus, improve her family's lifestyle.

In the next five years, she will have purchased a posho mill. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo, for processing loans on time.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank for crop watering

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea, age 38, is single and lives in the small town of Gori with her family: parents, brother, sister-in-law, and niece. Tea’s brother works for the local government and her sister-in-law is a manager of an esthetics clinic. Tea works at a restaurant. All the family members get monthly salaries. 

Several times, Tea has requested loans from local financial institutions in order to start up her clothing trading business, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected because of lack of experience in the business, which is usually demanded by local financial institutions. 

Her loan request has now been approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credit, with soft conditions to country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high-risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Tea plans to purchase clothing from wholesalers in Turkey and then sell these items from her house. After investing the funds in her business, Tea hopes to generate additional revenue and invest the profits to further develop her business. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start up a clothing trading business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es madre soltera vive con su hijo de 8 meses en casa alquilada, ella posee una tienda desde hace 1 años, vende golosinas, huevos, sopas, granos básicos, refrescos, etc. tiene muy buena clientela ya que la tienda la tiene surtida con productos que sus clientes necesitan, con las ganancias que obtiene cubre algunos gastos mas necesarios de su casa como agua, luz y pago de casa, por esa razón la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas mercadería y surtir mas su tienda para obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguir solventado los gastos que se le presenten en su hogar y también poder darle a su hijo lo que necesita sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
This client is a single mother. She lives with her 8-month-old son in a rented house. She has owned a shop for the last year; she sells snacks, eggs, soups, staple grains, soft drinks, etc. She has a very good clientele because her shop is stocked with products that her customers need. 

With the profits she earns, she covers some of the most important costs of her household, like water, electricity, and rent. For that reason, this client is requesting a loan to be able to buy more merchandise to better stock her shop. That way she will obtain better profits in order to continue paying for expenses that arise in her household and also to be able to give her son what he needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, eggs, soups, staple grains, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Felix Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Félix sigue con la actividad de la   reparación de autos, el es chapista hace ya varios años, tiene su taller  ubicado en la Zona de la Ballivian  donde ofrece sus servicios,  este préstamo cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de un motos y llantas para su movilidad, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de una caja y tapizado para los asientos de su movilidad que es también otra fuente de ingresos ya que lo hace manejar y recibe una renta diaria, como también le sirve para transportarse a distintos lugares donde realiza trabajos a domicilio,  se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Félix continues with the auto repair activity, he has worked as a sheet-metal worker for several years, his shop is located in the Ballivian area, where he offers his services, he mentions it went very well with the previous loan, he used to buy an engine and tires to get it to work, currently, he requests a loan to buy a gearbox and to upholster the seats in the vehicle, this is another source of income, because he rents the vehicle for a daily fee, he also uses it to get around to the different places where he does work, he feels happy for the opportunity provided.

loans.use: to buy a gearbox and to upholster his van

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 34 years old. She is married with three children. Her husband works as a security guard in the community. She has requested a loan to buy more beans and potatoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy food items for resale.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 36 years old. He is single and sells foodstuffs. He has been in the business for the past five years. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more beans and flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu appreciates the previous loan, which helped her to boost her business. She is taking out another Kiva loan, of KES 15,000, to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and beans to sell. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. The previous loan helped her improve her business and increase her monthly profits by 50 percent.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby, and even at the market. She faces major challenges of seasonality in her business and competition from fellow sellers.

With the loan of KES 50,000 that she is requesting, Fatuma wants to purchase five bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business. She appreciates the support being given.

loans.use: to purchase five bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.en: Emilienne is 50 years old. She is married to a carpenter, and they have eight children. She sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for the past 12 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans and potatoes to sell. She expects to use the profits from the business to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more beans and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en: Umazi operates a food-vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to buy three bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, rice and beans to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy three bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakame

texts.en: Mwanakame operates a beauty salon. Her potential customers are neighbors and town dwellers. She dreams of incorporating her business to form a beauty training school. With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to buy hair extensions, hair treatment items and shampoos. She joined Yehu because of its favorable loaning requirements, and she appreciates the support being given.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, hair treatment items and shampoos for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married mother of two children, both of whom go to school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past two years, Lucy has operated a grocery shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation, but she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and sugar to sell. Lucy decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust  to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Naskida

texts.en:
Naskida is a 41-year-old man from a small village in the Gurjaani district, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. He lives with his brother Aleksandre, who is 45 years old. Because he is an invalid, Aleksandre is provided with a monthly pension from government institutions. 
Naskida applied for loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were always rejected, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
Naskida is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a vineyard and sells the harvested grapes at local markets. Besides that, he has a plot of agricultural land where tomatoes are grown. Naskida also works as a laborer and helps his fellow villagers by doing agricultural work for fees. He is a very hardworking man and does his best to increase his family’s income, but his income is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 
According to Credo’s evaluation, the family belongs to the “subsistence poor” category. Naskida requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Naskida has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the credit Naskida will buy calves. As calves are purchased, he will raise them and produce dairy products in the future. This will be an additional source of income for them to buy all the medicine for his brother. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves to be used to produce dairy products.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a 30-year-old married man and has two children, who live in Taiz, Yemen. He is very hard-working and is doing his best to improve his living conditions. He never depends on anyone, always doing as much he can to earn money for his daily expenses. However, he is unable to buy some home appliances, because what he earns is hardly enough to pay the rent on the small house. He decided to apply for a Youth Loan of 150,000 YER to buy a fridge. He hopes to improve his living standards and open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy a fridge for personal use.

loans.name: Riadh

texts.en:
Riadh is a 27-year-old, married man who has three children and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has had a bus for two years. First, he saved a small amount of money, renting his own land to customers, in order to buy the bus. He has been offering bus transportation services, to and from his city, for some time now and his work has kept him increasingly busy. 

Riadh applied for a youth loan of YER 100,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy spare parts for his bus. He hopes to buy another bus.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus.

loans.name: Freddy Tobias

texts.es:
Freddy tiene 23 años de edad vive en Union Libre,  tiene 1 hija,vive con la compañera y con la hija,  en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Arte y Cultura  “Wari” se encuentra en la comunidad de Larkaloma a 45 minutos  de la oficina, está conformada por 11 socios

fredy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, maíz, además cría animales como  pollos y tiene algunas vacas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, abonos orgánicos y alimentacion para los animales. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá fumigar a tiempo los cultivos. 

El sueño es poder tener un vehículo propio para el negocio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Freddy, 23, is in a common law relationship and has a daughter; he lives with his spouse and daughter in Guaranda, Bolivar Province.  The “Arte y Cultura Wari” (Wari Art and Culture) communal bank is located in the community of Larkaloma 45 minutes from the office; it has 11 members.

Freddy works in agriculture growing potatoes and corn and also raises animals like chickens; he also has a few cows.  He’s asking for the loan to buy manure, fertilizer, organic manure and animal feed.  With help from the loan he’ll be able to fumigate the crops on time.

His dream is to be able to own a vehicle for the business.  The challenge he faces is competition.   He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Tochy

texts.ru: Точи очень добрая и чистосердечная женщина. Ей 54 года. Она замужем и имеет 2 сыновей. Точи выросла в бедной семье. Она вместе с родителями жила в сельской местности и вышла замуж не далеко от района, где она выросла. Ее муж Бахрон не имел ни ремесла, ни профессия. До сих пор он работает наёмным работником. Он работает в стройках объектов и получает за это маленькую сумму. Ее сыновья совершеннолетние и зарабатывают в Российской Федерации, так как на родине они не имеют постоянной место работы. Точи, более 35 лет занимается скотоводством. Она имеет большой опыт по скотоводству и с бизнесом справляется сама. Она продает скот на местном рынке и имеет своих клиентов. Точи начала стройку нового дома, так как они данное время живут в маленьком домике. Она хочет женить второго сына, но для него и его жены нет дома. Ее сыновья отправили ей те деньги, которые они накопили целый год, но отправленные деньги не хватило для постройки дома и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. для строительства нового дома. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на вашу благотворительность.
texts.en: Tochy is a very kind and open-hearted woman. She is 54 years old, married, and has two sons. Tochy grew up in a poor family in a rural area and got married not far from where she grew up. Her husband Bakhron did not learn a trade or profession and performs unskilled labor. He works on constuction sites and earns a small amount of money. Her adult sons work in Russia because they could not find permanent jobs in Tajikistan. Tochy has raised cattle for over 35 years. She has extensive experience breeding cattle and runs her own business. She sells cattle at the local market and has repeat customers. Tochy began building a new house because the one they live in now is small. She wants her second son to get married, but he and his wife would have nowhere to live. Her sons sent her all of the money they had saved up over the past year, but it wasn't enough to build the house. This is why she has asked for a loan of 4000 somoni to purchase construction materials such as cement, wood, and so forth to build the new house. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy building materials for building a new house

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 38 years old. She sells shoes and has been in business for one year. She wants a loan to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en: Fausta is 36 years old. She sells used shoes and has been in this business for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more used shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Alvaro Alonso

texts.es: Álvaro de 29 años de edad se dedica a la venta de diferentes artículos como: lámparas, cepillos dentales, baterías, pasta para zapatos, etc. así como muestra la fotografía, vende de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por su variedad de productos ya que también son muy vendibles, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, Álvaro esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más mercadería antes mencionada por mayor ya que tiene mucha demanda y asi obtener mas ganancias para darle a su familia una  mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Álvaro is 29 years old and works selling different articles such as lamps, toothbrushes, batteries, shoe polish, etc. As can be seen in the photo, he is a walking street vendor who sells at different markets close to where he lives. He has many customers due to his variety of highly saleable products. With the profits he makes he is able to pay for some of the household expenses. He lives in the house he owns together with his wife and their two children. 

Álvaro is applying for a loan so that he will be able to buy more of the previously mentioned merchandise in bulk, since he faces a high demand. In this way he can increase his profits and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lamps, toothbrushes, batteries, shoe polish, etc.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es: Celestina a sus 56 años de edad es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo, siempre ha luchado por darle lo mejor a su familia vive en casa propia con su dos hijos, desde hace varios años decidió utilizar su conocimiento sobre la costura, por eso puso un negocio en su lugar de residencia de confección de todo tipo de ropa, a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren, cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para  invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios  como: telas, hilos, elástico, botones, etc. para la elaboración de las de prendas de vestir. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 56 years old, Celestina is an incredible and exemplary woman because she is very hardworking, responsible, and positive; in addition, many people give good references regarding her character and her work. She has always strived to give the best to her family. She lives with her two children in the house that she owns. 

Several years ago, she decided to use her knowledge about sewing, so she set up a sewing business in her residence, making all kinds of clothes at very accessible prices. She also offers quality in her work, which is why many people prefer her. She has a great deal of experience, especially with regular customers who like her more every day. 

Celestina made the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her small business by buying the necessary supplies for making garments, such as fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, etc. She does all this with the goal of giving her customers better service so that they will feel motivated to continue soliciting her work, thereby increasing her sales and her income. She hopes to achieve her objective and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Valens

texts.en: Valens is 31 years old. He sells rice and has been in the business for the past 11 years. He would like to get a loan to buy more rice to sell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha has operated a clothes-selling business for the past four years. She sells in a shop to other town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to buy two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is a 44-year-old woman from a small village in Khashuri district. She is married and lives with her husband, two children (13 and 14 years old) and her mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Her children go to a local school. Maia applied for loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were always rejected, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions.
The only source of income for the family is from agriculture. In particular, they have a milking cow, whose milk is used to make cheese products. Maia produces cheese every day and sells it at local markets at a good price. The income is hardly enough for food for the family. 
According to Credo’s evaluation, the family belongs to the “subsistence poor” category. Maia applied for a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Maia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the credit, Maia will begin trading in clothing and bed-linens. She plans to go to Turkey and buy clothing and bed-linens from wholesalers and then to resell them at higher prices among her villagers. This will give her a chance to increase her family's income. The new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to begin trading in clothing and bed-linens.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is single and has three children, all of whom attend school and are under her care. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

For over three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby and even at the market. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and also competition from fellow sellers.

With the loan that she is requesting, Agness wants to purchase three bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour and butter.

loans.name: Ahmadbek

texts.ru: Ахмадбек живет далеко от города в сельской местности и кредитуется уже 3 цикл в ИМОН. Он честный и порядочный человек и поэтому имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Он использовал предыдущие займы для развития бизнеса. Он более 8 лет занимается этим бизнесом и имеет большого опыта по скотоводству. Он знает все тонкости своего бизнеса и его уважают все его клиенты, а другие бизнесмены знают его как сильного соперника. Ахмадбек как заботливый отец 2 детей и любимый муж трудится упорно для обеспечения своей семьи. Он имеет дополнительный доход от земледелия. В основном он выращивает картошку, пшеницу  и ячмень. Ахмадбек хочет развевать бизнес дальше, так как он нуждается в деньгах. Его дети выросли и требуют всё больше благ. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для покупки скота для увеличения оборотного капитала. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на вашу благотворительность. Этот займ поможет ему увеличить доход и таким образом принесет благополучие и радость в его семье.
texts.en: Ahmadbek lives far from the city, in a rural area, and this is his third time obtaining financing from IMON.  He is an honest and decent person, and this is why he has a good credit history.  He used his previous loans for developing his business.  He has been involved in this business for over 8 years and has a lot of experience in animal husbandry.  He knows all of the nuances of his business and is respected by all of his clients, and other businessmen know him as a strong competitor.  Ahmadbek, as a caring father of two children and a loving husband, works hard to provide for his family.  He has an additional income from farming.  He primarily grows potatoes, wheat and barley.  Ahmadbek wants to develop his business further because he needs money.  His children grew up and require more comforts.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 somoni to buy livestock for increasing his working capital.  He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.  This loan will help him to increase his income and, thus, bring well-being and happiness to his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock for increasing his working capital

loans.name: Naomy

texts.en:
Naomy is 28 years old. She is young in marriage, and she and her husband don't have children. 

She operates a curio shop in Malindi town where she lives with her husband. She also has a motorbike that transports people around at a fee. The major challenges that she faces in the business is competition from other business.

Naomy learned of Milango through an employee. She wants to buy a motorbike to add to the current one in order to improve the income that she gets. She has great plans for her future together with her husband and wants her future children to have better life.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Tierra Fértil  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Tierra Fértil está formado por 9 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, esta parroquia se encuentra rodeada de mucha vegetación, por su geografía accidentada tiene varios paisajes para disfrutar de sus verdes campo y sembríos, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno. Su gente es amable y muy gentil que luchan a diario para mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares, trabajan en diferentes actividades las mismas que le ayudan a mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares, aun mantienen viva las llamas de su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nora, está realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Tierra Fertil. Tiene 51 años es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 20,16 y 15 años de edad, su primer hijo se dedica a trabajar pero solo es para solventar sus gastos personales, sus dos hijos siguientes hijos están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo su taxi, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Doña Nora es toda una profesional en la rama de la costura, esta actividad lo aprendió estudiando y ahora es su fuente de ingreso para su hogar, lleva 22 años ejerciendo su profesión y trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. En su casa también se dedica a la crianza de pollos y cuyes los que vende o es para el consumo de su casa. 

El dinero de su crédito va a ser invertido en la compra de telas, hilos y otros materiales de costura.

Su meta es agrandar su pequeño taller.
texts.en:
The Tierra Fértil group is made up of nine women who live near to the Valle de Cuenca parish. This parish is surrounded by a lot of vegetation, and because of its varied landscape there is a lot of space to enjoy its green fields and farmland. Its architecture is a mix of old and new. The people are very kind and courteous and work hard every day to improve their households' stability. They have various jobs to provide for their families, and they still keep the flames of their culture and traditions alive.
One of the group members is Nora. She is taking out her first loan with her friends and fellow members of the Tierra Fértil group. She is 51, married, and has three children ages 20, 16, and 15. Her eldest child is a taxi driver. They live in their own home.
Nora is an expert and professional in the field of sewing. She learned this in school and it is now a source of income for her home. She has done this work for 22 years, and she works Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule. In her home she also raises chickens and guinea pigs for sale or for household consumption.
The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of fabric, thread, and other sewing materials.
Her goal is to expand her small workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other materials for sewing.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Marie Louise is 32 years old. She is married with one child aged 3. She sells flowers and has been in the business for 9 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more flowers for resale. She has a plan of making more savings from the profits.

loans.use: To buy more flowers to sell.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: Jhon tiene 21 años, está casado y vive en la casas de su madre junto su esposa. Jhon se dedica al servicio de transporte que lo realiza en su mototaxi propio, tiene un vehículo que compró con sus ahorros. Lleva en esta actividad más de 2 años y realiza su trabajo con buenos resultados. Comparte esta labor trabajando como mecánico de forma independiente. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede organizar su tiempo y horario de trabajo, genera sus propios ingresos económicos con el cual puede apoyar en la economía de su hogar, su meta principal es consolidar un taller mecánico en donde brinde servicio de refacción y reparación de mototaxis. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará los materiales necesarios para renovar el tapizado de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Jhon is 21 years old. He is married and lives in his mother's house with his wife. Jhon earns his living providing transportation services in his own mototaxi. He has a vehicle that he bought with his savings. He has been in this business for more than two years, and he has been successful in his work. He also works as an independent mechanic. 

What Jhon likes about his work is that he can organize his own time and work schedule and he generates his own economic income, with which he can contribute to household finances. His main goal is to establish a mechanic's shop where he can provide mototaxi refurbishing and repair services.

At this time, he will request 500 PEN, thanks to all the people who offer him the opportunity to access the financing that he needs to continue working. For his part, he promises to make his loan payments. With the requested loan, he will purchase the necessary materials to refurbish the upholstery of his mototaxi.

loans.use: to buy the materials he needs to refurbish the upholstery of his mototaxi for his business.

loans.name: David Alejandro

texts.es: David tiene 20 años es soltero estudiante de gastronomía. A David  le fascina cocinar  es por eso que decidió estudiar gastronomía ya que lo ve más que una carrera. El tiempo que le dedica a sus estudios es de 15 horas semanales y el resto del tiempo trabaja en un restaurant elegante. David se siente muy contento ya que solo le falta un año para terminar su carrera profesional. Su mayor deseo es viajar en cruceros y trabajar en hoteles de prestigio. El préstamo lo invertirá en la paga de las mensualidades de sus estudios. David agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo ya que podrá cumplir una de las metas  más importantes de su vida.
texts.en:
David is 20 years old and is single.  He is a studying cooking.  David is fascinated by cooking and decided to study cooking because he understands it more than other careers.  He dedicates 15 hours a week to his studies and spends the rest of his time working at a nice restaurant.

David is very happy since he only has one year left of his professional studies.  His greatest desire is to travel on cruise ships and work in prestigious hotels.

He will use this loan to pay his monthly school payments.  David thanks Kiva investors for the loan, since he will now be able to fulfill one of his most important life goals.

loans.use: to pay his monthly school payments

loans.name: Providence

texts.en: Providence is a mother of six children; they all go to school. With the loan, she would like to buy more retail items to resell at her stall, such as flour, yeast and fresh dairy products. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more flour and fresh dairy dairy products to sell at her retail stall

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “MUJERES EXITOSAS” está conformado por 06 socias quienes se dedican a actividades diversas del comercio. Las socias se encuentran contentas por encontrarse pasando el 05 ciclo. Flora tiene 57 años es soltera quien se quedo a cargo de sus pequeños sobrinos al fallecer su hermana. Flora hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de  ropas para bebes en forma ambulatoria en diversos mercados. Años atrás trabajaba en la guardería de un mercado. Es de esta manera que ha podido darles educación y alimentación a sobrinos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropas para bebes de estación de invierno. Su mayor deseo es tener un stand donde pueda trabaja y darles una carrera profesional a sus sobrinos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por ayudarles a mejora la calidad su economía familiar. Flora es la segunda del lado derecho viste casaca marrón.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Exitosas [Successful Women] group is made up of six members who are involved in diverse business activities.  The members are happy in finding themselves in their fifth loan cycle.  

Flora is fifty-seven years old, is single, and has cared for her young nephews since her sister passed away.  For twenty years, Flora has been dedicated to selling baby clothing door-to-door in many markets.  Years ago, she worked at the daycare in a market.  It is because of this that she has been able to provide her nephews with an education and food.  

She will invest the loan in the purchase of baby clothing for winter.  Her greatest dream is to have a stall where she can work, and to give her nephews a professional career.  

The group is thankful to the Kiva investors for helping them to improve the economic standing of their families.  Flora is the second individual from the right, in the brown jacket.

loans.use: to buy baby clothing for winter.

loans.name: Elena Del Carmen

texts.es: Elena de 43 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos. Ella posee una tortillería la cual es muy conocida en la localidad donde reside, tiene muchos clientes pues vende  las mejores tortillas, calientitas y con el servicio más rápido además a precios realmente accesibles; Elena  es una mujer emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, tiene una actitud de ganadora, por eso siempre se mantiene adelante de la competencia, ella piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, quiere correr el riesgo para poder hacer crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor y cal. Elena  tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una vida plena para su familia.
texts.en:
Elena, age 43, lives with her life partner and their three children.  She has a tortilla business, which is very well known in the area where she lives.  She has a lot of customers because she sells the best tortillas.  They are warm, she provides the fastest service, and the prices are truly affordable.  

Elena is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead.  She has a winner’s attitude.  Therefore, she always stays ahead of the competition.  She thinks that when someone wants something, they need to know that it runs a risk.  That is why life is worthwhile.  She wants to run the risk in order to be able to make her business grow.

That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow her to buy corn wholesale and lime powder.  Elena hopes that this way she will be able to bring financial security to her household and a full life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and lime powder.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Джамшед добросовестный и трудолюбивый человек. Он бедный человек и поэтому он живет вместе со своей семьей в старом домике, где нет условия для проживания. Он живет в сельской местности и поэтому он хочет отремонтировать свой дом и создать условию для зимы, так как зимой погода очень холодная и в его районе намечается ограничения света. Он имеют порядочную и счастливую семью. Джамшед имеет 2 детей. Его жена очень добрая и чистоплотная женщина. Джамшед более 15 лет занимается скотоводством, так как климат и условия его местожительства весьма благополучный для скотоводства и выращивания сельхоз культур. Джамшеду помогает его жена введению бизнеса. Джамшед и его семья уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеют денег. Этот план стал для его семьи большой мечтой и реальность этой мечты такова, что Джамшед запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина и т.п. для ремонта дома. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на вашу благотворительность.
texts.en: Jamshed is a conscientious and hardworking person.  He is a poor person and this is why he lives with his family in an old house that is not suited for living.  He lives in a rural area and wants to repair his house and create better living conditions for the winter because the winter weather is very cold, and his district is expected to have limitations on electricity.  He has a decent and happy family.  Jamshed has two children.  His wife is a very kind and pure woman.  Jamshed has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years because the climate and conditions in his place of residence are quite good for animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops.  Jamshed's wife helps him with running the business.  Jamshed and his family have been planning to repair their house, but do not have money.  This plan became a big dream for his family, and the reality of this dream is such that Jamshed is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to purchase construction materials, such as cement, wood, etc., to repair his house.  He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement, wood, etc., to repair his house

loans.name: Najmidin

texts.ru: Наджмидину 50 лет. Он трудолюбивый человек. Наджмидин женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Наджмидин более 5 лет занимается земледелием. Он в основном выращивает картофель на 1 га. Земли и пшеницу на 2 га. земли. Наджмидин несколько лет назад подрабатывал в Российской федерации, но так как он там не имел постоянное место работы, он вернулся на родину и начал свой бизнес земледелием. Он имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Наджмидину помогает его жена введению бизнеса. Он работает упорно с раннего утра до позднего вечера для того, чтобы получить хороший урожай и прокормить свою семью. Он является основным кормильцем в семье. Его сын хочет жениться, но они не имеют денег для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества сына. Этот займ поможет ему сделать счастливым его сына. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Najmidin is 50 years old.  He is a hardworking person.  Najmidin is married and raising five children.  He has been involved in farming for over five years.  He primarily grows potatoes on 1 hectare of land and wheat on 2 hectares of land.  Najmidin spent several years working in the Russian Federation, but because he did not have a permanent place of employment, he returned home and started his own farming business.  He has an additional income from animal husbandry.  His wife helps him to run the business.  He works persistently from early morning to late evening in order to get a good harvest and feed his family.  He is the sole provider for this family.  His son wants to get married, but they do not have money to hold a wedding party.  Najmidin is requesting a loan in the amount of 7000 somoni to hold a wedding celebration for his son.  This loan will help to make his son happy.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a wedding celebration for his son

loans.name: Uba

texts.en:
Uba has operated a business of selling leso cloth (women's wraps, also known as 'kanga'). She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.  She also owns and operates a poultry business.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase 40 pieces of leso cloth to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business. She dreams of expanding, to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of leso cloth to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, comercializa sus productos en agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su familia, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas y todo lo necesario para sus cosechas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The client has made a living in agriculture for several years.  Her main crops are corn and beans.  She markets her products to bulk grains buying and selling agencies.  With the profits that she makes, she helps with the home expenses.  She lives in her own home with her family.

The client is requesting a loan to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and everything else that is necessary for the harvests.  She hopes to make better profits and to give her family a better sense of economic stability.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, and herbicide.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 38 years old. He has been selling flowers, but recently he has changed to another business of selling buckets, for a half a year. He is a father of four children aged between 7 months and 13 years old. Three of them go to school.

Ibrahim has requested the loan to buy more buckets, to resell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more buckets to resell

loans.name: Maritza De La Paz

texts.es: Maritza de 36 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa de un familiar con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes, lociones, cremas, desodorantes, etc. desde hace 3 años, tiene buena clientela ya que sus productos son de muy buena calidad, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Maritza está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más productos antes mencionados por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así podrá darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maritza is 36, she is a single mom and lives at a relative's home with her two children, her activity for three years has been to sell perfumes, lotions, creams, deodorants, etc.  She has a good client base, because her products are good quality, with the earnings she gets, she is able to cover her living expenses, Maritza is requesting a loan to buy more of the products mentioned above at wholesale prices because this is her only source of income and this way she can give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions and deodorants at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Jose Melvin

texts.es: Jose de 34 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa y su hija. El posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que el realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; él es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo responsable y honesto, jose está  solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, botones, y todo lo relacionado con la costura y también comprar una maquina rana que le vende ya usada ya que el solo cuenta con una maquina de coser, para seguir con su trabajo y satisfacer la necesidad de los clientes y así el  podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, age 34, lives in a relative’s house with his wife and his daughter.  He has a tailoring shop in his home where he makes different types of clothes.  He has currently made a lot of customers because the work he does is excellent, and he sells at truly affordable prices.  He is a man who is very dedicated to his work; and he is responsible and honest.

Jose is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy fabric, thread, needles, buttons, and everything having to do with sewing.  He will also buy a used overlock type sewing machine because he only has one sewing machine.  He will do this in order to continue with his work and to satisfy his customers’ needs.  This way he will be able to have a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, buttons, and an overlock type sewing machine.

loans.name: Maximiliano

texts.es:
Maximiliano tiene 51 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es una persona muy trabajadora, honesta, servicial y responsable, trabaja en la agricultura siembra maíz y maicillo. Desde los 20 años de edad trabaja; fue  su padre quien le enseño el cultivar del maíz y a medida que fue creciendo fue aprendiendo y obteniendo mas experiencia en el cultivo. Luego, se caso formando una familia con formada por 3 hijos, 2 varones y una hembra  los dos varones uno tiene 15 años y el otro tiene 12 y la niña tiene 6 años los tres estudian, los varones después que vienen de la escuela  comen y hacen las tareas y después trabajan en el  mantenimiento, limpieza del cultivo del maíz. también se dedica al trabajo de la construcción como ayudante de albañil esto con el tiempo lo aprendió trabajando con empresas que lo contrataban y así a podido llevar el sustento a la mesa de su casa para su familia.

Para compra los implemento que utiliza en la siembra, tiene que viajar a una distancia de 2 kilómetros; pero aveces no los encuentra ahí, por lo que se ve obligado a trasladarse a otro lugar. 

    El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 25 libras de maíz y el abono para trabajar en este invierno que ya empezó, él tiene alquilado el terreno para sembrar. De esta manera, cosechara la alimentación de su familia y que no falte durante todo el año. En el futuro planea comprar una vaca o dos para generar otro ingreso al a casa.
texts.en:
Maximiliano is 51 years old, married and the father of three. He is a very hard working, honest, helpful and responsible person. He has worked in agriculture planting corn and sorghum since he was 20 years old. His father taught him to grow corn and through this experience he was able to grow, learn and obtain greater agricultural experience. After gaining experience, he married and formed a family of his wife, two sons and one daughter. His sons are 15 and 12 years old and his little girl is six years old. All three are in school. Every day after school the boys eat, do their homework and then work in the maintenance and cleaning of the crops. Maximiliano also works as an assistant to a mason, which he learned working for businesses that have contracted him. In this way, he has been able to put food on the table for his family. 

To buy the tools needs for planting he has to travel two kilometers. At times upon arrival he is not able to find the tools there and is then forced to travel elsewhere. 

He is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy 25 pounds of corn and the fertilizer needed to work during the season that has just begun. He rents the land where he plants. In this way, he will harvest food for his family and will not be in need all year. In the future he plans to buy a cow or two to generate other earnings for the home.

loans.use: to buy 25 pounds of corn and fertilizer to work during the harvest season that just began.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn, 33 years of age, is married to a soldier and blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store of personal products for almost ten years. With this business, she's earning a net income of 500 PHP daily. She also sell home products and school supplies as an additional source of income. She would like to request a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase hair accessories, hair combs, and fashion accessories to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase hair acessories, hair combs, and fashion accessories to sell

loans.name: Jaya

texts.en:
Jaya lives in Bogor, a semi-urban area about an hour from Jakarta. Jaya is married and lives with four persons in the family home. 

Jaya runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits. Jaya began working with Ruma 3 1/2 months ago because he wanted to try the mobile air time business. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. 

For the last three months, he has made around $30 to $35 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Ngorn's Group

texts.en:
Ngorn, 58, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Ngorn and her husband earn a living as farmers. They have been farming rice for fifteen years, earning about 19,000 KHR per day to spend for the family’s needs.

Ngorn has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her current business. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. 

Ngorn hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Alvin

texts.en:
Alvin is 49 years old and married with three children.

Alvin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like snack foods, soft drinks, candies, canned goods, noodles, etc. in her general store.

Alvin has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Alvin aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like snack foods, soft-drinks, candies, canned goods, noodles, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Isaf

texts.en:
Isaf runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. Isaf lives in Serang, a semi-urban area about 2 hours from Jakarta. Isaf is single and living with 4 persons in the family home.

Isaf began working with Ruma 1 year ago because he is interested in selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last 3 months, he has had around $170-173 in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
This is Anna, 35, a resident of Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Efren, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Anna owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one jeepney unit (14-16 person capacity), which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney. 

Anna dreams to continuously expand her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es: Gloria de 46 años es integrante del grupo “Madres Unidas” conformada por 08 personas dinámicas que luchan cada día por  salir adelante. Gloria una socia activa  y se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, la cual viene siguiendo este esta actividad hace más de 04 años. Gracias a su esfuerzo a mejorar su vivienda y con la ayuda de su pareja pudo comprar su moto, la cual lo trabaja él. En esta oportunidad solicitó para la  compra de azúcar, leche, arroz y bebidas. Seguir implementado su negocio es su mayor deseo. Gloria es casada y tiene  03 hijos en etapa escolar. El grupo “Madres Unidas” agradece el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Gloria se encuentra sentada es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo naranjado y casaca marón.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 46, is a member of the “Madres Unidas” group.  The group is comprised of eight dynamic people who struggle every day to get ahead.  Gloria is an active member, and she sells basic needs products.  She has been involved in this business activity for over four years.  Thanks to her effort to improve her house, and with her life partner’s help, she was able to buy the motorcycle that he works with.

This time she requested a loan to buy sugar, milk, rice, and drinks.  Continuing with her business is her greatest wish.  Gloria is married and has three school age children.

The “Madres Unidas” group is grateful for the loan provided, and they pledge to continue working well.  Gloria is seated in the first row on the left, and she is wearing an orange shirt and a brown jacket.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, rice, and drinks.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty works hard to support her family. Betty is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Betty requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat. Betty has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, Betty would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Gelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gelma works hard to support her family. She farms fruits in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  

Gelma is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her fruit farming business.

Gelma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is widowed and 62 years old. She has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  She has a food vending business, in the Philippines. She has been engaged in this business for two years.

Vicenta requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients, to use in preparing the foods she will sell. Vicenta would like to save money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to use in preparing food to sell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a hard-working woman who strives hard to support her family at large.  Here again she comes to you for another loan of KES 50,000 to buy stock, i.e lotions, shampoo, hair braids and necklaces for her cosmetics business.

loans.use: to buy stock, i.e lotions, shampoo, hair braids and necklaces for her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Residing in the Ponhea Luer district of Kandal province, Ya is 18 years old. He earns a living by farming rice in the local area. Ya is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day, and he manages to save about 12,000 KHR each day after daily living expenses.

Ya has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, he is applying for a loan with VisionFund. He will use his loan to cover his entire tuition fees to study Korean language short course for three months. He hopes this loan will enable him to keep studying until graduation. Graduating will help him to get a good job, so he will be able to support and improve the family.

loans.use: To cover his entire tuition fees and study until graduation

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng is 42 years old and is the married mother of two children, one of whom is still in school. She lives in the Pursat province. For the past 22 years Sokheng has struggled to feed her family by farming rice and raising pigs while her husband is a vet in their local area. From the current business she can earn about 24,500 KHR per day and manage to save 10,000 KHR per day after daily expenses. 

This is the second micro-loan for Sokheng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely paid back her prior loan which helped her to expand her farmland. Now she is seeking a loan to buy pig feed. She hopes that the loan will improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy pig feed.

loans.name: Enghak

texts.en:
Enghak is aged 31 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area located in the Sa Ang district, Cambodia. 

Enghak is a rice farmer who grows mango and cassava; she has been in this business for 10 years. The current business earns her family about US $8 per day to feed the family, but she manages to save about US $3 each day.

This is the fifth loan for Enghak with Kiva partner VisionFund. Now she is applying for another loan with VisionFund. Enghak is going to use her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be determined and optimistic. He works in a quarry to get his income. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the fact that business at times is low. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank in order to store clean water. Eight members of the family will benefit from the tank bought. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a Kiva borrower. He works in a quarry to make his income. He describes his biggest family challenge to be short rains and rationed water supply in the area. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water tank in order to store clean water. Four members of John's family will benefit from the tank bought, as well as some visitors. John hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a lorry to supply building materials. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Naphtali

texts.en: Naphtali is a Kiva borrower. She operates a beauty salon where she does hair treatment and hair plaiting. She will use this loan of KES 15,000 to buy a water tank. Her family will benefit from the tank. Naphtali faces a challenge of continuous supply of water. She will use the water tank to ensure there is an adequate water supply in the house. She hopes that in future she will have a bigger tank. This is Naphtali's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 56-year-old married man. He describes himself to be patient and trustworthy. He operates rental houses where he charges customers rent to stay in his houses. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a densely populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be sabotage by competitors. He will use the loan of Kes 30000 to repair his rental houses and pay his water bill. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to repair his rental houses and pay his water bill

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 42-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as reliable. She operates a poultry business where she rears chicken to sell. She also operates a green grocery where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. She will use this 20,000 KES loan to expand her poultry business by adding more poultry and vegetables to sell in her grocery store. Her business goal is to be a leading poultry supplier within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business to meet growing demand.

loans.use: expand her poultry business by adding more poultry and vegetables for sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a Kiva borrower aged 32. She is married and has one child aged four years. She describes herself as trustworthy and humble. 

She has taken a loan of KES 8,895 to buy a gas cooker that will benefit her family members. The family faces a challenge of using firewood when preparing food hence the need for a gas cooker. She operates a grocery store to earn an income. She hopes that in future she will expand her business so that it will increase her income. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Beth

texts.en: Beth is a 42-year-old married woman with five children. She describes herself as a trustworthy woman. She operates a tailoring business in Rongai area. She describes the area as busy and with inadequate infrastructure. She is applying for a loan of KES 20,000, which will be used to buy materials for sewing i.e threads,sheets of cloth needles etc. The anticipated profits will be used to buy another sewing machine and employ more employees. This is her first loan application to SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy materials for sewing i.e threads,sheets of cloth, needles etc

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is a married  woman; she lives in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her five kids.

She has been operating a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal sellers in her area. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is divorced and has three children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Naomi is a successful businesswoman. She sells groundnuts in Asekai (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 10 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Naomi uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Naomi will use the loan to purchase a larger quantity of groundnuts, which will enable her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Naomi plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of groundnuts, enabling her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Monicah
