texts.en: Monicah is a married woman. She has five children between the ages of 7 and 19. She describes herself as humble. She operates a tailoring retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located within a market area. She describes her biggest business challenge as low bargaining power from customers. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to purchase tailoring materials. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be a successful businesswoman. This is her second loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has two children, both of whom attend school and are under her care. She rents a house that has electricity, but no piped water. 

For over four years, she has operated a business selling second-hand clothes. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby, and even at the market. She faces major challenges of seasonality in her business, and competition from fellow sellers.

With the loan that she is requesting, Christine wants to purchase three bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis is 30 years old,  married and a mother of two children aged seven and two years. She owns a kiosk where she sells a variety of goods, a business she started two years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES. 15,000. 

This marks her third time borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase 50kg of cooking fat, bales of flour, boxes of bar soap and washing detergents and the anticipated profit to repay her loan. 


She hopes to see her business grow into a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase 50 kgs of cooking fat, bales of flour, boxes of bar soap and washing detergents.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 24 лет. Она заботливая мать троих хорошеньких дочерей. Мунира проживает со своей семьей и с родителями  мужа в районе Кубадиён. Это южная часть страны, климат которого благоприятствует здесь ведению сельского хозяйства. Мунира по характеру трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Она уже пять лет в области животноводства. Мунира в основном занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Этому виду деятельности она научилась еще в юности у своего отца. Мунира закупает коров и телят с близлежащих скотных рынков и после 30-35 дней откорма отводит их туда же на продажу. Кроме этого Мунира еще занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. Она во дворе своего дома выращивает кукурузу и использует ее листья для корма скота. Ей в бизнесе помогают свекор и свекровь. Она берет кредит для закупа коров и телят. Благодаря кредиту Мунира сможет увеличить поголовье продаваемого крупно-рогатого скота и таким образом улучшить качество жизни.
texts.en: Munira is a young, married woman, age 24.  She is a caring mother of three wonderful daughters.  Munira lives with her family and her husband's parents in Qubadiyon, Tajikistan.  It is located in the southern part of the country where the climate is excellent for agriculture.  By character, Munira is a hard working and kind woman.  She has worked in the field of livestock for five years.  Munira mostly breeds cattle.  She learned this skill in her youth from her father.  She buys cows and calves from a nearby livestock market and after 30-35 days of fattening them, she takes them back to the market and sells them.  Munira also raises crops.  In the yard of her home, she grows corn, the leaves from which she feeds to her animals.  Her mother and father-in-law help her run the business.  She is taking out a loan to buy cows and calves.  Thanks to this loan, Munira will be able to increase the number of animals she sells which will increase her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy five cows for her livestock business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He is 41, married, and the father of three. 

Moses owns a carpentry shop in his town; he started the business from a contribution received from his parents. Moses learned of Milango through his friends, and now seeks a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to buy a lathe machine. 

He will save the extra income raised, and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase timber and lathe machine.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is married, and lives in Mombasa Kenya. 

For the past three years, she has been selling sweet potatoes. She learned about Milango through a friend, and now seeks a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy sweet potatoes to sell. 

She wants her business to grow, and to employ people to help her run the business. The major challenge for her is to find clients.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kilifi, Kenya; she is married and blessed with three children. 

Mary makes and sells roofing materials commonly referred to as "makuti."; they are made from palm leaves. 

She learned of Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to help her buy more palm leaves.  

After five years she hopes to start another business. The extra income received will help her better the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut leaves and threads to make roofing materials.

loans.name: Munga

texts.en:
Munga, 33, lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani, Kenya. He is a husband and a father of four. 

For one year now he has been buying fish from the fishermen and selling it to the villagers. He started his business by selling two of his goats. The major challenge in the business is price fluctuation.

He heard of Milango from friends and since he wanted to access credit, he immediately joined. He now seeks a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy 100kgs of fish for resale. His goal is to own a shop in five years time. He will save the extra income he gets from the use of the loan.

loans.use: to buy 100 kgs of fish.

loans.name: Merite

texts.en:
Merita is a 37-year-old married mother of three children aged 4 to 5 years old. Together with her family she lives in the western part of Kosovo. She operates a tailoring business and her husband is a baker with a very low salary. Merita has been a seamstress for the past 14 years and makes tablecloths, curtains, skirts, and dresses for weddings, special events and casual wear for her local customers. She really enjoys her work. 

For the first time she is requesting a loan through KosInvest to buy material for her work and a new sewing machine, since she has been using the same machine for many years. She has been sustaining her business through her own efforts and all of her hard work and dedication. She hopes to increase her income and to expand her business in the future. She is happy for the financial support because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all lenders!

loans.use: To buy material and a new sewing machine for her work

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.en:
In the photo above are primary school teachers from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of hard working and dedicated teachers have come to Kiva field partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) to apply for a loan of SLL 8,800,000.00 for the entire group. With the help of the staff loan products specifically designed to meet the needs of low paid staff, these teachers will be able to buy goods or invest in projects that, left alone with their salaries, they would not be able to buy or invest in. But with this loan, they are being empowered and at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan. It is their school's bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

The featured leader of this group is Ruth. Ruth is a native of Gorama, she is 36. Ruth is married to a contractor. For 12 years now, Ruth has been a professional teacher. She has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Jesee

texts.en:
Jesee lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. He has no children and has been doing farming work for 12 years. His primary income sources are milk, tea, crops, and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'The reliable income and freedom to engage in various projects.' His biggest challenge is 'lack of workers and too much rain.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of Storia.

Jesee was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, 'due to the favourable loan terms.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Microfinance is for small projects and can help people to grow.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Jesee replied, 'I shall expand my projects.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jesee owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a motorcycle. He does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, and DVD, but does not have solar power or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and pipes

loans.name: Otamurod

texts.ru: Отамурод молодой и энергичный человек. Он женат и на воспитании 1 не совершеннолетнего ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием их ребенка, а также она помогает своему мужу по введению бизнеса. Отамурод более 5 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картошка, пшеница и т.п. Он имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Он упорно работает с раннего утра до позднего вечера для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги построить жилой дом. Он живет вместе со своей семьёй в старом и маленьком доме. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки минерального удобрения и горючего для своей земли. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Otamurod is a young, energetic man.  He is married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker and spends her time rearing their offspring.  She also helps her husband run their business.  For five years, Otamurod has worked in farming, growing crops like potatoes, grains, etc.  He has supplemental income from working with livestock.  He works hard from early morning until late in the night in order to save money to build a home.  He lives with his family in an a small, old house.  He is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy mineral fertilizers and fuel for his land.  He awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and fuel for the land where he grows potatoes and wheat

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: After graduating primary school, Stella decided to set up her own fish and meat business in ASEKAI (near Cape Coast). With over two years of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more fish and meat  for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a customs officer) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their four children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and meat  for resale.

loans.name: Corazones De Turi  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Corazones de Turi está formado por 10 mujeres quienes viven en la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es conocida por ser el mirador de la ciudad ya desde lo más alto se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca,  su gente se dedica al comercio, crianza de animales y a la agricultura, son muy trabajadoras siendo su principal objetivo el  sacara en adelante a sus familias, son personas amables y gentiles que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Targelia, forma parte del grupo de crédito Corazones de Turi  desde hace 3 años, su grupo de crédito le gusta por el compañerismo que existe entre todas sus integrantes, la unión y la solidaridad, haciéndole más solidó a su grupo.

La Señora. María Targelia tiene 45 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, sus dos primeros hijos ya son casados y viven independientes, sus dos últimos hijos tienen 16 y 8 años de edad, el uno trabaja y su último hijo está estudiando en la escuela de la localidad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casita en la que viven es de propia.

Doña María Targelia pasa la mayor parte de su tiempo en el cuidado de su familia, pero siempre busca la manera de mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar, para lo cual se dedica a la cría de cerdos, pollos, cuyes y ganado, también se dedica a la agricultura.

Su nuevo crédito va ha invertir en la compra de pollos, cuyes, su alimento para sus animales y semillas para sus cultivos. 

Su meta es tener más animales para la venta.
texts.en:
The credit group Corazones de Turi comprises ten women who live in the parish of Turi in Cuenca. This parish is known for being the city's vantage point. From the top you can see most of the city of Cuenca. Its people work as merchants, raising animals, and farming. They are very hard workers and their main goal is to provide for their families. They are kind and courteous people who still maintain their culture and traditions. 

One of the members of this group is María Targelia. She has belonged to the credit group Corazones de Turi for three years. She enjoys her credit group because of the team-spirit there is among all of the members. Their unity and solidarity makes the group more solid. 

María Targelia is 45 years old, married, and has four children from her marriage. Her two oldest are already married and live on their own, and her two youngest are sixteen and eight years old. One works and her youngest goes to the local school. Her husband works in construction and they own the small house where they live.

María Targelia spends most of her time taking care of her family, but she is always looking for ways to improve her household's financial stability, which is why she works raising pigs, chickens, Guinea pigs, and cattle. She also farms. 

She will invest her new loan in the purchase of chickens, Guinea pigs, feed for her animals, and seeds for her crops. 

Her goal is to have more animals to sell.

loans.use: to buy chickens, Guinea pigs, animal feed, and seeds.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu lives in Mariakani, Kenya. She is single mother of two. For more than three years she has been running a grocery store. She has also introduced charcoal as a commodity that she sells to the locals. She invested a small amount of money she had saved before to start the business. She learned of Milango through friends and since she wanted credit she decided to join. 

She now seeks a loan that will enable her to buy charcoal in larger quantities so that she can sale wholesale. She has an ambition of owning a wholesale shop in future. The income from the loan will enable to her educate her children with the best education that is available.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in Mombasa, Kenya. For the last three years he has been running a nursery school and this has been his business. He is married and blessed with three children all of whom attend school. He wants to buy stationery for the school and that is why he seeks a loan. He is a teacher by profession. 

His goal is to admit up to 200 pupils in to the school in the next five years. The challenges he faces in this business is parents not paying fees on time. Also he faces alot of competition from other nursery schools that are more established. He intends to use the income generated from this loan to pay school fees for his children. He has a passion for educating children and this loan will help a great deal in making sure that he takes part in the growth and development of the next generation.

loans.use: to buy stationery

loans.name: Bendera

texts.en: Bendera applied for her first loan on Kiva and she got it. She paid the loan back without difficulty, and the business is doing great. Alongside her retail shop, she has been selling building blocks. The business supplements her income from the retail shop. She seeks another Kiva loan to buy more building blocks for resale. The major challenges that she faces in running this business is the high cost of transportation. She works hard everyday to have better livng standards for her family. She also wants to educate her children and ensure that they get the best education available.

loans.use: to buy building blocks.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Please meet 31-year-old Mohammed from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round-time marketers," traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

Mohammed completed 12 grades and is unmarried. He describes himself as a serious businessman. His fiancee is a businesswoman.  They have a 5-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. 

Mohammed has a shop where he has been selling cement for the past two years now. He works 10 hours each day. With this loan, he will buy more cement to resell. One of the greatest challenges that he faces is fewer goods in his shop. He transports his goods by truck.  He started his business with a loan from his father. He is proud of his business because he makes a good profit. His plan is to open a store. He thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: he will buy more cement to resell.

loans.name: Ana Felicita

texts.es: Ana de 48 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa y otros productos de higiene personal su negocio lo tiene ubicado en las afueras del hospital que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia,  con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, vive en casa de su mama junto a ella y su hermana, Ana está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor y así poder surtir su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y seguir solventado los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Ana is 48, she sells clothes and personal hygiene products, her business is located outside the hospital that is close to her residence.  With the profits she makes, she is able to cover her home expenses, she lives at home with her mom and sister, Ana is requesting a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale and this way be able to stock her business and earn more income to continue paying for her home expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothes and personal hygiene products at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en:
Tawa is 55 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is married, and she does not know how to read or write. She has four children aged between 38 and 19 who live on their own. She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

For the past seven years she has been selling peppers, oil, salt, etc. in the local market. She sells six day a week from 7AM to 5PM. She likes her business because she has a lot of customers, and she started this business with money given to her by husband. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her goods at her table. 

Tawa is requesting a loan to purchase more peppers, oil, and salt for her business. Her dream is to build a house for her children.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more peppers, oil, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has six children, aged 22, 20, 19, 16, 14 and 5 years. In 1993, Kadiatu established her rice and stew, couscous and fried rice with meat business. She began her business because she wants to fight poverty and to be independent. She opens her business six days a week and 10 hours a day. She earns 1,200,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy bags of rice, palm oil and cooking oil. She hopes that this loan will help increase her profit by Le 800,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to transform to a standard restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, palm oil and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 43-year-old single mother of five children. She sells grocery goods, a business she started 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 23,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She has requested a first loan of 20,000 KES to purchase fruits, vegetables, potatoes and carrots for sale. The profit she earns will be ploughed back to her business. Her dream is to lead a successful life.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables, potatoes and carrots for sale

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 35 years old and married with three children, ages 1 year to 12 years old. He runs a musical and video disc business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. Two of his children are going to school and has two additional dependents at home.

He has been in this business since 2000 and sells a variety of musical and video disc within a busy market area.  He says that the main challenge to his business is delay in transporting his goods.

Edward requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase a variety of musical and video discs. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him to educate his children and increase his business. In the future, he would like to expand his business more than even. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of musical and video discs  for resale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 33-year-old business woman from Liberia. She is married and has three children, between 15 and 6.  Three of them are currently attending school and live at home. She has completed grade 7 before starting her business.  She describes herself as hardworking. She lives and works in Gbarnga, the capital City of Bong County. Bong is located in the centre of the country and is an agricultural hub. The majority of residents are farmers growing rice, palm oil and cassava. 

Mercy has a table business which sells local fish for the past two years.  She works 10 hours at her business. Her greatest challenge is few goods. She intends to use the loan to buy more fish to resell. She started her business by selling to friends. She likes her business because she gets more money from her business.  She hopes to one day own a shop.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advanced for their help.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu is 29 years old and lives in Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the centre of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers, producing rice, palm oil and cassava. She has a market table where she has been selling milk, candle, toothpaste, battery etc for the past four years. She works at her business nine hours a day. She transports her goods to her business by bus. The biggest challenge she faces in her business is she wants to change the waiter-market business to palm oil and dry meat business. She did not go to school. She has four children between one and ten. Only three are at home and in school. With the proceeds from the loan, she wants to change her business by buying palm oil and dry meat to resell. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. She started her business with money from her mother. In the future, she wants to own a house. She is proud of her business because she gets money every day for her expenses. She wants to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to change her business by buying palm oil and dry meat to resell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 53-year-old single mother of five children who are between 15 and 6 years old.  She has both a cereals and a cutlery business in Kapcholoi and has been in operation for over three years, earning an income of KES 16,000.

With her second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, she intends to purchase stock of green grams, beans and maize for resale.  The profits she earns from her business will be used as savings and to purchase a plot and develop it.

Her dream is to improve the living standards of her family and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals for resale

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 36 years old, married, and supports four people. He runs a furniture making business in Kapsabet town in Nandi County. This has been his income generating business for the last 7 years; he earns an average monthly income of KES 18,000. 

He has borrowed a loan of KES 70,000, which is his fifth loan with KADET LTD. With this loan he will be able to pay college fees for his brother. Alfred anticipates getting profits from his construction business, which he will use to expand his business by increasing more models of furniture to meet his clients' demands. 

Alfred hopes to improve his living standards and be financially stable; he also hopes to be able to save money for school fees for his children as well as expand his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Please meet 26-year-old Naomi, from Buchanan, the capital of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. Buchanan is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are based in the city. Residents love eating fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

Naomi is single and she completed grades 9 before starting her business. She has two children, aged 3 and 10. One child is in school, and both live at home. Naomi describes herself as hardworking woman. 

Naomi has a shop that sells artificial hair and perfume. She has been in this business for 8 years and works from Monday to Saturday, 10 hours per day. With this loan, she will buy artificial hair and perfume.  

One of Naomi’s greatest challenges is to increase her sales. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her boyfriend.  She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. 

Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy artificial hair and perfume.

loans.name: Welleh

texts.en:
Welleh is 34 years old, and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. Welleh is married and has three children living at home between 1 and 16 years old, two of which are in school. She stopped her own education in 12th grade. 

For the past three years she has been selling soft drinks. She started this business with a small amount of money from her aunty, and she learned the business from her as well.  She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business, and as a result she hopes to have more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, only 24 years of age, has been running her own salon in Mombasa, Kenya for three years. The hair stylist has faced several challenges so far, including competition in the market, the high price of cosmetics, the cost of electricity and inflation rates. 

Catherine has a plan, in the next five years, to open a cosmetics shop alongside her salon. This will enable her to maximize the income she earns since her customers will be buying cosmetics from her shop.

Catherine learned of Milango through her friends at a time she really needed to finance her business. She received a previous loan with Milango that she repaid without problems. Catherine is now requesting a new loan to buy shelves, braids and weaves for her salon.  She is working hard to make sure that she has a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy shelves, braids and weaves.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 39 years old and she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

Betty is married with seven children between one and 16 years old, only five of whom are in school and live at home. She did not go to school, but she is good at managing her business. For the past three years, she has been selling slippers in the local market. She started this business with a little amount from her mother and she learned this business from her. She likes how people respond to her business, and mostly she enjoys the interaction with her customers. She spends eight hours with her business, six day a week.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. She hopes to get more money and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Siah is 30 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu (cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.) Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

Siah and her fiance stay together. She did not go to school. She has three children between 8 and 1 years old. Two of her children are in school and they all live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling rubber dishes (bowls, cups, spoons, plates, etc.) in the local market in order to help her children. She started this business by selling for her mother, and she learned this business from her. She likes her business because of the ways people respond to it. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business in hopes of having more money to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes (bowls, cups, spoons, plates, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Dhahabu

texts.en:
Dhahabu started a retail shop that is picking up now. The 39-year-old mother and wife seeks another Kiva loan to buy five bundles of flour, two sacks of sugar and 20 liters of cooking oil. 

She started the retail shop from the savings she had made from selling coconut leaves known as "makuti." She has great hope that the business will grow into being a wholesale shop someday. 

She had previously taken a loan to pay school fees for her children, and the loan is currently paying back. The loan will enable her to generate money from the business to repay the school fee loan that she has. She has eight children together with her husband. The challenge she faces is price changes.

loans.use: to buy five bundles of flour, two sacks of sugar and 20 liters of cooking oil.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is married, with four children. She has received some schooling until the end of senior high school. 

Currently, Cynthia sells second-hand clothing in Sekai (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about seven years now. Her husband is a driver. Cynthia’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. 

Cynthia will use the loan to increase her existing second-hand clothing capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Cynthia plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing second-hand clothing capacity.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Rebecca did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Rebecca sells cassava and plantains in Sekai (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about four years. She is married to a farmer and, together, they have two children. Rebecca uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Rebecca will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of cassava and plantain, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Rebecca wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of cassava and plantain to sell.

loans.name: Samara

texts.ru: Самара, 28 лет, замужем, многодетная мать, имеет 5 детей (5 дочерей). Сразу же по окончании школы вышла замуж. Самой старшей из дочек 10 лет, самой младшей 2 года. Образование - среднее. С 2003 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 20000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет 5000 сом (KGS). Супруг помогает по хозяйству. На сегодняшний день она смогла развить своё хозяйство. В хозяйстве у нее имеется 1 дойная корова и 15 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства Самара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35 000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы. Доходы от кредита Самара  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве, а также на образование детей.
texts.en: Samara is 28 years old, married and has five children (five daughters).  She got married right after finishing school.  Her oldest daughter is 10 years old, and the youngest is two years old.   Samara has a secondary education.  She has been involved in animal husbandry since 2003, having started this business with an amount of 20,000 som (KGS).  The family's monthly profit amounts to 5000 som (KGS).  Samara's husband helps her with the business.  To-date, she was able to develop her business.  She has one dairy cow and fifteen sheep.  In order to further develop her business, Samara requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy one cow.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities in her business and also into her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio, está acompañado y disfruta de un hijo de 6 años de edad, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. El se dedica  al comercio de ganado, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años, negocio que lo fundo por iniciativa propia, hasta el momento no tiene ningún problema alguno  y lo desempeña todos los días.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar seis terneros para luego comercializarlos; esta inversión le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias poder  ofrecerle a su familia la alimentación.
Su sueño es apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Antonio has a spouse and delights in his six-year-old son; he has no relatives abroad.  He works as a cattle merchant, an activity he’s been in for five years.  He started the business on his own initiative and to date has no problems; he works every day.

The loan he needs will make it possible for him to buy six calves to subsequently sell.  This investment will help him strengthen the business and the profits will allow him to provide food for his family.  His dream is to support his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy six calves.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Please meet 36-year-old Felecia from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Felecia completed 9 grades and is single.  She has two children ages 18 and 7.  They are in school and live at home. 

Felecia has owned her own shop selling used shoes for the past seven years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more used shoes for her business. On average, she works 8hours at her business.  She started her business with money from her mother. She transports her merchandise by taxi.  She cites small income as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the profit making.  In the future, she would like to build a house.  
She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more used shoes for her business.

loans.name: Finna

texts.en:
Finna is a 40-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is married and has three children, between 25 and 16 years old.  Only two are currently attending school, and they all live at home.  Finna did go to school, but engages in business to help herself.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. It is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating 'fufu,' a dish made from a cassava-based dough that is typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.
 
Finna has a table business, where she has sold pepper, oil, bitter-ball, okra and other food ingredients, for the past three years. She started her business with money she got from her husband.  She works at her business from 8:00AM to 4:00PM each day.  Her greatest challenge in business is low income. She intends to use the loan to buy more pepper, oil, bitter-ball, okra and other food ingredients to resell at her table.  She likes her business, because it helps her to support her home.  

Finna hopes one day to own a house. She wants to thank the Kiva lenders, in advance, for their help.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, oil, bitter-ball, okra and other food ingredients to resell at her table

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 42 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city of Buchanan are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She lives in Buchanan along with her husband and seven children between the ages of 20 and 12; only three of her children are in school. She has been running a shop that sells fast food like bread, eggs, tea etc for the past two years in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bread, eggs, tea etc for her business. She likes her business because it helps to support her home.  She hopes to one day to own a house. 
 
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, eggs,tea etc for her business

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 55 años de edad es una mujer muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Reina desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y dos nietos, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y así ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Reina, 55, is a very responsible woman whose main priority is moving her family forward.  She sells tortillas that she makes every noon and evening.  Her business is located at home.  Reina would very much like to improve her business because it produces very stable profits which make it possible for her to support her family.  She lives in her own house with her two children and two grandchildren and this is why she’s asking for a loan by means of which she can buy corn at wholesale and lime powder so that she can make a larger amount of tortillas especially on weekends when demand rises because many tortilla shops close and she can earn higher profits to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and lime powder.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахнозе 30 лет. Она несчастливая женщина. Ее муж бросил ее и их 2 детей. Шахноза воспитывает своих детей сама. Она имеет 2 дочерей, которым 10 и 4 года. Шахноза работает в банке. Она является оператором денежного перевода. Шахноза любит свою работу и честно выполняет свою работу. Ее коллеги знают ее как порядочную и честную женщину. Шахноза имеет стаж более 7 лет. Она несколько лет сделала сбережения и  недавно сделала ремонт дома. Она теперь хочет купить мебель и технику для своего домохозяйства. Ее девочки очень обрадовались, когда узнали об ее плане и ждут не с терпением новой мебели и современной технологии. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки мебели и техники для ее детей. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shahnoza is 30 years old.  She is not a lucky woman.  Her husband left her and their two children.  Shahnoza is raising the children by herself.  She has two daughters, who are 10 and 4 years old.  Shahnoza works at a bank.  She is an operator of money transfers.  Shahnoza loves her work and does it with honesty.  Her colleagues knows her as a decent and honest woman.  Shahnoza has over 7 years of experience.  She has been saving money for several years and recently made repairs to her house.  She now wants to purchase furniture and electronics for her household.  Her girls got very happy when they learned about her plan and eagerly wait for new furniture and modern electronics.  Shahnoza is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 US dollars to purchase furniture and electronics for her children.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: purchase furniture and electronics for her children

loans.name: Esther Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Esther Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Sekai (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for many years. 

Esther Abena is married and has one child. Her husband works as a manager. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Esther Abena wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions. In the long term, Esther Abena plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions.

loans.name: Delmy Carolina

texts.es: Delmy de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda desde hace varios años, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, pero esas ganancias no le alcanza para poder mejorar su vivienda por eso Delmy está solicitando un crédito para cambiar el techo, mejorar la cocina y realizar una división de tabla roca para poder hacer unos cuartos, pero no cuenta con capital suficiente para poder comprar todos los materiales como: cemento, arena, tejas de barro, tabla roca, pago de mano de obra, etc. por esa razón solicita el crédito y así poder realizar el cambio en su vivienda y que toda la familia pueda vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Delmy, 31, lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  She’s had a small store for several years and with profits earned is able to cover some of her household expenses.  But these profits aren’t enough to be able to do home improvements and this is why Delmy is asking for a loan to replace the roof, improve the kitchen and make some drywall divisions to make some rooms but she does not have sufficient capital to be able to buy all the materials like cement, sand, clay roofing tiles, drywall, to pay labor costs, etc.  This is the reason for requesting the loan so she can make the changes at home and the entire family can live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 56-year-old Julia from Bulawayo. She is married with five children. All her children are going to school. Julia runs a retail business. She sells new clothes for kids, women and men. She also sells footwear and African attire. The business has been in operation for over 30 years and has been her source of income since then. She says the main challenges faced are price wars and high import duty when bringing goods from outside the country. She has requested a loan of $500 to buy clothes for women , men and children for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay for her children's educational fees and other business expenses, thus improving the family's lifestyle. In the future, Julia plans to open numerous outlets and and increase her business capacity.

loans.use: to buy men, women and children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 42 year old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city of Buchanan are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. she and her family live in Buchanan. She has seven children between the ages of 22 and 7; only three are currently in school. She been selling red oil, pepper, salt etc for the past two years in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper, salt etc for her business, She likes her business because it helps to support her home.  She hopes to one day to own a house.  She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, pepper, salt, etc for her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Please meet 47-year-old John from Gbarnga in Liberia. Gbarnga is located in the centre of Liberia in Bong County. The majority of people are employed as farmers, cultivating crops such as rice, palm oil and cassava.  

He completed six grades and is married. His wife sells foodstuffs. He has eight children between the ages of 29 and 8 year old. The four oldest ones are in school, and live at home. 

John has shop which sells light bulbs, zinc, nails, saws, hinges, etc. He has been in business for three years and works from Monday to Saturday, ten hours each day.  

With this loan, he will buy light bulbs, zinc, nails, saws, hinges, etc. One of the greatest challenges that he faces is small capital. He transports his goods by taxi. He started his business with 250 USD from his savings. 

He is proud of his business because he makes more profit. His plan is to own a house. He thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy light bulbs, zinc, nails, saws, hinges, etc.

loans.name: Sama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Sama from Port Loko. She is married with three children between the ages of 9 years and 18 years. Her children are currently going to school. Her husband’s income is not enough to support the home.

Sama runs general stock items at her house; she sells soap, milk, pure water, soda, and biscuits. She has been running this business since 2006. She works at the business throughout the week from morning to night. Sama says that her business is going well because she started with a small amount through BRAC.

Sama has requested a loan in order to buy more soap, milk, pure water, and drinks. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. 

In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soap, milk, pure water, and drinks.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris sells doughnuts in Sekai (near Cape Coast). She has been educated until the end of junior high school. She is married and has five children. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Doris has been working in this enterprise for 16 years now. As the sole provider in the family, she is responsible for paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to purchase increased amounts of butter, sugar, flour, and oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her doughnut enterprise and to increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business into neighboring villages.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of butter, sugar, flour, and oil.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es: Doña Eloísa de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos,  ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Eloísa solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Eloísa, 52, lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  She has worked selling tortillas at home for several years; she works Monday to Sunday and has a large clientele because she’s a very hardworking, kind person.  She’s able to help her husband cover household expenses with the profits she earns.  Eloísa is asking for a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime powder to continue making tortillas thus earning higher profits to have better economic stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn and to buy lime powder.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn lives in New Kru town, which is one of the oldest communities in Liberia. Living conditions there are a bit difficult due to the high rate of crime, few bathrooms,  filthy conditions and over population. But the most interesting part is that rooms are a bit cheaper, food is cheaper, there is the option of traveling, and the town contains one of the biggest markets in Liberia.
    
Evelyn, 47, is married. Her husband works as driver, and they have four children between 14 and 4. Their children are currently attending school and live at home. 

Evelyn was not fortunate enough to attend school, but she is busy running her table business where she sells slippers, body cream, and clothes in the market of New Kru Town. With a little money from her mother, she managed to established this business five years ago, and she learned it by watching other businesswomen. She stated: "I enjoy the flows of costumers and the fast buying."

With the loan, she will buy more slippers, body cream, and clothes (blouses, tee shirts, etc.) for her business. She says that besides fewer goods on her table market, she has no other problems for now. 

She dreams of moving from the table business to the store business and living a better life in future.

loans.use: to buy more slippers, body cream, and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sipho

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 55-year-old Sipho from Bulawayo. She is married and has four children.  

Sipho runs a retail business in town. She sells footwear and clothing items for children and adults. The business has been in operation for over four years. She says the main challenges she faces are competition from bigger retailers, lack of capital and high import duties. 

Sipho has requested a loan of $500 to buy shoes and clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to supplement her spouse's income and enable her to buy food and pay rent and school fees for the children in school. 

In the future Sipho plans to open a clothes boutique and other stalls around town.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ntombezinhle

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 34-year-old Ntombezinhle from Bulawayo. She is married and has one child, who attends primary school.  Ntombezinhle runs a retail business. She sells footwear and a variety of clothing items. The business has been in operation for at least nine years now. She orders her stuff outside the country where it is relatively cheap and of good quality. She says the main challenges faced are competition and high import duty when bringing in a lot of stuff. Ntombezinhle has requested a loan of $500 to buy shoes,balnkets and clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to have more income to buy food and pay fees for her child, as well as pay rentals for her business premises. The money will also go a long way in uplifting her business. In the future Ntombezinhle plans to open more stalls around town and a clothing boutique.

loans.use: to order blankets, handbags, shoes and clothes, including tracksuits, winter boots, and skirts, for resale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: After graduating Junior High School, Gladys decided to set up her own fried fish business in ASEKAI (near Cape Coast). With over 11 years worth of experience, she is currently looking to further expand her enterprise. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more fish for resale. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a steel burner) with the upkeep of their house, while ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Edith Margarita

texts.es: Edith de 40 años de edad tiene un pequeño chalet ubicado en la plaza de donde ella reside, vende golosinas, refrescos, frutas, etc. tiene mucha clientela pues es un  lugar muy transitado, con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su madre y su hija de 13 años, Edith está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar más mercadería y surtir su chalet y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Edith, 40, has a small shop located in the square where she lives where she sells snacks, soft-drinks, fruit, etc.  She has a large clientele because it’s a very busy spot.  She uses profits earned to help with household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her mother and 13-year-old daughter.  Edith is asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise to stock her shop and earn higher profits to provide her family with better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Musitulia

texts.en:
Musitulia is 46 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. For the past 6 years, Musitulia has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells prepared food. 

To help expand her business, Musitulia has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more food, spoons, and glasses for the restaurant. This will help Musitulia to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a big hotel. 

Musitulia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Musitulia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more food, spoons, glasses for her restaurant.

loans.name: Miurys Del Socorro

texts.es: Miurys vive en el barrio Laureles Norte, una zona marginal de Managua, trabaja como asistente del hogar en casa particular, con su esposo comparte los gastos varios, ambos procrearon dos hijos, los cuales tienen las edades de 15 y 6 años, los cuales estudian. Miurys desea brindarles seguridad a sus niños, es por esto el motivo de la necesidad de solicitar el crédito para hacer de concreto la parte trasera de una pared de su casa. Esta mejora le dará más tranquilidad a su familia y comodidad.
texts.en:
Miurys lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte on the outskirts of Managua.  She works as a domestic assistant at a residence in the city. She and her husband share the various expenses in their household.  They have two children, who are aged 6 and 15 and are in school.

She wishes to provide greater security for their children by building a concrete wall to protect the rear of their home.  This improvement will bring her peace of mind and provide comfort to her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, steel and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Innovación  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Innovación está formado por 9 mujeres quienes viven  en  la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que goza de bellos paisajes, es de un clima frió, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad gracias a la belleza de su arquitectura, tiene 4 ríos los que le bañan ha esta hermosa ciudad. Su gente es muy amable, gentil y cordial que luchan cada día para mejorar la situación económica de sus hogares,  trabajan en diferentes actividades económicas y aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Eulalia, este es su primer crédito que está realizando con sus amigas y compañeras quienes han formado este grupo con un mismo objetivo el cual es la superación personal y la familiar. 

La Señora Eulalia tiene 46 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos de 28, 27, 21, 20 y 17 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo y cuarto  hijo estudian en la universidad, su tercer hijo trabaja y su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en su carpintería.

Doña Eulalia se dedica al comercio, vende todo tipo de ropa y una gran variedad de cosméticos, actividad que la desempeña desde hace 20 años,  tiene un local propio en el centro de la ciudad, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.

El dinero va a invertir en la compra de ropa y cosméticos para su clientela. 

Su meta es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Innovación” (Innovation) communal bank consists of nine women living in the city of Cuenca, a city that enjoys beautiful scenery and a cold climate.  Since December, 1999, it’s been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity thanks to the beauty of its architecture.  This beautiful city is bathed by four rivers.  Its residents are kind, gracious and cordial and strive daily to improve the economic situation at home; they work in various economic activities and still retain their culture and traditions.

One of this group’s members is Eulalia.  This is the first loan she’s taking out with her friends and companions who form this group with the same goal: personal and family improvement.

Eulalia is 46-years-old, married and has conceived five children who are 28, 27, 21, 20 and 17 years of age.  Her oldest son is married and lives independently, her second and fourth attend university, her third works and the last one attends secondary school in the city.  Her husband works in his carpentry shop.

Eulalia’s a merchant.  She sells all types of clothes and a great variety of cosmetics, an activity she’s been carrying out for 20 years.  She has a shop of her own downtown and works Monday to Saturday with no fixed schedule.  She will use the money to buy clothes and cosmetics for her customers.  Her goal is to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jardin De Rosas Group

texts.es:
La señora Angelina esta casada, tienen 32 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de de ganado porcino, inició este negocio con unas gallinas luego decidio criar cerdos, hasta la fecha lleva 5 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará pra la compra de cerditos para criarlos y luego venderlos, desea en el futuro tener una granja con cerdos y pollos. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades pecuarias y al comercio.
texts.en:
Angelina is married and is 32 years old.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She has 5 children, 2 of whom are in school.  She has a business raising pigs.  She started this business with some hens, and later decided to raise pigs.  As of now, she has 5 years of experience.

Angelina is organizing a group to request a loan that she will use to buy piglets to raise and later sell.  In the future, she wants to have a farm with pigs and chickens.  The other members of this group work in animal husbandry and retail trade.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is married and has been blessed with four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 4 years she has operated a vegetable kiosk business selling green vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes. She sells primarily to local neighbors. She dreams of expanding and establishing a shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Shukrije

texts.en:
Shukrije is 34, married, and has two children. They live in a small village. Shukrije owns a small farm stable with a cow, which provides her with milk and milk products for her family and for selling in the neighborhood. With this cow, she is able to sell approximately 4 liters of milk per day. While Shukrije works with her cow producing dairy products, her husband works in construction. 
Shukrije is in need of a loan in order to fix the roof of the warehouse where she keeps her cow's feed. 
Shukrije hopes to expand her farm and to add more cows so she can continue to grow her business and expand her market. She loves what she does and is committed to it because she likes working in the agricultural sector. She is hoping to be able to save money for her children’s education expenses and works very hard right now in order to meet the expenses of daily living for her family. She is aware that without this loan and support, her life will be difficult. She is really appreciative of this help!

loans.use: to fix the roof of the warehouse where she keeps her cow's feed.

loans.name: Roberto De Jesus

texts.es: Roberto es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y su hijo es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. Roberto  desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Roberto is a man who is very responsible with his obligations at home; he’s always been noted for providing the best for his family.  He currently lives with his wife and son.  He’s very hardworking and has always worked gladly and enthusiastically.  He works in agriculture and every year grows the main basic grains of his zone like corn and beans.  

Roberto wants to increase his sales which is why he visited the Integral offices to request a loan that will make it possible for him to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and pesticide, among others.  He wants to be able to count on the support provided because he has no other source of income and this way he’ll be able to continue to provide daily bread at home with no limits whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: After successfully graduating primary school, Rose is now an established businesswoman. She is divorced and has three children. She sells groceries in ASEKAI (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about two and a half years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Rose uses her income to provide for the entire family. Rose will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of groceries, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rose plans to diversify the types of products that she sells,  allowing her to adapt  to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of groceries, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Jose Napoleon

texts.es: José es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz, frijol y caña de azúcar; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista sale  a comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. José solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
José is very kind and hardworking.   He lives with his wife and his two children.  He works very hard on his own parcel where he grows corn, beans and sugarcane.  His products are very good quality and when the harvest is ready he goes out to sell it in various markets near his place of residence.  

José is asking Integral for a loan to have the money needed to buy agricultural supplies like pest controls, fertilizer, manure and seeds, among other things he needs for his crop.  He hopes to increase sales to earn higher profits and provide better economic stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Santos Alberto

texts.es: Santos, habitante del barrio Santa Elena, una zona marginal de Managua, el  es un hombre trabajador, que lucha para darle el bienestar a su familia, su esposa es ama de casa, el trabaja en mecánica automotriz, ambos tienen a cargo a dos sobrinos los cuales quieren como a sus propios hijos, quienes están estudiando. Don Santos solicita el crédito para hacer un muro perimetral, esto con el objetivo de tener más seguridad en su hogar para la familia, en vista de que el barrio donde habita no es muy seguro.
texts.en:
Santos is a resident of the Santa Elena neighborhood, a poor area of Managua.  He is a hardworking man who struggles to provide for his family's well-being.  His wife is a housewife, and he works as an auto mechanic.  Together, they have 2 nephews in their care who are in school, and who they love as if they were their own children.  

Santos is requesting a loan to build a perimeter wall so that he can have better security in his home for his family, since the neighborhood where they live is not very safe.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, steel, gravel, and cement blocks

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a widow. She owns a house that has no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a cassava selling business and her customers are her fellow villagers. Her challenge in the business is seasonality.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase 12 sacks of cassava for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sacks of cassava for sale.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy operates a small scale chop bar (roadside restaurant) in ASEKAI, near Cape Coast. She has had some formal education, as she is a Junior High School graduate. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a driver. Dorothy has been operating her chop bar for close to 5 years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of ingredients for her tasty local dishes, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of ingredients for her tasty local dishes.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough that is wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her ‘Kenkey’ in ASEKAI (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Kenkey’ for 16 years. 

Efua is married and has 6 children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Efua wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and sell catalogue items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell house to house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi operates a second hand clothing business in Asekai (near Cape Coast). Esi is a widow with 3 children. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Esi uses her income to provide for the entire family. Esi will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of second hand clothing, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. As a Junior High School graduate, Esi understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of second hand clothing, thus helping her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Durante la cosecha pasada Carlos pudo aumentar su producción gracias a que contrató jornaleros para que lo ayudaran en las labores en su finca de café. Para poder pagar a tiempo a los jornaleros y comprar fertilizantes para su finca utilizó un crédito obtenido por parte de Kiva el cual pagó al final de la cosecha. Para este año Carlos necesita otro financiamiento pues quiere comprar planta de café para renovar parte de su finca y comprar fertilizante. La planta que siembre ahora le estará comenzando a dar frutos en 3 años y con esto su producción aumentará considerablemente.
texts.en:
During the previous harvest, Carlos was able to increase production thanks to being able to hire laborers to help him with the chores on his coffee plantation.  To be able to pay the laborers on time and to buy fertilizer for his farm he used the Kiva loan he got and that he repaid at the end of harvesting.

For this year, Carlos needs another loan because he wants to buy coffee plants to renew part of his farm and to buy fertilizer.  Any plant he plants now will start to bear fruit in three years and with this his production will increase considerably.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es:
Irma tiene 32 años de edad, ella es casada y madre de 3 hijos los cuales viven en su casa de habitación y ninguno de ellos estudia. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora con 3 años de educación primaria pero no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres. La actividad de cultivo de café la aprendió de su esposo y lo práctica en su compañía hace más de 6 años. El terreno que ella en compañía de su esposo trabaja es propio gracias al esfuerzo y trabajo puesto por muchos años. Su cliente mayor y más fuerte es IHCAFE (Instituto Hondureño de café) ya que ellos avalan y compran la cosecha de antemano por la calidad y transparencia con la que ellos trabajan.

Hoy en día ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual ella piensa comprar abono, urea y formula cafetalera para darle un mejor mantenimiento a sus cultivos y poder obtener una buena cosecha. 

Sus planes para el futuro es poder ampliar sus cultivos de café tener sus cultivos en excelentes y atractivas condiciones para sus clientes ya que sus cultivos de café son su única entrada económica para el sustento de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Irma, 32, is married and mother of three children who live in her house; none of them are attending school.  She’s a housewife and farmer with three years of primary education; she was unable to continue because her parents couldn’t give her economic support.  She learned to grow coffee from her husband and has been doing so with him for more than six years.  The land she and her husband work is their own thanks to their effort and work of many years. Her main and most important customer is IHCAFE (Honduran Coffee Institute) since they guarantee and purchase the harvests ahead of time because of its quality and because of the transparency with which they work.

Today, she’s asking the Comixmul cooperative for financing she plans to use to buy manure, urea and coffee plant formula to better care for her crop and thus obtain a better harvest.  Her future plan is to be able to expand the coffee plantation and to have her crops in excellent, attractive condition for her customers because her coffee crop is her only source of income for her and her family’s support.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Om-Asem Group

texts.en: Sadia is a 24-year-old woman who lives with family in Aden, Yemen. She is the leader of Om-Asem Group. She has sold perfume, incense, clothes and makeup for the last five years, trying to help her family with daily expenses. Sadia has applied for a loan of 70,000 YER. With her portion, she will buy more quantities of perfume, incense, clothes and sewing tools. She hopes that this will boost her income. She expects that one day she will be able to make her own incense.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of perfume, incense, clothes and sewing tools.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single lady aged 28 years, a professional teacher and a business lady. She deals in used items such as tables, chairs and bathroom accessories and other household items most especially for people shifting to other places.
Mary has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock so as to satisfy the increasing demand of her clients since her items are usually cheaper than the other traders. She also intends to use the profits generated by the loan to construct rental rooms next to her family house. This will help them have enough space, improve their standard of living and also get more income.

loans.use: To buy second hand household items

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es: Con el crédito que Clementina obtuvo el año pasado por parte de Kiva le fue posible comprar fertilizantes para su finca de café y también con eso pudo contratar a un trabajador para que le ayudara en las labores del corte de café. Para este año Clementina planea resembrar una parte de su finca pues las plantas de esa zona ya son algo viejas y ya no producen como deberían. Las nuevas plantas estarán comenzando a producir café dentro de tres años. También necesita comprar fertilizantes y por eso ella solicita nuevamente un crédito de Kiva y así podrá aumentar su producción.
texts.en: With the Kiva loan Clementina got last year she was able to buy fertilizer for her coffee farm and was also able to hire a laborer to help her with the coffee picking chore.  For this year, Clementina plans to replant part of her farm because the plants in that zone are somewhat old now and don’t produce like they should.  The new plants would start to produce coffee in three years.  She also needs to buy fertilizer and that is why she’s asking for a Kiva loan again and to be able to increase production that way.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Assana

texts.en: Even though Assana grew up in poverty, without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Assana is an entrepreneur. She sells local dishes in her chop bar (roadside restaurant/bar) in ASEKAI, near Cape Coast. Since she began it 20 years ago, her business enterprise has grown substantially. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 4 children. Assana has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. Thus, she plans to use her loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare her local dishes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Assana wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to prepare her local dishes.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is involved in selling groundnut cake in Asekai (near Cape Coast). Her earnings are generally used to help her husband (who is a construction worker) support their 1 child. She has been involved in selling groundnut cake for 20 years now.
