She plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of groundnuts, thus helping her sell more due to increased inventory capacity. She aspires to use her profits, to both better market her groundnut cake enterprise and increase her existing working capital. She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of groundnuts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Mary did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Mary sells groceries in Asekai (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 10 years. As a divorcee with 5 children, Mary uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Mary will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of groceries, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Mary wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of groceries to sell

loans.name: Amiel

texts.en: Amiel aged 34. He is married to a teacher and they have three children, two of whom go to school. He has sold milk and sodas for four years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sodas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more sodas to sell

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino is 50 years old from the small village of Samtredia district. She is married and lives with her son, daughter-in-law and mother-in-law, who is provided with a retirement pension. Tsitsino requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a pig, 2 milking cows and 2 calves. Tsitsino produces dairy products for selling. Her son has rented a bus and works on the bus line. Their income is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tsitsino has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Tsitsino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit Tsitsino will purchase a bus. After the bus is purchased, her son will not have to rent a bus and will be able to generate more income.  The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a bus

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en: Brigitte is 44 years old.  She is married with one child aged 8, and he is enrolled in school. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for one and a half years. With the loan, she would like to buy more vegetable to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 49 year old hardworking man with 4 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. His main business is transport, alongside selling cassava flour. He started these businesses with a vision of improving his income; however, he is facing challenges of limited capital to buy stock. Besides that, Richard is hoping to expand his business to new areas. Richard intends to use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Three years ago, during a visit to San Diego, Emilie (pictured left) met Gilberto (pictured right), and found in him, a partner for life. Soon after, she returned to the United States to marry Gil.  Emilie is passionate about teaching children and she spent several years doing so in Paris and Montreal.  Upon her arrival, she obtained her teaching certification here in San Diego, in order to begin teaching in her new hometown.  A year after getting settled in San Diego, Emilie and Gil welcomed their son Mateo (pictured center), another driving force in their desire to create this home-based school!

Emilie learned of the Montessori method while teaching in France and Canada. Her younger sister also attended a Montessori school, and she was impressed with its impact. “I watched my sister blossom and witnessed such growth and independence in her,” she shared. Emilie and Gil were initially motivated by a desire to provide a learning environment for their son. “We really believe in a peaceful environment where children can learn life skills and grow up to be independent and productive,” said Emilie. The idea to set up a French Montessori school made sense to Emilie and Gil, seeing as Emilie is fluent in French and English and that it will be the first French Montessori School in San Diego. 

“She says she wants a big family,” Gil shared with a smile. Emilie is on track to have just that, as when the school opens in September, Emilie will have six students between the ages of two and four in her home. The plan is to hire a teaching assistant next year and have as many as 12 students in her program.

A loan of $7,000 helps Emilie to purchase Montessori materials for her school and upgrade her home to house the school.

loans.use: to purchase Montessori materials for her school

loans.name: Mitingi

texts.en:
Mitingi is married and has 3 children all of whom go to school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase 4 sacks of dried fish.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of dried fish.

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret's group is in its second loan cycle with ID-Ghana and first with Kiva. They sell bags, jeans and vegetables.

Margaret is a very hardworking person who has a business selling bags. She states that at first it was a little difficult, but over time she gradually attracted customers and gained confidence, becoming the good small businesswoman that she is today. She works hard and struggles to increase her income and improve each day.

Margaret is requesting this loan to buy more bags to sell. This way, she can continue with her sales, attract more customers, and keep working. 
Margaret and the other members of this group are grateful for this opportunity that they are receiving, because it will be a great help to them.
They need a total amount of GHS 1250 to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more bags to sell.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Comfort is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling artificial hair in Asekai (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for many years. Comfort is married and has 6 children. Her husband works as a store operator. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Comfort will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of artificial hair, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of artificial hair, thus helping her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married with one school-going child. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children. 

She has operated a khanga (women’s wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business and also competition from her fellow sellers.

With the loan she is requesting, Mejumaa wants to purchase two bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of khangas (wrap cloth) for resale.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi operates a food stall business, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates for the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi has operated a fish selling business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby but she faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of owning her own fish shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase cooking oil and sacks of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and sacks of fish to sell

loans.name: Danaya 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DANAYA 7  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide , le mil  et le riz avec DIATA BAKARI,  1ere  assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  0.50  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo et Bougouni,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 65.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "DANAYA  7" are married women, who average 39 years of age and four children each, and they all live in polygamous families in Bladiè, a village in Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back.

The crops grown are peanuts, millet, and rice, as is the case with DIATA BAKARI, who is the first person sitting from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase some farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to make use of 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold at the village, in Garalo et Bougouni, to men and women customers. She plans on making a profit of 65,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing for planting season

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Durante la cosecha pasado Antonio pudo sembrar con café un terreno que había adquirido hace tiempo y el cual en dos años estará cosechando con lo cual podrá aumentar su producción. También pudo adquirir un vehículo para transportar café de su finca al centro receptor de su comunidad. Antonio dice que esto no hubiera sido posible sin el crédito que obtuvo por parte de Kiva y está muy agradecido. Para la siguiente cosecha Antonio necesita de otro crédito para realizar labores de limpieza en su finca y comprar fertilizantes.
texts.en:
During the recent harvest, Antonio was able to plant coffee in a field that he acquired some time ago. It will be ready to harvest in two years, and this will allow him to increase his production. He was also able to acquire a vehicle to transport coffee from his farm to his community's receiving center. 

Antonio says that this would not have been possible without the loan that he received through Kiva, and he is very grateful. For the next harvest, Antonio needs another loan in order to carry out cleaning at his farm and to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and clean his farm.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a married, mother of one child who stays at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her largest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past three years, she has operated a beauty salon business. She operates the business from home, where neighbors and passerby  are her potential customers. Her major challenge is seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to accommodate more customers in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase a hair drying machine for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans  in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a hair drying machine for her business

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es: Con el crédito obtenido en Kiva durante la cosecha pasada Rubén pudo sembrar 1000 plantas nuevas de café en su finca, las cuales dentro de dos años más estarán dando sus primeros frutos y de esta forma su producción aumentará. Para darle continuidad al trabajo que viene realizando Rubén necesita de otro crédito, pues comprará fertilizante orgánico para su finca y también planea resembrar otro terreno que adquirió hace algún tiempo.
texts.en: With the loan he obtained from Kiva during the last harvest season, Ruben was able to plant 1,000 new coffee plants on his farm.  Within 2 years, these will be giving their first fruits, and so his production will increase.  In order to continue with the work that he's been doing, Ruben needs another loan which he will use to buy organic fertilizer for his farm and also replant some land that he acquired a while ago.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and replant his farm

loans.name: Belancille

texts.en: Belancille is 56 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more foodstuffs such as sweet potatoes and bananas to sell. Belancille will put the profits from her business toward savings.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as sweet potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Dúo El Rosario Group

texts.es: Dúo el Rosario Está a cargo de la señora Ofelia, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa( blusas de tela por docena.)  Actualmente ella tiene varios pedidos de blusas pero las tallas y colores que tiene no le son suficientes porque no completa el pedido de sus clientes.  Por tal motivo ella necesita un capital nuevamente para poder comprar grandes cantidades en tallas y colores que le faltan y así tener el producto cuando el cliente le solicita,ya ha trabajado varios creditos en Kiva/Fape y ha sido muy responsable en sus pagos ya que los creditos que le han otorgado ha sido de mucha ayuda para ella y su negocio espera seguir luchando dia a dia para salir adelante no solo ella si no tambien de esa forma su familia.
texts.en:
Ofelia is in charge of the Dúo de Rosario group. She sells clothing (cloth blouses by the dozen). Currently, she has many orders for blouses but the sizes and colors she has are not sufficient because they do not fulfill her customers' orders.  For that reason, she again needs capital in order to buy larger quantities of the sizes and colors she is lacking and therefore have the product when the customer asks her for it.

She has already worked with many loans with Kiva and Fape and has been very responsible with her payments.  The loans that have been previously awarded to her have been very helpful for her and her business.  She hopes to continue striving day by day in order to move not only herself but also her family forward in this way.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini is a hardworking woman who does her best to meet the requirements of her family. 

Here she comes to you again requesting a loan of KES 25,000 to buy spare parts for her motorcycle and also to service it for efficiency of her work. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle and also service it.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio ya ha transformado parte de su producción de café convencional a café orgánico. Esto fue posible con el crédito que solicitó en Kiva. Para este año tiene planeado convertir otra parte de su finca a café orgánico y nuevamente necesita un financiamiento pues debe preparar el terreno para sembrar nueva planta, la cual aún no adquiere y después debe fertilizar tanto su nueva siembra así como lo que ya tenía sembrado anteriormente. Ignacio nos comenta que anteriormente había trabajado con otros financiamientos y que el de Kiva le parece excelente ya que tiene un buen plazo de tiempo para pagarlo.
texts.en:
Ignacio was able to convert part of his production from conventional coffee to organic. This was made possible with the loan he requested from Kiva. For this year, he plans to convert the rest of his farm to organic coffee. However, he needs another loan so that he can prepare the land for planting a new crop which he has yet to acquire. Afterwards, he will fertilize this new crop and the other ones that were planted previously.

Ignacio says that he has worked with other lenders, but Kiva appears to be among the best because he has been given good terms by which he has time to make his payments.

loans.use: to replant his coffee farm and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es: Durante la última cosecha a Apolinar le fue muy bien pues su producción de café aumento bastante y además, gracias a un crédito obtenido por parte de Kiva, tuvo la oportunidad de resembrar parte de su finca que ya no estaba produciendo lo suficiente debido a que las plantas tenían bastantes años. Parte de las ganancias que obtuvo al final de la cosecha las invirtió en otras actividades alternas que tiene, pues cuenta con un vivero de orquídeas, siembra caña y cría mojarras. Para la siguiente cosecha Apolinar necesita un crédito pues debe fertilizar estas nuevas plantas y en un periodo de dos años su producción crecerá aún más.
texts.en:
The last harvest was very good for Apolinar because his coffee production increased considerably.  Also, thanks to a Kiva loan that he got, he had the opportunity to replant part of his farm.  It had not been producing enough because the plants were pretty old.  

He used part of the earnings that he got at the end of the harvest to invest in alternative business activities that he has.  He has an orchid nursery, he grows sugarcane, and he raises ‘mojarras’ [fish].  

Apolinar needs a loan for the next harvest.  He needs to fertilize these new plants.  In a period of two years his production will grow even more.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's university registration fees.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Victoria sigue con la misma actividad de la Venta de comida, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas,   en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de un Frizer para mantener sus vegetales y carne conservados para así elaborar sus platillos, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria continues in the same business of selling food. She did very well with her previous loan since it was used to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan in order to buy a freezer so that she can store vegetables and preserve meats that are used in preparing her dishes. She is pleased with and appreciative of the opportunity given to her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Madelene

texts.en: Madelene is 46 years old. She is married to a driver and blessed with five children. They all go to school. She sells various items through both general store and hardware businesses. She has been involved in these businesses for the past six years. With the loan, she wants to buy more soap, cooking oil, and beans for sale in her general store business. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more soap, cooking oil, and beans for sale

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en: Fausta is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is also a businessman. Fausta sells various items in her retail business and has requested a loan to buy more rice, sugar and utensils to sell. Fausta will put the profits from her business toward savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice, sugar and utensils

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman with one child. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her largest monthly expense is food.

She operates a food making business, making basic foods like beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She mentioned that her major challenge is the high cost of purchasing foodstuff. 

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with two children. She lives in a rented house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

She operates a food-making business, making comestibles like beans and chapati (flat bread) to sell to passersby and neighbors. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing foodstuffs to be her major challenge. 

With the 40,000 KES loan, Mwanakombo wants to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma operates a food-making business, making comestibles like beans and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. In addition, she sells charcoal to supplement her income. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing foodstuffs to be her major challenge. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, Mwanajuma wants to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Please meet 26-year-old Ruth from Paynesville North in Liberia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers,” traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia. 

Ruth is single and has two children, age 7 and 3, who are in school and live at home. Ruth completed tenth grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a hard-working person. Ruth has a table in the local market where she sells palm oil and dry meat. She has been in this business for the past four years and works nine hours each day. With this loan, she will buy palm oil and dry meat to resell.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is a small income. She transports her goods by shared taxi.  She started her business with a loan from her mother. She is proud of her business because it provides for her daily expenses. Her plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to buy palm oil and dry meat to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and food products like tomatoes, onions, and soup to resell.

loans.name: Rosta

texts.pt:
Rosta é casada, tem 48 anos idade e é mãe de 8 filhos, dos quais 2 são maiores de idade e os restante 6 ainda estão a estudar. Sustenta 4 netos que vivem com ela.
Com este valor a cliente vai comprar vários produtos como farinha, milho, feijão, alguidares, loiça e peneiras, que traz da zona centro do pais.
Diz que tem como objectivo principal crescer no negócio, fazer uma loja e um aviário na sua casa e com estas fontes reforçar a renda familiar. 
Diz que vai pagar pontualmente para voltar a solicitar outros empréstimos para realizar seu plano.
texts.en: Rosta is 48 years old. She is married and has eight children, two of whom are adult and the other six of whom are still in school. She also supports four grandchildren who live with her. Rosta will use this loan to buy various products such as flour, corn, beans, dishpans, dishes, and colanders, which she brings from the center of the country. She says her main goal is to expand her business, setting up a shop and a chicken coop at her home and using that income to supplement her family's income. She says she will make her loan payments on time so she can request other loans to carry out her plans.

loans.use: to buy various products such as flour, corn, beans, dishpans, dishes, and colanders to resell.

loans.name: Suraia

texts.pt:
Suraia tem 46 anos de idade, é casada e tem 2 filhos com 23 e 29 anos que não estudam. Ela vive na casa própria.
O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de cortinas e camas para revender na sua residência e diz ter clientes que compram seus produtos a credito.
Suraia pretende fazer crescer o seu negócio de forma a possuir um estabelecimento comercial em sua casa onde possa vender produtos de 1ª necessidade.
O sonho de Suraia é concluir a sua casa, e depois disso espera poder comprar a respectiva mobília.
texts.en: Suraia, 46 years old, is married and has two children 23 and 29 years of age who are no longer in school. She lives in her own home. She will use this loan to buy curtains and beds to resell, and she says she has customers who buy her products on credit. Suraia wants to expand her business so that she can set up a shop in her house to sell staple goods. Suraia’s dream is to finish building her house and buy furniture for it.

loans.use: to buy curtains and beds to resell.

loans.name: Maria Ivete

texts.pt:
Maria de 36 anos idade, é casada e tem 3 filhos.
Maria é negociante e pretende aplicar o dinheiro do empréstimo na compra e revenda de produtos comestíveis como frangos, carne de porco e ovos, dentro os quais a carne de porco é o mais procurado. Maria faz entregas dos seus produtos aos clientes e cobra no final do mês.
Maria tem esperança de continuar com o seu negócio e pretende ainda construir um estabelecimento para diminuir saídas que tem feito para fazer entregas.
Ela tem como principal desafio comprar uma viatura para o transporte de produtos comercializados visto que tem pago elevados valores para o transporte.
texts.en: Maria is 36 years old. She is married and has three children. Maria is a businesswoman and hopes to use her loan to buy foodstuff for resale, including chickens, pork, and eggs, of which pork is in the highest demand. Maria delivers her products to her customers and bills them at the end of the month. Maria hopes to continue her business and plans to build a shop to reduce the number of deliveries she does. Her greatest challenge is to buy a vehicle so she can transport her merchandise, since she spends a lot of money on transport.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pork, and eggs to resell.

loans.name: Gaydou

texts.en:
This is Gaydou, 47, from Liberia. She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia. Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers”, traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

She is married with four children. Her children's ages are between 25 and 30. They all are currently attending university.  

Gaydou has owned her own table business selling pepper, red oil, and rice for the past five years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more pepper, red oil, and rice for her business.  

On average, she works 10 hours a day at her business. She started her business with money given to her by her husband. She transports her merchandise by a shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the profit she makes every time. In the future, she would like to buy a piece of land and build a house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, red oil, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 38-year-old businesswoman from Liberia. She is single and has two children between 7 and 5. They are currently attending school and live at home.  She completed 3rd grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a smart businesswoman.

She lives and works in Paynesville North, which has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to “round time marketers”, the local term for traders who travel to the interior regions of the country to purchase goods to sell throughout the county.  Because of this, there are a large number of wholesalers operating in the area that distribute to the markets in the county, including supplying the capital city of Monrovia. 

Annie has owned a table business where she sells used clothes for the past four years. She works 11 hours a day at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is a small amount of capital. She intends to use the loan to buy used clothes for her business. She started her business with money from her fiancee. She likes her business because she makes profit. She hopes to one day to own a house.
  
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Siah is a 36-year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is single and has a 12-year-old child who is currently attending school and lives at home.  She completed sixth grade before starting her business. She describes herself as hardworking businesswoman.

She lives and works in Paynesville North, which has the largest market in Montserrado County. The area is home to “round time marketers," the local term for traders who travel to the interior regions of the country to purchase goods to sell throughout the county. Because of this, there is a large number of wholesalers operating in the area that distribute to the markets in the county, including supplying the capital city of Monrovia. 

For the past four years, Siah has run a table business which sells used clothes. She works 11 hours at her business. Her greatest challenge in business is having little capital. She intends to use the loan to buy used clothes for her business. She started her business by money from her fiancé.  She likes her business because she makes more profit. She hopes one day to own a house.  

She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino is a dairy farmer looking towards the future. He understands his role in the bigger picture of anthropogenic climate change and wants to both reduce his farm's environmental impact and show his grandsons a more sustainable way of farming and living. 

His family will benefit from their 25 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester on three primary fronts: waste treatment, renewable energy production, and more sustainable farming practices. This loan represents 47% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 25 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martín is a young, motivated dairy farmer with strong entrepreneurial spirit. He loves technology and is excited to be a pioneer in his community. He is investing in his 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because he sees the economic and environmental benefits. He knows that more effectively treating his cow waste will reduce his farm's impact on the environment, while his digester will concurrently produce renewable energy and biofertilizer, allowing him to significantly reduce input costs in his production cycle. This loan represents 51% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
This is Joey, 42, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Irene, a housewife and mother to their children. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Joey oversees operations of their jeepney transportation business. They have one Jeep that carries up to sixteen passengers to their destination within the community. He earns from the boundary (daily quota) their driver remits eveyday. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in boundary every day.

To help him continue operation of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan for the maintenance of his jeepney unit.

Joey dreams to expand his business and hopes for a better future for his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week. There he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Jose Atilio

texts.es:
José, está acompañado y no tiene hijos, asimismo no posee familiares en el extranjero. El, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, además a la crianza de ganado, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, oficio que lo aprendió de sus padres y lo desempeña todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm; hasta el momento no posee ningún problema. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros;  esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir todo lo necesario para la siembra y así obtener una excelente cosecha.
Su sueño es terminar de construir su propia casa y brindarle seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose lives with a partner and has no children, neither has he any relatives abroad.  He is a farmer who cultivates corn and beans, and he also raises livestock.  He's been doing this work for 10 years; he learned to farm from his parents.  He works every day from 6am until 3pm, and up until now, he's had no problems.

Jose needs a loan so that he can buy agricultural supplies that he needs, such as: organic fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and other supplies.  This investment will help him to acquire everything he needs for his crops so that he can have an excellent harvest.

Jose's dream is to finish building his own house so that he can provide security to his family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Toby

texts.en:
Ugad is a village in Tumauini, and is known as a land of agriculture, and for its hard-working people. Here, Toby lives in a neighboring community, with his wife and one kid, whom he must support in their needs. Toby is a small-scale farmer, growing basic grains and raising cattle. He's known as an honest and hard-working person.

Toby recently came to visit an ASKI office and is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farming business. Toby hopes to benefit by increasing the area used for his crops.

The impact and benefits of these loans have been very positive for Toby and his family. They will now have a farm with a larger area for farming production and cattle and this will allow them to improve their financial situation with the income they will earn.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farming business.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
This is Gleceria's 23rd loan cycle and she is a loyal partner. She has had a direct-selling business for more than a decade now. Her loans, which were being used in her business, helped her a lot even in her family's expenses and her child's education. She and her husband, who is a farmer, are helping each other to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gleceria dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her youngest child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Badamtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Badamtsetseg, 37 years old, lives with her husband, daughter and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Seven years ago, the family came to and settled in Ulaanbaatar. She has been working as an office manager at a private company for four years. Her husband makes house decorations for a living and her daughter and son both go to high school. Besides her job, she also runs a clothing sales business by renting a stall at a trade center and hiring her own sister as a saleswoman. 

She is requesting a loan of 2500000 MNT to purchase clothes in large quantities. As a result, she can run her clothing sales business without worrying about inventory shortages. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who deeply cares for her family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes in large quantities.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es: Durante la cosecha pasada Carmelo renovó parte de su finca y compró fertilizantes con ayuda de un crédito que obtuvo por parte de Kiva el cual pagó al final de la cosecha. Para este año Carmelo tiene planeado renovar otra parte de su finca y dentro de tres años el podrá aumentar su producción que actualmente es de 12 toneladas a un total de 18 toneladas. A Carmelo le parece muy buena opción el financiamiento de Kiva ya que normalmente en las financieras tienen que hacer los pagos semanalmente.
texts.en: During the past harvest Carmelo updated part of his plantation and bought fertilizer with the help of a Kiva loan that he used to pay for finishing the harvest. This year, Carmelo is planning to update another portion of his plantation, and within three years he will be able to increase his production from the current 12 tons to a total of 18 tons. He thinks the Kiva loan is a very good option because normally at financial institutions he would have to make weekly payments.

loans.use: to update his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan, age 57, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She has one married daughter. Currently, she has an adopted grandson who is in school and lives with her. 
Phan and her husband buy and sell lies (small freshwater clams) wholesale and retail in her village. She is now in the process off building a new house to live in (in the photo), but she does not have enough money to finish it. Hence she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To finish her house construction.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
This is Elsa. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the grocery items that she needed in her variety store. The loan also helped in the education of her child, as well as in their everyday expenses. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her business profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elsa dreams that her store will get bigger and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: La Señora Ana trabaja para un centro de salud publico desde hace mas 2 años como enfermera, actualmente este credito lo solicita para tramitar y cancelar aranceles de la titulacion de diploma de enfermeria profesonal, espera que ceprodel y pueda brindarle este credito para realizar los pagos correspondinete ya que esto le va facilitar una mejor condicion de vida para ella y su familia
texts.en: Ana has worked as a nurse at a public health center for more than two years. She is requesting the loan to pay the processing fees for her professional nursing degree. She hopes that Kiva partner CEPRODEL can provide this loan so she can make the corresponding payments, which will help her improve the quality life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to pay processing fees for her nursing degree.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
This is Flordeliza, 55, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Bernardo, a farmer, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating an ornamental plant business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
Flordeliza grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias, along with a variety of hanging plants and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10000 loan. She will buy gardening materials and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Flordeliza dreams to grow her business in the coming years and hopes to live a peaceful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar is 24 years old and lives with his mother, wife and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. His wife recently gave birth and now stays at home looking after her baby. Anar graduated two years ago from university and is now working as an electric engineer at a heat station. He is requesting a loan of 7000000 MNT to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, a low-pressure heater and building materials such as bricks, cement and planks. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and in the winter time, wind seeps through walls and frost forms around the windows, shattering them. Anar will install vacuum-insulated windows in place of the old ones and build an extension to his house providing more space and reducing heat loss. The renovated house will enable the family to live in a comfortable and warm place. Also. the family will burn less coal for heating thus releasing less pollutants into air, contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows, a low-pressure heater and other building materials

loans.name: Koeurn

texts.en:
Koeurn, age 31, is a construction worker. He has been married since 2003 and has a daughter who is in school. His wife is a garment worker. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 
Koeurn is requesting his first Kiva loan in the amount of $1,500 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work because he does not have his own motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamdavaa, 37 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Recently he has been recruited into a full time job at a large auto service company. Before this job, he ran his own small auto service business for more than 16 years. Using his previous loan, he purchased old cars at a lower price, and after repairing them, he sold them for a higher price. 

Now he is requesting a loan of 1300000 MNT to purchase fertilizers and pipe with wide holes. In spring, they planted cabbage, carrots and potatoes and he wants to accelerate their growth with fertilizers. Pipe with wide holes will irrigate the field with more efficiency. The vegetables he planted will be used for home consumption or sold for cash. More importantly, growing vegetables has a positive impact on the environment by turning carbon dioxide into oxygen. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants to create a brilliant future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pipe with wide holes.

texts.en:
Narin, age 24, is a garment worker. She has been married since 2011 and has a young son. Her husband is a sawing machine repairman. Narin lives with her parents and two sisters in suburb of Phnom Penh. 
Narin is now in the process off building a new house to live in (in the photo), but she does not have enough money to finish it. Hence she decided to apply for a loan.

loans.name: Leopolda

texts.es: Con el crédito obtenido en Kiva durante la cosecha pasada Leopolda y su familia pudieron comprar planta de café para resembrar parte de su finca y también les sirvió para comenzar un pequeño negocio de cría de credos. Para la siguiente cosecha ella necesita realizar labores de limpieza y comprar abono plantas y así poder aumentar su producción de café. Las plantas que sembró comenzarán a dar frutos dentro de dos años y con esto ella espera que su producción aumente al doble, lo cual hará que mejore su situación económica.
texts.en: With the Kiva loan she had during the past harvest, Leopolda and her family were able to plant coffee to re-sow part of their farm, and it also helped her start a small business raising pigs. For the coming harvest, Leopolda needs to clean the farm and buy fertilizer for the plants, and in this way she can increase her coffee production. The crops she planted will start bearing fruit within two years, and with that she hopes to double her production, which will improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to plant coffee and clean his farm.

loans.name: Romualda

texts.es: El año pasado Romualda y su esposo compraron planta de café para renovar sus fincas y abono orgánico y gracias a esto lograron tener una buena producción, la cual entregaron en su totalidad a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco”, asociación a la cual pertenecen desde hace algunos años. Para la siguiente cosecha Romualda renovará otra parte de sus cafetales ya que tiene algunas plantas que ya han cumplido su ciclo productivo de vida. Para hacer la renovación ella necesita de otro financiamiento por parte de Kiva el cual pagará al final de la cosecha.
texts.en:
Last year, Romualda and her husband bought new coffee plants in order to replenish their fields, as well as organic fertilizer. Thanks to this, they were able to have a good harvest, which they took over to the Unión Regional de Huatusco, an association to which they have belonged for several years. 

For the next harvest, Romualda will replenish another section of her farm because the plants have now completed their life cycles. To do this, she needs another loan through Kiva, which she will repay after the harvest.

loans.use: to replenish her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish, conchs and prawns, among other seafood.

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en:
Mary-Ann is 22 years old, single, and lives in Molatuhan Bajo, Lopez Jaena. She used to help her parents with their household chores just to lighten her parent's burden from work. She planned to continue her education, despite obstacles, which makes her strong enough to survive life. 

She is receiving a loan amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC in order to pay her school tuition fees and obligations. She hope to be given a chance to work at a company where she can share her talents and give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees and obligations.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol (in the photo) is 53 years old. She has been married for almost twenty years and has two daughters, who are assisting her parents with the business. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Thol and her husband produce soy milk and ice cream for sale. They make the products at home and sell them in the village and in front of the garment factory. Thol is asking for a loan to buy an ice cream container as well as a motorbike to carry ice cream and soy milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy an ice cream container as well as a motorbike to carry ice cream and soy milk to sell.

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
Lizel is 20 years old, single, and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She used to help her parents with their household chores to lighten their burden from work. Lizel planned to continue her education despite obstacles which make her strong enough to survive life. 

She is receiving a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC in order to pay for her school projects and laboratory expenses. She hope to be given a chance to work at a company where she can share her talents and give her family better living conditions, in the near future.

loans.use: to finance shool projects and laboratory expenses

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
With 21 years of experience in the beauty and hair industry, Anna decided to go into business for herself one year ago and opened Anna’s Beauty Salon & Spa. 

Anna currently works alone full time, but plans on hiring another full-time employee. However, she is taking precautionary steps to ensure her business stays afloat. Knowing she needed more equipment before taking on more clients, Anna turned to a friend –another salon owner—who referred her to nonprofit microlender Accion Texas Inc. 

The loan will help the 40-year-old as she continues her endeavors as an entrepreneur providing for her six children through her business. Specializing in hair coloring, Anna also offers styling, cutting and up-dos for special events, and nail work. View all of what Anna has to offer via her website: http://www.annasfashionandbeauty.com/.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Silvia Yanira

texts.es:
Silvia, es una persona de hogar, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella, se dedica a la venta de ropa variada para ambos sexos, oficio  lo aprendió por amistades y de esto logro obtener un puesto en el mercado, hace 15 años desempeña dicho negocio.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar diversidad de ropa tales como: pantalones, chores, camisas, blusas, faldas, trajes, ropa interior y ropa para niños/as; esta inversión le ayudara a surtir el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. 
Su sueño es mejorar su local y agregar otro tipo de producto. El objetivo primordial es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y crecer como microempresario.
texts.en:
Silvia is a homebody; she lives with her husband and their three children.  She sells different kinds of clothing for both sexes for a living.  She learned this business from some friends and from there she was able to get a stall at the market.  She has had her business for 15 years.

The loan she needs will allow her to buy different kinds of clothes, such as pants, shorts, shirts, blouses, skirts, suits, undergarments, and children's clothing.  This investment will help her stock her business and satisfy her customers' needs.

Her dream is to improve her stall and add another kind of product.  Her essential goal is to offer her children a better quality of life and to grow as a small businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy pants, shorts, shirts, blouses, skirts, suits, undergarments, and children's clothing

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory is new to the trucking and transportation business with less than two years of experience.  Although new to the business, he likes the open road and freedom to make his own schedule.  

Gregory drives a heavy duty truck and transports vehicles from state to state.  One day, while at a local bank in Slidell, Gregory inquired about applying for a business loan.  When things did not work out, the bank referred Gregory to Accion Texas Inc.  He applied for a microloan and was approved for $5,450.  

Gregory used his Accion loan to pay for fuel for his truck, maintenance repairs, and to pay for certificates to be able to travel from state to state delivering the vehicles.  The loan also helped Gregory maintain his business in his first six months and continue to operate smoothly.  

For now, he continues to deliver the vehicles and meet many different deadlines.  He plans to hire additional workers to drive as well and bring in more business.

loans.use: to pay for fuel for his truck, maintenance repairs and certification

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Sopha (in the photo) is 33 years old. He has been married since 2003 and has four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of his children attend school and one is still too young for school. The family is living in a Phnom Penh suburb. 

Sopha and his wife are garment workers. He is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work because he takes his brother’s motorbike to work very often.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
This is Margie's 15th loan cycle. Her loans helped not just her business but also her children's education and their household expenditures. Aside from her variety store, she also has a buy and sell business where she sells different jewelry. She and her husband are helping each other to sustain their family.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Margie hopes to be more successful and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilian Sarai

texts.es:
Lilian, vive con su familia, su esposo y un hijo. Ella, posee un taller de sastrería, oficio que lo aprendió como ayudante  y luego logro colocar su propio taller con el que cuenta hoy en día, lo realiza desde hace 2 años y trabaja con proyectos de las escuelas.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar materia prima tales como: hilo, zipper, telas, botones y otra máquina de coser; esta inversión le ayudara a tener los consumibles  necesarios para trabajar y así agilizar más su producción para terminar más rápido lo pendiente.
Su sueño es ampliar su taller y tener su propio local, adquirir nuevas maquinas y aprender más. Brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Lillian lives with her family, her husband and a son. She has a tailoring shop, a trade she learned as an assistant. She later was able to open her own shop, from which she makes her living today. She has had her own shop for two years and she works on projects for schools. 

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy material, such as thread, zippers, fabrics, buttons, and another sewing machine. This investment will help her to have the supplies she needs to work, and so will also speed up her production so she can finish her pending orders more quickly. 

Her dream is to grow her workshop, to have her own space, to acquire new machines, to learn more, and to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy thread, zippers, fabrics, buttons, and another sewing machine.

loans.name: Jeniza

texts.en:
Jeniza is 25 years old and lives with her family. She is studying at the university level. She chose this career path because of the wide variety of opportunities it can open up for her in the future.  In addition, she is also working as an administrative intern at a well-known business in her town. 

With the support from this loan, Jeniza plans to cover the cost of books, uniforms and study materials. She is grateful for this opportunity and the support she has received, and she plans to put her studies to good use by getting a job to support her family.

loans.use: to  cover the cost of books, uniforms  and study materials

loans.name: Ketty

texts.es: Ketty, de 36 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres. Ketty se dedica a la venta de plátanos. Tiene un puesto ubicado en uno de los mercados principales de su ciudad hasta donde se dirige todos los días luego de obtener los plátanos en los puertos del rio. Vende al menudeo o al por mayor. Ocasionalmente, dependiendo de la temporada ofrece a la venta yuca, limones, cocona y otros alimentos de origen animal como pescado seco y carnes de animales silvestres. Realiza esta actividad hace 3 años, lo hace con mayor énfasis cuando en la ciudad se celebra alguna festividad o acontecimiento importante; afortunadamente su trabajo le genera buenos ingresos económicos que le dan tranquilidad emocional. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener contacto con las personas, le da vitalidad y mucha energía estar en constante actividad física y sobre todo se siente feliz porque puede generar sus propios ingresos económicos para continuar solventado sus gastos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado racimos de plátano al por mayor para continuar trabajando en su puesto de ventas.
texts.en: Thirty-six-year-old Ketty is a single mother of two children who live with her at her parents' home.  Ketty sells bananas for a living.  She has a stand in one of the city's main markets where she goes every day after getting her bananas from the river ports.  She sells retail and wholesale.  Sometimes, depending on the season, she sells yucca, lemons, cocoa, and other animal products, such as dried fish and wild animal meat.  She has had this business for three years; she puts more effort into is when there is a holiday or important event in the city.  Fortunately, her work generates good income, which gives her emotional peace.  What she likes about her job is that it allows her to be in contact with people; being constantly physically active gives her vitality and a lot of energy and above all she is happy because she is able to generate her own income to keep paying for her expenses.  This time she is asking for 1,500 soles.  She is very happy to have received financial support that allows her to keep going and she promises to make her payments on time.  She will use the requested amount to buy bunches of bananas wholesale to keep working at her stand.

loans.use: to buy bananas wholesale

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, es una persona de hogar y vive con un primo, está soltera.  Ella, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz y frijol, asimismo vende chobananos y charamuscas, la agricultura la aprendió de sus padres y lo desempeña desde hace 3 años, cuenta con mozos para cultivar.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar semilla, abono, veneno, preparación  y pago de alquiler de terreno; esta inversión le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario para el cultivo y aprovechar el tiempo de invierno para obtener una mejor producción.
Su sueño es crecer como microempresario y agregar otro tipo de cultivo, construir su propia vivienda y crear su propia familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is a homebody and she lives with a cousin.  She is single.  She grows staple grains for a living, such as corn and beans, and she also sells frozen chocolate-covered bananas and frozen juice.  She learned to farm from her parents and she has been doing this work for three years.  She has laborers to help her harvest.

She needs this loan for seed, fertilizer, poison, preparation, and to pay rent on her land.  This investment will help her have everything she needs for her crop and to take advantage of the wintertime to get a better yield.

Her dream is to grow as a small businesswoman, to add another kind of crop, to build her own home, and to start a family.

loans.use: to pay for seed, fertilizer, poison, and preparation, and to pay rent on her land

loans.name: Ishdorj

texts.en: Mr. Ishdorj, 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for more than 15 years. Recently, due to an accident, he broke his arm and is now resting at home. His family income consists of diary products sales and taxi income as well as vegetables sales. The number of cattle he breeds increased to 23 from 20. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some serious repair. So he is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his house and be prepared for the upcoming harsh winter. The renovated house will protect the family against strong storms and frosts. They will even save money by reducing their coal consumption, which has a positive impact on the environment as fewer pollutants are released into air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who has proved hard work pays back.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El año pasado Carlos resembró nueva planta de café en una parte de su finca ya que está realizando la conversión de su producción de café convencional a café orgánico. Esta planta estará dando sus primeros frutos en dos años y es necesario tener muchos cuidados con ella para que se obtengan mejores resultados. Para poder seguir con su proyecto de renovación Carlos debe comprar más planta, preparar sus terrenos y comprar fertilizantes. Para llevar todo esto a cabo es necesario para él obtener nuevamente un financiamiento de Kiva el cual pagará al final de la cosecha.
texts.en: Last year Carlos resowed a new coffee plant on part of his land, as he is converting his coffee crops from conventional to organic.  This plant will bear its first fruits in two years and he has to take very good care of it so he will get the best results.  To keep up with his renovation project, Carlos needs to buy more plants, prepare his land, and buy fertilizers.  In order to do all of this he needs another Kiva loan, which he will repay after his harvest.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia is a 39-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has four young children. She raises pigs. Her husband is a construction worker. To be able to meet the family's daily needs, Claudia requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy three sacks of pig feed and three more pigs to augment her income and to expand her hog-raising activity. In the future, Claudia would like to expand her business to improve her livelihood and to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and pigs

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer. Her previous loan was a big help not just in her business but also in her family's everyday expenses. She has been in this business for four years now. She and her husband, who is a security guard, are working hand-in-hand to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jennifer dreams of expanding her business and having more items in her store. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her general store.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio, es un joven de 25 años habitante del barrio Laureles Norte, una zona marginal de Managua. Su esposa vela por el orden del hogar, juntos procrearon dos hijos los cuales estudian y espera poder terminar de darles sus estudios a los dos, con su trabajo como operador de compactadora en construcción. José Antonio solicita este crédito para hacer un cuarto en su casa, lo que le permitirá más espacio y comodidad para sus hijos, de esta manera ira poco  a poco mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda para la  mayor seguridad de la familia.
texts.en: José Antonio is a young man of 25 who lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood, a poor area of Managua.  His wife takes care of the household.  Together they have two children who are in school and he hopes to be able to pay for them both to finish their studies with his work in construction as a compacter operator.  José Antonio is asking for this loan to add a room to his home, which will give his children more space and comfort.  He will improve his home little by little this way so his family can be safer.

loans.use: to buy cement, cinder blocks, iron, sand, and corrugated sheet metal

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo prestamo porque requiere de mas capital de trabajo; este le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas necesarios tales como: semilla, abono, venenos, preparación de la tierra y pago de mozos; esta inversión le ayudara a tener una buena producción y generar más ingresos para el hogar.
Las condiciones economicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Marcos needs another loan because he needs more working capital; this will allow him to pay for farming supplies he needs, such as seed, fertilizer, poisons, land preparation, and labor.  This investment will help him have a good yield and generate more income for this household.  

His finances and his family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to pay for seed, fertilizer, poisons, land preparation, and labor

loans.name: Gabriela Lisbeth

texts.es:
Gabriela es una mujer de 29 años, madre de dos hijos de 6 y 2 años a quienes espera verlos crecer en las mejores condiciones de salud, educación y estabilidad, para esto se esfuerza cada día a pesar de las barreras que muchas personas le pongan por su falta de preparación, pues terminó la secundaria y se dedicó a trabajar. Ahora vive con sus hijos en La Concordia un cantón de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas que anteriormente pertenecía a la Provincia de Esmeraldas. Es considerado un cantón muy fuerte en la agroindustria y exportación de varios productos como palma africana, macadamia y palmito por lo cual un aproximado de más de 300 millones de dólares se mueven solo en este cantón. También el turismo es una fuente de economía, pues hay lugares que son visitados y los habitantes del pueblo aprovechan este movimiento para comercializar todo tipo de productos con negocios establecidos en cada rincón como restaurantes, tiendas, farmacias, almacenes de ropa, tours, etc.
Gabriela aprendió desde muy joven las labores del campo y se especializó en los cultivos de maracuyá y cacao, dos frutos que tienen alta demanda en la zona y son cultivados en muchos terrenos, pues el clima del lugar se presta para esta producción. Es por esto que desde hace 2 años Gabriela dedica al menos 6 horas cada día en la producción de cacao y maracuyá que posteriormente vende en el mercado de la zona o bajo pedidos de varios clientes. En medio de varias actividades complejas, Gabriela ha ganado mucha experiencia y necesita incrementar su producción, pues mientras sus hijos crecen ella debe incurrir en gastos mayores. 
Con el objetivo de aumentar cultivos y mejorar la calidad de los ya existentes, Gabriela solicita un préstamo para invertir en semillas y abono con lo cual aumentará la producción y por ende sus ganancias serán mayores, de esta forma podrá ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor estilo de vida y además podrá brindarles la educación que ella no pudo terminar y así hacer realidad su sueño de un día poder  verlos obteniendo su título profesional. 
En anteriores ocasiones, Gabriela no había podido acceder a los créditos de instituciones financieras, sin embargo gracias a Fundación Alternativa y su producto Kiva ha podido contar con el apoyo que ella tanto esperaba y por el cual agradece de antemano a aquellas personas que en varias partes del mundo se unen a sus sueños para hacerlos realidad.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 29 years old.  She is the mother of two children who are six and two whom she hopes to see grow up with the best health, education, and stability.  They are why she applies herself every day in spite of the barriers that many people put in front of her because of her lack of education, as she dropped out of secondary school and started working.  She currently lives with her children in La Concordia, a canton of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas that used to be part of the Esmeraldas Province.  It is known as a canton that is very big on agro-industry and the exportation of various produce, such as African oil palms, macadamias, and fan palms, which is why over 300 million dollars move through this canton alone.  Tourism is also a source of income, as there are areas that attract visitors and the locals take advantage of this to sell all kinds of products with businesses on every corner, such as restaurants, stores, pharmacies, clothing outlets, tours, etc.  

Gabriela learned to work in the fields as a very young girl and she specialized in passion fruit and cacao, two fruits that are in high demand in the area and which are grown on a lot of land, as the area's climate lends itself to these crops.  That is why for two years now Gabriela has spent at least six hours a day on her cacao and passion fruit crops, which she then sells at the local market or to customers who place orders.  Gabriela has gained a lot of experience through all of her complex activities and she needs to increase her yield, as her expenses will grow with her children.    

In order to expand her crops and improve the quality of the ones she has, Gabriela is asking for a loan to invest in seed and fertilizer with which to increase her harvest, which will in turn increase her profits.  This will allow her to offer her children a better way of life and the education that she was not able to finish.  This will make her dream of one day seeing them receive professional degrees come true.   

Previously, Gabriela did not have access to loans from financial institutions, but thanks to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva she has been able to count on the support that she hoped for so dearly.  She would like to give thanks in advance to the people in different parts of the world who take up the cause of her dreams to make them a reality.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for her passion fruit and cacao crops

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 34 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial, es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Juan no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ají de Gallina para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Juan trabaja como chofer en una empresa constructora de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos para la construcción de una habitación en la vivienda de sus padres, ya que actualmente su sala y cocina están todos juntos y solo cuenta con una habitación para todos, de esta manera Juan desea brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old, single, and lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial.  He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who puts all of his effort into getting his family ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and a need to work from a very young age, Juan was not able to pursue a professional degree.  In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and sometimes he makes a delicious ají de gallina chicken stew to share with his family.

Juan works as a chauffeur for a construction company in his city on his own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication .  He works every day for around 10 hours and he believes it is going well because of his skill and because of his good customer service.

Juan is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to the help they have offered that he will be able to pay for the construction of a new room in his parents' home because currently the living room and the kitchen are one room and there is only one bedroom for everyone.  In doing this Juan hopes to offer his family better safety and wellbeing.  He will keep working and applying himself to achieve his greatest dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a new room in his home.

loans.name: Claudia Arely

texts.es:
Claudia, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo prestamo, ya que el credito anterior fue mucha ayuda porque le sirvio para adquirir utensilios para el hogar y hoy este lo necesita para la elaboracion de pupusas para obtener ingresos; esta inversion le  permitirá comprar la materia prima necesaria tales como: carnes, quesillo, loroco, chicharrón, bolsas, aceite, servilletas,  papel plástico, gas, entre otros; esto le ayudara a brindarle un mejor servicio a los clientes y generar más ventas.
Las condiciones economicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Claudia needs a new loan.  Her previous loan was very helpful because it allowed her to buy household appliances and she now needs this one to make pupusas to make money.  This investment will allow her to buy the raw materials she needs, such as meat, cheese, loroco, pork rinds, bags, oil, napkins, paper, plastic, and gas, among other things.  This will help her offer her customers better service and generate more sales. 

Her financial situation and her family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy meat, cheese, loroco, pork rinds, bags, oil, napkins, paper, plastic, and gas, among other things

loans.name: Nieleniton Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe NIELENITON IV sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kolombada un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
