Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres de l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur huitième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Foune la première personne à droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0.5 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 50 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the Nieleniton IV group are married women with an average age of 34 years old and an average of three children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Kolombada, one of the villages of the commune of Guégnaka, in the prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region, which is Mali's second administrative region.

They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of organizing their businesses better at the start of the winter season. The crops they grow include groundnut, millet and beans. They are on their eighth loan from the institution.

With this loan, Foune, who is sitting on the far right of the photo, is planning to buy fertilizers and small materials and to pay for the labor costs of maintaining around 0.5 hectares of millet and groundnut.

Once it has been harvested, the produce is sold in the town of Fana, to a customer base made up of men and women. Foune expects to make roughly 50,000FCFA per season.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, seeds, fertilizers, hoeing and small materials.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira lives in Palayan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental with her husband and two children. She helps her husband to run a junk shop buying and selling recyclable materials in the town. She has been in this business for six years and it helps them a lot to sustain themselves. 

She borrowed 15,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase recyclable materials for sale. In the future, she hopes to see her children successful.

loans.use: to purchase recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Cooking different menus for meals is the daily routine of Tessie. She runs a restaurant business in front of Municipal Park. What she has now is the fruit of her patience and hard work with the help of her husband. Before she used to sell house-to-house but now she has her own stall in their community. 

Tessie has four helpers in her restaurant who serve as dishwashers and waitresses.

At her age, Tessie still wants to expand the business to get additional income. Tessie is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy meat and raw ingredients to use in preparing cooked foods. She will use the loan wisely and considers it as a big help for her and for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat and raw ingredients to use in preparing cooked foods.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 45 and is separated with three children in her custody. She runs a store selling goods in their community to earn a living. 

She borrowed 2,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to buy dried fish and bagoong (a condiment) to sell in addition to her inventory capital. 

She hopes to expand her business and able to support the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and bagoong to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is from the village of Sibula, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental and is running her own store selling goods in their community. She is married and has seven children. 

She borrowed 4,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which she joined two years ago, to buy sugar, canned goods and biscuits to sell. She planns to add more capital in order to gain more customers and generate more income for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy sugar, canned goods and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 46, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Lenato, a caretaker, and is a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
Marilyn operates a landscaping business. Not so many people have this kind of business but she chose this and her business is continuously growing.  She is being referred by her relatives, friends and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 35,000 in sales every month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to accessories and materials like lawn edging, brick, gravel and other materials. 

Marilyn hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of strength and good health for her whole family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for accessories and materials like lawn edging, brick, gravel and other materials.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace of Pob. 1, Oroquieta City is a single woman operating an internet cafe in town.  She also has refreshment services offered for her customers.  She borrowed a loan of 15,000.00 PHP from GDMPC micro credit in order to buy more computers to be used in the business.  She is looking forward to be able to have another branch of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more computer

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
This is Annalyn, 40, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines.  She is married to Marcos, a maintenance staff worker and they have children.  She and her husband manage their household while operating the business.  She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Annalyn operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg.  She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  She also sells processed food, mineral water and electronic loads.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 60,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business.  She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Thelma hopes that her business will continue to grow.  She dreams to have a vacation with her whole family.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina.  Her previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy more grocery items. The loan also helped in the education of her children as well as in their household expenditures.  She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.  The more items displayed at the store the better.  More items to sell will result in more profits.  Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Regina hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 50 and is married with four children living in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.  She helps her husband by raising pigs for sale in town.  She borrowed a loan of 20,000.00 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to buy more piglets to raise.  She planned to build a livestock's shelter to be used for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Afshan's Group

texts.en:
Afshan is is a 25 years old lady living with her spouse and one child in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is the only person who is providing financial support to his family as well as his old parents.

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for 6 years ago,  A few days ago he got into a road accident during driving,  Due to that accident his rickshaw's front screen has broken and he got some other damages too.  Now he needs to repair his rickshaw and get treatment for his injuries, so that he can become able to drive the rickshaw again.  

For this purpose he has insufficient amount to meet such expenses.  Therefore, Afshan decided to take a small loan from reputed organization BRAC Pakistan.  She hopes that through this loan her husband will maintain his auto rickshaw and drive the auto rickshaw smoothly again.  Afshan is very glad after taking this loan and assure us to payback the installments on due time.

Note: In the picture Afshan raise her hand.

loans.use: For medical expenses and the repair of the rickshaw after an accident.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, es una mujer de 41 años,  es madre soltera de 2 hijos y vive junto a ellos en su casa propia. Yolanda se dedica a la repostería, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, donde le enseñaron a elaborar deliciosas tortas y pasteles para eventos o fiestas de promoción escolar, bodas y demás acontecimientos sociales. Tiene un puesto de ventas instalado en un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad.  Su trabajo es artesanal, todo lo hace a mano. Por la creatividad que expresa en cada trabajo que realiza obtiene pedidos de sus clientes con mucha frecuencia es por eso que continúa actualizándose con nuevos diseños pues considera que siempre hay cosas nuevas que  aprender. Trabaja sola en este negocio desde hace 7 años. Le gusta  la repostería así como las manualidades y se siente a gusto con su oficio pues le ha proporcionado muchas satisfacciones como contar con los ingresos económicos necesarios para convertirse  en una próspera empresaria. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está segura que le irá bien por esto agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes tales como harina al por mayor, dulces y azúcar impalpable para continuar realizando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 41, is a single mother who lives with her two children in her own home.  Yolanda runs a bakery and learned the business at a professional training center where they taught her how to make delicious cakes and pies for events, school graduation parties, weddings and other social affairs.  She has a busy stall in the city market and makes all her products by hand.  Because of the creativity she expresses in all her work she always receives many orders.  Therefore she is constantly coming up with new designs because she believes it is important to learn new things.

She has been working alone in the business for seven years.  She enjoys baking and also likes working with crafts.  Her business has given her many satisfactions and allowed her to earn enough income to become a prosperous business woman.  

On this occasion she is requesting 1,000 PEN and is grateful for the financial support to continue to prosper.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time and will use it to buy ingredients such as flour, wholesale, and powdered sugar for her work.

loans.use: To buy flour wholesale, sweets and sugar.

loans.name: Nieleniton V Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe NIELENITON V sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kolombada un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur huitième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Mamou la deuxième personne à droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.5 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice  de 90 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Nieleniton V group are married women who have an average age of 34 years old and an average of three children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Kolombada, one of the villages in the municipality of Guégnaka, in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region, Mali's second administrative region.

They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of being able to organize their business activities better at the beginning of the winter season. The crops they grow include groundnut, millet and beans. They are on their eighth loan from the institution.

With this loan, Mamou, who is standing second from the right in the photo, is planning to buy fertilizers and small materials and also to cover labor costs for maintaining around 1.5 hectares of millet and groundnut.

Once harvested, the produce is sold in the town of Fana to a customer base made up of men and women. Mamou is expecting to make a profit of around 90,000FCFA per season.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, seeds, fertilizers, weed killer, hoeing and small materials.

loans.name: Nieleniton Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe NIELENITON VI sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kolombada un des villages de la commune de Guégnaka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres  l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur huitième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Oumou  la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.5 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice moyen de 95 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of the Nieleniton VI group are married women who have an average age of 33 years old and an average of three children each. The majority of them live in polygamous families in Kolombada, one of the villages in the municipality of Guégnaka, in the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region, Mali's second administrative region.

They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of being able to organize their business activities better at the beginning of the winter season. The crops they grow include groundnut, millet and beans. They are on their eighth loan from the institution.

With this loan, Oumou, who is sitting in the middle in the photo, is planning to buy fertilizers and small materials and also to cover labor costs for maintaining around 1.5 hectares of millet and groundnut.

Once harvested, the produce is sold in the town of Fana to a customer base made up of men and women. Oumou is expecting to make a profit of around 95,000FCFA per season.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizers, weed killer, hoeing and small materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora  Maria trabaja para una escuela publica primaria impartiendo clase desde hace mas de 15 años, actualmente esta realizando una mejora en su casa de habitación con el cambio de techo el que le dará una mejor condición de vida a ella y su familia, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para compra de materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Maria works for a public elementary school and has been teaching for over 15 years.  She is currently involved in renovating her house by changing the roof so her  family will have better living conditions.  Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting and beams.

loans.name: Danaya 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DANAYA 8  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  41 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide , le mil, le haricot et le riz avec  KARA AROUNA ,  2 eme de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1.5  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo et Bougouni,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 125.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya 8 group are married women who have an average age of 41 years old and an average of five children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bladiè, one of the villages in Bougouni, Mali's third administrative region.

They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with the aim of being able to run their farming businesses successfully during the winter season. They are on their tenth loan from the institution and the previous loans have all been repaid in full.

Kara Arouna, who is the second from the right in the photo, grows groundnut, millet and rice. 

With this loan, she is planning to buy fertilizers and seeds and also to cover labor costs to farm around 1.5 hectares.

Once harvested, the produce is sold in the villages of Garalo and Bougouni to a customer base made up of men and women. Kara Arouna is expecting to make a profit of around 125,000FCFA per season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help her husband out with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and seeds, and to pay plowing expenses for the farming season.

loans.name: Miujiza Group

texts.fr: La cliente Christina est vice présidente du groupe d’affaire « Miujiza», doyenne, entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 59 ans, veuve et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs propres familles. Son conjoint fut inopinément décédé. La cliente est vendeuse de Farine de manioc. Elle est propriétaire d’un entrepôt de farine de manioc. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de ses enfants.  Il y a environ 5 ans. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 15 sacs de Farine de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise et acheter une parcelle pour ses jeunes enfants. Les taxes multiples constituent un défi pour son entreprise.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs.
texts.en: The customer, Christina, is the vice-president of the Miujiza business group. She is the eldest in the group and an experienced entrepreneur, who is 59 years old, a widow and mother to six children, some of whom are studying and others who have their own families. Her husband died unexpectedly. The customer sells cassava flour and is the owner of a cassava flour warehouse.She began her business with her own capital which she was given by her children around five years ago.This new loan will be used to buy 15 sacks of cassava flower. She would thereby like to expand her company and buy a plot of land for her young children. The multitude of taxes are a real challenge for her company. Finally, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for its support in the form of micro-loans for small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of cassava flour.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposo y su pequeño hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, Maria no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Maria trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de cosecha, sembrado, riego y otro, Maria trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Maria se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para cercar la parte trasera de su vivienda y también para poner piso de concreto en su hogar, de esta manera Maria brindará mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño tener una pequeña parcela donde sembrar pecanas para su venta.
texts.en:
Maria, 20, lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago, with her husband and small son.  She loves them very much and they are the main motivation in her life.  Maria is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who makes every effort, together with her husband, to provide for the family.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of economic resources and due to the need to work, Maria was unable to get a nursing degree as she would have liked.  In her free time she enjoys watching television and sometimes makes delicious pork cracklings to share with the family.

On her own initiative and with much hard work and dedication, Maria works as a hired hand on a farm in her city.  She carries out jobs such as harvesting, planting, irrigation and other tasks.  She works around eight hours a day, every day, and believes things are going well for her because of her dedication and kindness to others.

Maria is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to renovate her home.  She wants to buy construction materials to put up a fence in the backyard and also put down a concrete floor inside the house.  This will give Maria's family more security and well-being, and will allow her to continue working and striving toward her goal of having a small patch of land where she can grow pecans to sell.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Bulgan

texts.en: Mrs. Bulgan, 33 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running an automobile spare parts sales business since 2009 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience. Her husband drives a truck at a mining company. Her twelve and eight year old daughters both go to school. She is requesting a loan of 4150000 MNT to purchase spare parts such as bumpers, brake discs, air ducts and calipers. With this loan, she can continue to sell spare parts without worrying about inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who wants her daughters to get a good education.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en:
Mr. Batsuuri, 35 years old, lives with his family in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. The family has recently built a house on a plot of land. But due to the lack of finances, some of the interior and door parts remain unfinished. So Batsuuri is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, planks, cements and metals. 

He wants to install a high quality door into the house and build a barn next to the house. Building the barn will reduce heat loss through door parts, and the high quality house will greatly improve his family's living standards. 

More importantly, the family will begin to burn less coal for heating, thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution by releasing fewer pollutants into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who is striving for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran is 47 years old, married, and he has a 4 children. His wife is a housewife. Imran is a popular merchant in his home town, because his shop is situated in the center of town. It is already 10 years he is selling food products. From this business his profit is about 150 AZN a month. He sells food products such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages in his shop. His son also helps him in this business.  

The profit he gains is not enough to reinvest into his business to cover his customers` demands, so he is suffering for this reason. His shop being the family's main source of income, his profit is used for their needs. Imran would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for 1,900 AZN. He will purchase additional food stuff and diversify. This will be his 4th loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy food products in order to expand his business.

loans.name: Corina

texts.en: Corina is a 21-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 2 young children. She is engaged in seaweed farming. She grows cultured seaweeds. Together with her husband, they work hand in hand to earn a living. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more seaweeds and lift weights to increase production and yield a better income. In the future, Corina would like to expand her seaweed farming to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy more seaweeds and lift weights

loans.name: Joyfe

texts.en: Joyfe is a  student at the  University in Ozamiz City. She lives in Molatuhan Alto, Misamis Occidental with her family. Her father is a farmer, and his earnings are not enough to support Joyfe's higher education costs because of her younger brothers’ need for support, too. All these hindrances did not stop her from pursuing her dream. She joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay school tuition fees. She dreams of being able to finish her studies and work for a bright future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
This is Aurora. Her previous loan was a big help in her pineapple farming business. The loan also helped in her household expenditures. She also sells chicken for additional income. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP (Philippine peso) loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her business. Her profits from his business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aurora hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her business.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en:
Dong, 50 years old, is married and has one child. She supports the family through the income she earns from selling clothes. She has been in this business for ten years. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Dong intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes. This buying will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes for selling.

loans.name: Negmatillo

texts.ru: Негматилло 52 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Детям 8 и 13 лет. Негматилло более 14 лет работает в заводе по разработки металлургии. Он работает заведующий складом. Негматилло как честный и порядочный человек имеет хорошую репутацию в коллективе. Он живет вместе семьей в старом доме и их дом не имеет условия для жилья. Несколько лет назад он начал строительство новых дополнительных комнат в своем участке, но так как он имеет маленькую зарплату, и живут они бедно, не может достроить этот новый дом. До зимы он должен достроить дом, так как в старом доме, невозможно жить зимой. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как песок, цемент, древесина и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Negmatillo is 52, married, and is raising two children, aged 8 and 13. FOr more than 14 years, Negmatillo has been working as a warehouse manager in a metal processing plant. An honest and organized person, he is well regarded in the collective. He lives together with his family in an old house that is in very poor condition. Several years ago he started to build a new house on his lot with more rooms, but he cannot complete it because his pay is low and they are poor. He needs to finish the house before winter, because the old house is unlivable in the winter. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2500 somoni to buy building materials such as sand, cement, lumber, etc. He awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials as cement, wood, sand and etc. for building a new house

loans.name: Cronelyn

texts.en:
Cronelyn is 18 and is studying in the university here in Misamis Occidental. She borrowed an amount of 10,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) from GDMPC to pay the costs of tuition fees and study materials. 
Cronelyn is always focused on her studies because she wants to help her parents and aside from that, is also hoping to work in a company in town or abroad if given a chance.  This will provide for more comfortable and better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to pay the costs of tuition fees and study materials

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc is 55 years old and married with five children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns an income by sewing. Duc has been working on mending the punctures of auto tires and selling auto tires for 31 years.

He intends to take a loan to gradually expand his business by buying auto tires for selling to meet his current customers' needs and to attract more new customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy auto tires to sell to meet his current customers' needs and to attract more new customers.

loans.name: Shehzadan

texts.en:
Shehzadan is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been actively involved in the business of milk sales for many years.  She has five calves and  two cows in milk. She milks cows and then sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese. She has three children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

Shehzadan has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. She requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc is 59 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a mason. She has been running a general store for five years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Cuc is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of food products, such as cooking oils, milk and rice to stock her general store.

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of food products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a metal door.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
This is Yolanda. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP (Philippine peso) loan that she used to purchase hogs and feed needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold, and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional hogs and feed needed for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Yolanda is very thankful to God for giving her joy and strength. It is her prayer that her children will always be in good health and that God will always guide them. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Lang, 59, is widowed and has five children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income by selling noodles to people in her community. She started her business 20 years ago.

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying cooking appliances that will enable her to better serve her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and her children's education.

loans.use: To buy cooking appliances to better serve her customers.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 35 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a driver. She has been running a general store for 8 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Nga is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of food products, such as cooking oils, snacks and confectionery to stock her store. That will allow her to attract more customers.

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of food products, such as cooking oils, snacks and confectionery to stock her store.

loans.name: Angelino

texts.es: Durante la cosecha pasada Angelino renovó parte de su finca de café pues había plantas que tenían muchos años y ya no producían mucho café. Para poder llevar esto a cabo Angelino solicitó un crédito de Kiva, con el cual le fue más sencillo hacer todo esto. También le fue muy bien este año con su cosecha de limón pues se estuvo pagando a buen precio. Para este año Angelino necesita comprar fertilizante para su finca y de esta manera pueda aumentar su producción de café.
texts.en:
During the past season, Angelino revitalized part of his coffee farm since he had plants that were many years old and were no longer producing much coffee. In order to accomplish his goal, Angelino requested a Kiva loan and the money helped to make his job easier. He also did very well with his lemon crop this year since he was paid a good price.

For this season, Angelino needs to buy fertilizers for his farm so that he can increase his coffee production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 57-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been in the business of popcorn sales with the support of her husband for three years. Her husband purchases a large quantity of popcorn in different flavors from wholesale markets, and then Sakina sells it to the people of her community at reasonable prices. She earns enough to lead a decent life. She serves well in her community and wants to grow her business. 

She requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy more stock of popcorn in different flavors to increase her sales. She is in her fourth loan cycle with Kashf foundation. She wishes to spend a part of her profits on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy more stock of popcorn in different flavors.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a very hard working lady who lives with her husband and three children. She is happily running a small general store at the corner of her house with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who purchases grocery items from the wholesale market then they sell them to the people of their community. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet the expenses of the family members. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Homida

texts.ru: Хомида трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 60 лет. Она замужем и имеет 1 ребенка. Ее муж занимается скотоводством. Хомида с юных лет научилась шить национальный мужской зимний халат «чапан». Она имеет очень умелые руки. Она шьёт очень аккуратно и имеет своих клиентов на рынке, где она реализует свою продукцию. Она хочет улучшить условию проживания, путём заработки больше денег. Она хочет купить абрикосовый сад и переработать абрикосы. Она будет продавать разработанные абрикосы, то есть «курага» на местном рынке. Ее муж будет помогать ей введению нового бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки абрикосового сада. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ей найти нового источника дохода.
texts.en: Khomida is a hardworking woman of 60, married and with one child. Her husband raises livestock. Khomida learned to sew traditional Tajik men's "chapan" robes when she was young. She is very skilled with her hands. She sews precisely and has her own customers at the market where she sells her creations. She wants to improve their living conditions by earning more money by renting garden space and growing and processing apricots. She will then sell the dried apricots ("kuraga") at the local market. Her husband will help her run the new business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy an orchard's worth of apricot trees. She awaits your kind assistance. This loan will help her obtain a new source of income.

loans.use: To buy an orchard's worth of apricot trees

loans.name: Germae

texts.en:
Germae is 17 and living with her family in Tipan, Oroquieta City. She studies information technology for the purpose of working abroad if given the chance so that she will have a bright future and be able to support her parents when they get old. 
Despite having a crisis financially she will never surrender and plans to survive in this life. She hopes to finish her studies to be able to have a better living condition in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and study materials

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en: Ngoc is requesting a new loan to buy wood materials for making wooden furniture and other wooden products to sell from her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood materials for making wooden furniture and other wooden products to sell.

loans.name: Irinea

texts.es: La cosecha que tuvo Irinea este año aumentó en comparación a la del año pasado pues gracias a un crédito obtenido por Kiva pudo comprar fertilizantes, preparar su parcela y reparar una manguera que utilizan para extraer agua de una represa que hay en su terreno. El café que Irinea produce es en su totalidad orgánico y para esta cosecha necesita comprar más fertilizante y realizar algunas labores de limpieza en su finca. Para llevar esto a cabo necesita nuevamente de un crédito de Kiva el cual pagará al final de la cosecha.
texts.en: The harvesting season that Irinea had this year grew in comparison with the last and thanks to a credit she obtained with Kiva she was able to buy fertilizers to prepare her fields and repair a hose that she uses to extract water from a reservoir on her property. The coffee that Irinea makes is completely organic and, for the coming, harvest she needs to purchase more fertilizers and complete some other work to clean up her farm. In order to do this, she needs a new credit with Kiva, that she will repay at the end of the season.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and clean up her farm.

loans.name: Angel Jesus

texts.es:
Angel es un hombre de 33 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a su familia, Angel no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Pedagogía que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Angel trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el realiza labores de cosecha, sembrado, riego y otro, Angel trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Angel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual desea poder utilizar ya que en poco tiempo iniciará estudios de computación y necesita mejorar sus métodos de estudios, asa pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia negocio comercial.
texts.en:
Angel is a 33-year-old man, is single, and lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona.  He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person, and he dedicates all of his efforts towards moving himself ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need for him to work from a very young age to help the family, Angel was not able to study the pedagogy career that he desired.  In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends.  Sometimes, he makes a very delicious chicken and rice dish to share with his family.

Through his own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Angela now works as a farmer on an agricultural property in his city.  He performs tasks like harvesting, planting, watering, etc.  He works every day for approximately eight hours and believes that everything is going well thanks to his performance and the kindness that he shows others.

Angel is very thankful for the Kiva loaners.  Thanks to their support, he will be able to buy a computer, which he hopes to be able to use as he begins his studies in computing; he needs to improve his study methods.  He will also continue working and making an effort so that he can realize his greatest dream, which is to have his own commercial business.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Nestor Adan

texts.es: El Señor  Nestor trabaja para una escuela publica desde hace mas 7 años como bibliotecario, actualmente esta cursando una carrera técnica el cual le ayudara a tener mejor oportunidad de superación e ingresos salarial para seguir apoyando a su familia y salir adelante, solicita a ceprodel un crédito para solventar estos gastos y poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en: Nestor has worked for a public school for 7 years as a librarian and he is currently taking a course in a technical career, which will help give him a better chance to earn more money and continue to support his family as well as to get ahead. He is asking CEPRODEL for a credit that he will invest in the costs associated with this and to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: pay fees and for stationery for techincal studies.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 48 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей. Образование-высшее, работает преподавателем в местной школе. После смерти мужа, в поисках дополнительных доходов для своей семьи решила заняться полеводством и животноводством. Бизнес начала с 12 000 сом (KGS), купив на эти деньги 3 овцы. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе Гулмира увеличила поголовье своего скота в хозяйстве и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулмиры имеется: 2 дойные коровы и 4 теленка. Также в наличии имеет 2,72 ГА земельного надела на обработку и посадку фасоли. Гулмира оказалась выносливой и терпеливой и после смерти мужа сама обеспечивает свою семью. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Гулмира  планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего небольшого хозяйства и в будущем хочет собрать денежные средства на свадьбу старшего сына.
texts.en: Gulmira is 48, divorced and the mother of 4. She has a college degree, and teaches at the local school. After her husband died, she looked for new sources of income and decided get into farming and animal husbandry. She started the business with 12,000 som (KGS), and used this money to buy 3 sheep. Thanks to her backbreaking efforts and productive work, Gulmira increased her farm's animal herd and began to earn a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS). Today Gulmira's farm has 2 dairy cows and 4 calves. She also has 2.72 hectares of land planted in beans. Gulmira has turned out to be both hardy and patient, and after the death of her husband, she has been providing for her family all by herself. WIth the goal of expanding her farm business, Gulmira has turned to the Bai Tushum & Partners Microloan bank for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy young bulls for fattening and later resale. Gulmira plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into further expanding her small farm business and in the future wants to save money for her oldest son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy young bulls for fattening and resale

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: Con un crédito de Kiva José Luis pudo comprar planta de café y fertilizantes para renovar su finca durante la cosecha pasada. La planta que sembró estará dando frutos dentro de tres años y con esto aumentará su cosecha y sus ingresos. Para esta cosecha José Luis necesita de otro financiamiento por parte de Kiva ya que nuevamente comprará fertilizante y también utilizará parte de ese dinero para el pago de trabajadores que lo ayuden a hacer algunas actividades en su parcela. Con las ganancias que obtenga el final de la cosecha José Luis pagará este crédito.
texts.en:
With a Kiva loan José Luis was able to buy coffee plants and fertilizer to revitalize his farm during the previous harvest. The plants that he planted will bear fruit within three years, increasing his harvests and his income. 

For this harvest José Luis needs another Kiva loan to buy fertilizer again. He will also use a portion of the money to pay workers who help him carry out some activities on the farm. 

José Luis will repay this loan with his earnings from the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay day labourers.

loans.name: Gleidys Jazmín

texts.es: Gleidys Jazmín es una mujer de 27 años de edad, madre de un hijo de 8 años y vive en unión libre con su pareja actual. Desde hace 6 años comenzó a vender mercancía por catálogos (perfumería, accesorios, ropa), actividad que alterna con el servicio de arreglo de uñas (manicure y pedicure) a domicilio. Es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, día a día se esfuerza para generar ingresos para su hogar, laborando arduas jornadas y haciendo los domicilios en bicicleta.  Con el crédito que solicita desea adquirir una moto y comprar más surtido de productos e insumos (accesorios, ropa, acolchados para camas, esmaltes para uñas, limas, entre otros), con el objetivo de facilitar su movilización, realizar los domicilios de manera ágil y oportuna y, tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a los clientes; de esta forma incrementará  sus ventas y podrá mejorar el nivel de ingresos. Su principal sueño es montar un gran almacén de variedades, que le permita pasar más tiempo con su pequeño hijo y brindarle un mejor bienestar en el futuro.
texts.en:
Gleidys Jazmín is a 27-year-old woman, and is the mother of an 8-year-old boy.  She lives in a common-law marriage with her partner.  Six years ago, she began to sell merchandise through catalogs (perfume, accessories, clothing), an activity that she alternates with a home nail service (manicure and pedicure).  

She is an enterprising and hardworking person.  Day to day, she works in order to generate an income for her home, working arduous days and doing the home visits by bicycle.  With the loan that she requests, she hopes to purchase a motorbike and to buy more assorted products and materials, like accessories, clothing, sheets for beds, nail polish, nail files, and other items.  

In this way, she will grow her sales and will be able to reach a new level of income.  Her greatest dream is to have a large variety store.  This would allow her to spend more time with her young son and to offer him a better well-being in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike and to buy assorted products and materials (accessories, clothing, sheets for beds, nail polish, nail files, and others).

loans.name: Danaya B Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  DANAYA B  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Bladiè, un des villages de Bougouni, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide et le riz avec  MAKEME ,  1 ere assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour exploiter  1  hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Garalo,  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Danaya B Group are married women who average 39 years of age and 4 children. They all live in polygamous families in Bladiè, one of the villages in Bougouni, third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their fourth loan from the MFI. The previous loans were repaid without problems.

Makeme (first woman on the right in the sitting row) is growing peanuts and rice. With her loan, she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to farm 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and in Garalo, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She intends to turn a profit of XOF 100'000 (ca US$ 200) per planting, which will enable her to repay the loan, and also help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is 41 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a sailor. For the past seven years, Ha has been making clothing to sell. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ha is requesting a loan to buy greater quantities of material such as threads, cloth, and accessories to make clothing to sell. She hopes that her loan will help her to expand her business. In the future, Ha hopes to have money to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy threads, cloth, and accessories to make clothing to sell

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is 28 years old and married with one daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past seven years, Tam and his wife have been working as painters. 

Tam is requesting a loan to gradually expand his business by buying wood frames and painting materials for his business. He will use his loan to meet current customer need and attract more new customers. Tam hopes that his business runs smoothly and he will be able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood frames and painting materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is from Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married and has three children. 

To make a living, Grace owns and operates a general store. She's been engaged in her business for many years. 

In 2008, Grace joined GDMPC. Grace is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like dried fish, rice and corn grits for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like dried fish, rice and corn grits for sale.

loans.name: Ulfat

texts.en:
Ulfat is a 51-year-old married woman with two children. For the past 15 years, she has been successfully running a small general store with her husband nearby their house. Ulfat's husband assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market. He has maintained many contacts over the years. Ulfat is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Ulfat is requesting a 35,000 PKR loan to buy more stock of grains, biscuits, candies, and beverages. In this way, she will be able to consistently meet increasing demand and expand her business. Ulfat wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy grains, biscuits, candies, and beverages

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 36-year-old married woman who is the mother of six children. For many years, she has been selling and purchasing animals with the support of her husband. Mumtaz buys baby goats and cows at low prices, brings them up, and then her husband sells them in the market at a higher price. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation and has a good loan repayment history.

Mumtaz is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan to purchase one more goat. This will be her second loan. Mumtaz hopes to grow her business and she dreams that she will be able to provide good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more goat

loans.name: Dani

texts.en:
After he graduated from high school, Dani did not go to school, but worked to help his parents. His parents work as part-time teachers in a private school. Their income is very minimal, just enough to live from day-to-day as a family. 

Dani is now 22 years old. He is a man who has a passion to continue to develop his capabilities. He is now getting ready to study at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara, and he has chosen the Teknika program. Dani wants to be a professional technician on a ship. 

With expectations of his parents, Dani can finish his study and quickly get the job he wants. Dani wants to make his parents happy, and he wants to help his parents as much as possible. 

Dani applied for a loan from Kiva to help him pay for his learning and cover all the needs of college. Dani is very grateful to the lenders. The loan may be useful for him and to make his parents happy.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is 42 years old and married without kids. She lives with her husband in a city.  For the past eight  years, Tarana has run an interesting business selling toys with the help of her husband. Her business gives her the joy of seeing happy little kids. Tarana opened a store on her plot of land last year to serve customers in her neighborhood and she is satisfied with her business and income. She has borrowed previously from Aqroinvest and has a good repayment history.

Tarana is requesting a loan of 1800 AZN for medical purposes as she wants to be a mother one day. This will be her sixth loan. Tarana thanks Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: to go under medical treatment as she wants to be a mother one day

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 40 years old and a mother of one child. She lives with her husband in Sibarok, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

She has a vegetable garden as their main source of income. She helps her husband to operate it. In order to buy seedlings and fertilizer such as manure, she is borrowing an amount of 20,000 PHP. She plans to cultivate the vacant lot near her garden to gain more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy assorted seedlings and fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie lives in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She earns a living by providing transportation services. She has been doing this for many years so as to support the needs of her three children. For a 29-year-old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy except to see her children successful in their studies.

She plans to improve her business and provide her children a better living condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a 25-year-old hardworking man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

His main business is selling party and burial flowers, alongside farming. He started these businesses with a vision of earning an income for his family.

He faces challenges of limited capital, but he has a vision of constructing a better house and becoming a well known florist in the area.

Ronald is requesting a loan to buy flowers to sell.

loans.use: to buy flowers to sell.

loans.name: Iwan

texts.en:
Iwan is a prospective student at Nusantara Maritime Academy (AMN) who wishes to study marine engineering. 

Iwan lives on the coast of Java, precisely in the east of the city of Cilacap. Iwan has just graduated from high school and wants to continue his studies in AMN. He hopes to complete the program of study, but he has concerns about the cost of these studies. 

Iwan's parents work as regular employees, but their salary is only able to meet their daily needs, and that makes it difficult to finance his studies. Iwan wants to work on a ship as a ship professional. This is a dream from long ago, since he lives on the coast. However, Iwan also does not want to bother his parents, because the parents have to pay for her sister's schooling. 

Iwan wants a loan from Kiva to help pay for college, so that he can complete his studies, get a job faster, and help the economy of his parents.

loans.use: To pay education fees for three years.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is married and a mother of one school-age child. She is 27 years old and lives in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Ginalyn is a farmer. She grows different kinds of fruits and vegetables like peaches, beans and cucumbers. She has been doing this for five years.

Aside from farming, she also raises pigs for sale. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit in order to buy feeds. She plans to build a shelter for her pigs and use it for expansion.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Jose Leodan

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 30 años, soltero y creció en un hogar con escasos recursos económicos, por lo cual tuvo que trabajar desde muy chico para ayudar con los gastos de su casa, por lo cual solo pudo terminar la escuela primaria y con esos conocimientos defenderse en las varias actividades en las cuales emprendió.  Actualmente vive en la parroquia de Río Verde de Santo Domingo, la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una ciudad que cuenta un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Sus varios atractivos turísticos acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial o de servicios para habitantes y turistas.
Luego de una larga trayectoria como comerciante, José decidió emprender en la labor que había aprendido como profesión que es la herrería, la cual la realiza desde hace 7 años, es un trabajo que le gusta mucho pues al ver que nadie daría uso a metales viejos que para muchas personas no son más que chatarra, José los somete al fuego y con su creatividad fabrica piezas que sirven como implementos de decoración de hogares. José se siente muy orgulloso cuando uno de sus trabajos terminado y le motiva a seguir creciendo. Sin embargo, como en todo trabajo, hay un riesgo de salud por los residuos de metal que se expulsan y los cambios de temperatura a los que se somete, es por esto que José hace algún tiempo atrás sufrió un accidente que lo imposibilitó de trabajar durante varios meses, pero al recuperarse empezó con nuevas motivaciones. Su sueño es establecer un almacén en donde pueda vender las piezas fabricadas por sus propias manos y la lucha por ese sueño, comenzará con un crédito que solicita el cual lo invertirá en la adquisición de metal, chatarra y herramientas que le servirán para incrementar su producción y así poder ampliar su cartera de clientes. Éste es un paso que lo acercará cada vez más al cumplimiento de su sueño. José agradece a Fundación Alternativa por abrirle las puertas para crecer con su emprendimiento y además por creer en los sueños de las personas del sector rural. También agradece a los inversionistas de Kiva en todo el mundo por su aporte que simbolizan pasos para el desarrollo de los países.
texts.en:
José is a 30-year-old man. He is single and grew up in a home with few economic resources, so he had to start working at a very young age in order to help with the household costs. Because of this, he was only able to finish elementary school and has had to get by with this limited education in the various jobs he has taken on. He currently lives in the Rio Verde de Santo Domingo parish, the capital of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city that has considerable business enterprises because it has become a place of exchange between the coast and the highlands. The several tourist attractions, as well as the hot climate, are a major draw for tourists from Ecuador and around the world. The majority of the residents have some sort of business enterprise or provide services for residents and tourists.
After a long career in business, José decided to start a business doing what he had learned to do as a career: to be a blacksmith. He has done this work for seven years now. He loves his job. Seeing that no one uses old metal that is nothing more than scrap for many people, José puts it into the fire and uses his creativity to create pieces that serve to decorate homes. He is very proud of his finished pieces, and this motivates him to continue expanding his business. However, as in all jobs, there is a health risk because of the metal residues he is exposed to, and because of the temperature changes. Because of this, some time ago José suffered an accident that made it impossible for him to work for several months. However, once he recovered, he started again with new motivations.
His dream is to establish a store where he will be able to sell pieces he has made with his own hands. He is working hard to reach this dream. He will start with this loan, which he will invest in the purchase of metal, scraps, and tools which will allow him to increase production and thus expand his clientele. This step will get him closer to his dream. José is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa for opening its doors to him so that he can expand his business, and also for believing in the dreams of people in rural areas. He also thanks the Kiva lenders all over the world for their contribution to countries' development.

loans.use: to buy used metal and materials for making new pieces.

loans.name: Fouzai

texts.en:
Fouzai is a 39-year-old, married woman and mother of two children. 

Five years ago, she started her own business of clothes sales when her husband became severely ill. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation, upon the advice of her neighbor, to initiate her own business. 

She buys clothes of different designs from the market, in bulk and at lower rates, then sells them in her community at reasonable prices. She has a good client list and manages her household expenses through her business. 

She has gradually improved her business and has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy an ample variety of clothes in different colors and designs to increase her sales. She wishes to use the earned revenue on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of clothes in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is 41 years old, married, and the father of one daughter. 

Elshan is a well known fruit seller in his town. He has dedicated 10 years of his life to this activity. Elshan says, "I love my business because it is my only source of income.” 

He has a need to expand his business by buying fruit trees and getting more lands for cultivation so that he can get his daughter married. Now his first goal is the fruit business, from which he takes care of the financial needs of his family.

Now it is summer time and he needs more variety of fruits because of increasing demand. He needs a 1,800 AZN loan in order to bring in more fruit stock. He has a good loan history and this is his fifth loan. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to bring in more fruit stock for the summer.

loans.name: Agblegno-Ekpui-Kpolozimé-Vogan Group

texts.fr: Monsieur  Kodjovi est agriculteur.  Âgé de 51 ans, il est marié et a à sa charge 10 enfants dont la moitié est scolarisée. Il a déjà obtenu un prêt chez WAGES. Cet homme est à la tête d’une entreprise de 6 salariés. Il espère diversifier son activité avec ce crédit. En effet, il compte acquérir de nouvelles terres. De plus, il compte acheter une quantité important de palmier pour augmenter sa production de sodabi. Son projet a ensuite pour but d’améliorer le quotidien de sa famille, de pouvoir assurer une scolarité à ses enfants. Monsieur Kodjovi est le responsable du groupe GP AGBLEGNO – Ekpui –Kpolozimé – VOGAN. Les onze autres membres du groupe sont pratiquement à l’image de leur responsable, avec les mêmes objectifs et des montants de prêts presque égaux. Ces agriculteurs espèrent bénéficier au maximum de l’opportunité offerte par WAGES.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjovi, age51, is a farmer. He's married and has ten children to support, half of whom go to school. He already obtained a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES. He runs a six-employee company. Thanks to this loan, he hopes to diversify his business.

Indeed, he intends to acquire new land. Furthermore, he intends to buy a large quantity of palm trees, in order to increase his "sodabi" production (sodabi is an alcoholic beverage made out of palm tree sap). His project's goal is then to improve the daily life of his family, and ensure his children receive and education.

Mr. Kodjovi is responsible for Agblegno – Ekpui –Kpolozimé – Vogan Group. The elven other members are just like their leader. They share the same goals and each will receive an almost equal share of the loan.

These farmers hope to get the most of the opportunity provided by WAGES.

loans.use: to buy farm input

loans.name: Reyna Celina

texts.es: La Señora Reyna trabaja para una escuela publica de primaria desde hace mas de 7 años como maestra con niños desde 7 - 9 años, actualmente esta cursando una carrera técnica la que le servirá de mucho beneficio para ella y su familia ya que tendrá mejor oportunidad de ingreso y superación,solicita  a ceprodel un crédito para el pago de esos gastos.
texts.en: Señora Reyna has worked for a public elementary school for over seven years as a teacher of children ages 7-9. She is currently taking a technical degree that will be of great benefit to her and to her family, since she will have better career and earning potential. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to pay these costs.

loans.use: to pay diploma processing and fees.

loans.name: Violeta Silvia

texts.es: La Señora violeta trabaja para una escuela publica como maestra desde hace mas de 15 años, actualmente le están realizando una mejora en su casa de habitación elaborando una pared perimetral para obtener mayor seguridad y bienestar de ella y su familia, solicita a ceprodel un crédito para realizar esa mejora.
texts.en: Señora Violeta has worked for a public school as a teacher for over 15 years. Repairs are currently being made to her home. A wall is being built around the perimeter for better security and for her family's well-being. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to make this improvement.

loans.use: to buy bricks for a wall.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is 32-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children, two daughters and one son. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health care. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant, but his income is insufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute to the family income. She has been in the business of sewing for a period of about four years. She is quite familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation, when she took out her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy a stock of thread in various colors, as well as some packets of buttons, ribbons and zippers. Then she will be able to meet the demand from her customers without fail.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in various colors, together with some packets of buttons, ribbons and zippers.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 37-year-old married woman, the mother of four children. She has been actively involved in the business of selling clothes for the past eight years. She buys a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her community at reasonable prices. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. She wants to grow her business and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her increased sales. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different colors and designs for resale.

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en: Kiran is a 27-year-old married woman; the mother of three children. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is her husband. They offer a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and have retained many customers who regularly shop at their store. Kiran makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower prices. In this way, she will be able to meet increasing demand consistently. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour for her store from the market at lower prices.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en: At the age of 25, Ayesha is an enthusiastic single lady. She had been actively running her own beauty parlor in her community to support her entire family for many years. She offers quality services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her providing the best service, she has become very famous in her street and has built up a good customer list. She wants to expand her business to meet the increasing demand from her customers but, due to a shortage of funds, she is unable to fill the needs of her customers. For this reason she applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams  in large quantities for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 48-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has six young children. Her husband's income as  a tricycle driver is not enough for the family's daily needs.

She engages in a food-vending business. She sells homemade fried chicken to customers in the community. She has been selling fried chicken for almost three years now. Zenaida requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy  seasonings and chicken so that she can continue to serve her customers and also augment her income. 

In the future, Zenaida would like to expand her business to become a successful businesswoman while providing her children with good food and high-quality educations.

loans.use: to buy seasonings and chicken .

loans.name: Koser

texts.en:
Koser is a 31-year-old, married woman. She is a motivated mother of three children and she is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, clothing, and health. 

Koser has been running a small beauty parlor in her house to contribute to her family's income. She offers many efficient services to her customers, such as facials, haircuts, and makeup. 

Her business is at an initial stage and she wants to expand her business to meet the increasing demands. For this reason, she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy in large quantities more hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening. 

Koser is in her third loan cycle with a good loan history. With the help of the loan, she will not only purchase a variety of products, but will also be able to meet her household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy in large quantities more hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening.

loans.name: Pierina Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Pierina trabaja para un instituto publico rural como maestra desde hace mas 5 años brindando clase a adolecentes entre las edades de 14 - 17 años, actualmente esta culminando una carrera tecnica donde le brindara mayores posibilidades de vida en lo laboral y salarial siendo beneficiada su familia y ella,solicta  a ceprodel un credito para cancelar y tramitar arancel y titulo.
texts.en: Señora Pierina has worked for a public institution as a teacher for over five years offering classes for adolescents ages 14-17. She is currently finishing a technical degree which will provide her with better career and salary opportunities. This will be beneficial to her and to her family. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to pay tuition and degree fees.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and degree fees.

loans.name: Bernadetha

texts.en: Bernadetha is married and has five school-aged children. She lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To make a living, she cooks snacks and offers refreshments for sale in a school canteen, and she sells some in their community. She has been doing this more many years. She borrowed 5,700 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to buy ingredients. She hopes to see her children successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make snacks for sale in a school canteen.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia had a difficult time after the failure of her husband’s business. Eight years ago, she started sewing clothes to support her entire family.
